US Bank continues to operate poorly. Today I found my accounts frozen due to suspected activity. When I called, it took me over an hour to finally reach the department that " closed the account ''. 
1. Every person on the phone ( 3-4 ) proclaimed " we have no way of reaching XXXX and don't have a number to connect you to ''. UNACCEPTABLE - They lock my business accounts with over $ XXXX tied up and proclaim it could be up to 24 hrs before someone will call me to discuss. 

2. Only through persistence and demanding a supervisor, on the 3rd supervisor, they miraculously found a number to talk with XXXX dept. 

3. Once finally connected, over an hour into the call, XXXX from XXXX gets on call. During the course of the call, he asked me a series of questions regarding the suspicious activity which I confirm I authorized. He then proclaims because I shared my account info, it was FRAUD and the account would remain closed and I'd have to go to a branch and open a new account. This is ridiculous! I authorized the logins and verified the company and their eventual deposit into my account which was the reason for the account validation. I have 2 factor authentication on my account and would know if this vendor ever tried to use those logins again folowing our call. 

4. Throughout the process, representatives on the phone repeatedly stated Company policiy and procedure '' dictates the account being closed. There was NO FRAUDULENT Activity on the Account. I validated the user was on the phone with me and was authorized. XXXX the XXXX XXXX refused to understand the circumstances and the impact of locking my business accounts before a long weekend. 

XXXX. XXXX with XXXX DENIED me the right to discuss with his supervisor and hung up on me because I challenged his decision and asked for other options before shutting down my small business for the next 4-5 days ( I'm out of state without access to a USBank ) and Monday is a holiday all because he's seen these transactions tied to fraud previously. He refused to accept my authorization for the logins and provide options. 

6. US Bank fraud department and handling of small business accounts need to be investigated by the CFPB. This is ridiculous. They have now tied up almost {$75000.00} in my funds over the last 10 days due to the mishandling of 3 transctions. 10 Days ago they processed the same ACH 3x and refused to take responsibility while tying up @ XXXX until on day 5 they admitted their mistake and miraculously were able to credit my account despite for 4 days claiming " there was no way '' to credit the account for this blatant mistake. Next, I reported a fraudulent check that was cashed on my account 7 days ago tying up yet another {$9500.00} while they process the claim. The check has XXXX US bank markings on it and is blatantly fraud. And now, when the activity is authorized, they senselessly freeze my accounts and force me to go without access to my $ XXXX for upwards of the next 5 days. 

This is causing incredible undue hardship on a veteran owned, small business. Additionally, the lack of appropriate response by any of the multitude of folks on the phone is truly UNACCEPTABLE. No one listens, no one tries to resolve, instead they dismiss my concerns and need for solutions and attempt to stand behind a policy. Just like the 3 ACHs they erroneously processed, there was absolutely a solution to credit my account real time. Just like there is a way to credit my account for the fraudulent check and just like there is a way to unfreeze my account when I clearly stated I authorized the user to access my account.

As a last resort, I am submitting the complaint here to get the recent Macy 's Credit Inquiry removed from my Credit report. I would also like to make sure that the associates at Macy 's store do not trick other customers with new credit card applications and credit inquiries.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative: Never gave XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) consent to pull my credit. Heres a few Violations XXXX committed against me *Federal Laws : * 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. 2. Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681m *Regulations : * 1. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) - 12 CFR 1002 2. Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) - 16 CFR 600 *Hard Inquiry Rules : * 1. Permissible Purpose Rule ( FCRA 604 ) : Companies must have a legitimate purpose to inquire about your credit. 2. Authorization Requirement ( FCRA 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Companies must obtain your consent before pulling your credit report. *Acceptable Hard Inquiry Purposes : * 1. Credit applications 2. Employment screening ( with written consent ) 3. Insurance underwriting 4. Credit account reviews *Time Limits : * 1. Hard inquiries remain on credit reports for 2 years ( FCRA 605 ( c ) ( 1 ) ). 2. Multiple inquiries for same purpose within 14-45 days are typically combined into one ( FCRA 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) ). *Consumer Rights : * 1. Right to dispute inaccurate inquiries ( FCRA 611 ). 2. Right to request inquiry removal ( FCRA 612 ). *Penalties for Non-Compliance : * 1. Civil liability ( FCRA 616 ). 2. FTC enforcement actions. Relevant US Codes : - 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681m ( FACTA ) - 12 CFR 1002 ( CFPB ) - 16 CFR 600 ( FTC ) Now that they pull my credit and denial me of credit service when I have a right according to Here are relevant US codes and guidelines regarding denial of credit : Federal Laws : 1. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq. 2. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. Regulations : 1. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) - 12 CFR 1002 2. Federal Reserve System - 12 CFR 202 3. Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) - 16 CFR 600 Denial of Credit Rules : 1. Adverse Action Notice Rule ( ECOA 701 ) : Creditors must provide written notice of denial. 2. Discrimination Prohibition ( ECOA 702 ) : Credit decisions can not discriminate based on : - Race - Color - Religion - National origin - Sex - Marital status - Age ( provided applicant has capacity to enter binding contract ) 3. Credit Reporting Requirements ( FCRA 615 ) : Creditors must report accurate info. Notice Requirements : 1. Reason ( s ) for denial ( ECOA 701 ( a ) ) 2. Credit score disclosure ( FCRA 609 ) 3. Credit reporting agency contact info ( FCRA 609 ) Consumer Rights : 1. Right to request credit score disclosure ( FCRA 609 ) 2. Right to dispute credit reporting errors ( FCRA 611 ) 3. Right to sue creditor for discrimination ( ECOA 706 ) Penalties for Non-Compliance : 1. Civil liability ( ECOA 706 ) 2. FTC enforcement actions 3. CFPB enforcement actions Relevant US Codes : - 15 U.S.C. 1691 ( ECOA ) - 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) - 12 CFR 1002 ( CFPB ) - 12 CFR 202 ( Federal Reserve ) - 16 CFR 600 ( FTC )

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative:
Approx. 2 weeks ago, I filed a claim with this organization asserting that Wells Fargo is manipulating charges to charge consumers overdraft fees. Since then, Wells Fargo has claimed this is untrue by sending me a copy of the fee schedule and its terms and conditions. With this being said, the fee schedule is as follows : 1st ) Holds 2nd ) Deposits : Pending deposits that are immediately available. 
3rd ) Withdrawals That said, on XX/XX/year>, I received a 24-hour grace period notice. In this message, I had until XXXX XXXX. EST to bring my account to a positive status, or I would incur an overdraft fee. The transactions are as follows : 1 ) At XXXX XXXX., I owed the bank a balance of - {$170.00}, which did not include an overdraft fee. 
2 ) At XXXXXXXX XXXX., I owed the bank a balance of - {$170.00}. Again, this did not include an overdraft fee. 
3 ) At XXXXXXXX XXXX, I deposited {$190.00} in the bank, bringing the balance to a positive status of {$20.00}. This did not have an overdraft fee. 
4 ) At XXXXXXXX XXXX, my new balance was now XXXX. This included the overdraft fee. 

According to Wells Fargo, the overdraft fee should have been included in the XXXXXXXX XXXX. balance and added to it at XXXXXXXX XXXX. EST. Therefore, when I made my deposit, I should have made a deposit that included the overdraft fee. However, as you can see from the above actions and pictures of my account, this is untrue. I was positive, and the bank still assessed me an overdraft fee. Please remember that transactions from XXXX are available for immediate use, so how can I be in positive status and still be assessed an overdraft fee? Especially since, according to Wells Fargo 's letter, the Deposits are the second process in the balance calculation formula. Suppose Wells Fargo, or any bank, can assess an overdraft fee after the account is brought to positive status. In that case, the deadline they attempt to impose doesn't mean anything because I could have met the deadline and still be charged an overdraft. Wells Fargo sent their letter to you and me stating, " On XXXX XXXX, a recurring payment of {$56.00} was debited from my account, leaving me a balance of $ XXXX ( paid ). On XXXX XXXX, a recurring {$49.00} from XXXX was authorized, and I had an ending balance of - {$67.00} ( paid ). On XXXX XXXX, I received incoming transfer credit for {$98.00} from XXXX, thus creating a balance of {$130.00}, leaving me a - {$38.00}. The problem is that the actual balance at the time of the transfer was {$67.00}, and the {$98.00} covered that, leaving me in the positive with the remaining funds. The bank waited approximately one hour after the XXXX transfer to post the overdraft... the same thing they did today. This means that Wells Fargo changed the order of the transactions and/or renamed the XXXX type from recurring to incoming transfer. They also stated in their response, " Deposits made after XXXX EST will not increase the accounts available balance in time to avoid the overdraft fee. '' This is not part of the terms and services agreement, especially given that the cutoff time is based on the location of the deposit or transfer ( page 9 ). This goes to my point of using two different time zones. With this, here is the exact process according to page 9 of the terms : Step 1 ) We calculate the available balance in your account that can be used to pay your transactions. Step 2 ) We sort your transactions into categories : 2A ) Credit deposits, 2B ) Subtract withdrawals, and 3C ) Paychecks and reauthorized ACH payments. Step 3 ) If the available balance is not enough the use of overdraft fees become applicable. With all this being said, the 24-hour grace period is EST standard, but the definition of cutoff time is " local time, '' i.e., MST. The time line presented to me goes on to say " We credit deposit received before the cutoff time ... '' Which does appear in both the app and website. From that credit they subtract the transactions ( which is done ). If there isn't enough to cover all transactions the overdraft fee is assessed ( this doesn't happen ). As you can see from the screenshots... the first step was done minus the overdraft fee being included. The second step was done ... and the third step was done but the account was already in the positives thus the overdraft fee should not have occurred.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Against Freedom Mortgage for Unauthorized Escrow Refund Use and Failure to Issue Refund Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint regarding Freedom Mortgage, as they have misappropriated my escrow refund without authorization, causing significant inconvenience and frustration. 

Recently, Freedom Mortgage took funds from my escrow refund, stating they used these funds to pay my school taxes. However, I had already paid my taxes directly and I don't not pay school taxes because I have no kids, also did not authorize Freedom Mortgage to make this payment. Upon realizing the mistake, I contacted Freedom Mortgage, and they assured me a refund check would be sent promptly. However, despite multiple follow-ups, they have delayed returning my money and have provided inconsistent responses, leaving me feeling like I am being given the runaround. 

This situation has caused considerable financial strain, and I believe Freedom Mortgage has acted improperly by using my escrow funds without authorization and by failing to promptly resolve the issue once it was identified. I am seeking assistance from the CFPB to expedite the return of my escrow refund and ensure that Freedom Mortgage takes appropriate steps to prevent this issue from happening again. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX

My mortgage is held by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX Illinois, but is serviced by LoanCare of XXXX  XXXX, VA. I reached out to the company on XX/XX/XXXX to have the funds returned to me since they are needed to pay other bills. At that time I was told that online payments have to be cancelled 3 full business days before their scheduled payment date or they will be processed despite the confirmed cancellation. I asked where this information was available to the public and was told that it is internal information that is not shared with the consumer. Their policy is that I must show them proof that the funds were withdrawn from my account ( even though they know they have the funds ). Once I provide the proof, then they will take 5 business days to process my request. At the time, they will mail me a check for the funds that they illegally withdrew from my account. This is a stalling tactic that again is intended to materially harm the consumer and deprive them access to their own assets.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Newrez, acting as a mortgage service company, erroneously placed Lender Placed Insurance ( LPI ) on my home mortgage loan, and in so doing attempted to force me to pay an additional {$340.00} monthly fee to cover the cost of the escrow they established to pay for the LPI. 

During my previous complaint against this company regarding this issue, they made numerous false statements, specifically producing letters they alleged were written and mailed to my XXXX XXXX insurance agent and myself, forewarning us of their intent to implement LPI. He also confirmed that the earlier proof of insurance that was mailed to the Newrez Texas address instead of the Michigan location, had also been received. So with this information, it became clear that Newrez had no reason to ever place LPI. 

Now as I continue to make my regular monthly payment in full and on time, Newrez shifted from charging me a monthly LPI escrow fee, to now applying late fees every single month. This is a result of my not paying their inflated monthly payment to cover the LPI escrow, which again should never have been created. So they are basically attempting to penalize me for not paying their inaccurate statement amounts. 

To compound the damages they have already caused by making me expend dozens of hours writing letters and filing complaints, they are now reporting false information to all three Credit Reporting Agencies by showing an inflated Past Due making it appear as if I am over 30 days delinquent even though they continue to cash my checks every month. This has caused my XXXX XXXX XXXX to plummet XXXX XXXX XXXX in one month, from a perfect previous score in XXXX XXXX XXXX. There is only one derogatory item on any of my three of my credit reports, and it is Newrezs false reporting in gross violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Privacy Act Violations, Inaccurate Reporting, Predatory Lending, and Misrepresentation by Credit Acceptance Corporation and XXXX XXXX XXXX  Complaint Summary : I am filing this complaint against Credit Acceptance Corporation and XXXX XXXX XXXX  for multiple violations of my consumer rights. These include misrepresentation of contract terms, predatory lending, unfair and deceptive practices, and ongoing unauthorized reporting to credit bureaus despite a paid-off balance on the equitable side. The issues in question involve inflated pricing, undisclosed liens, and an incomplete vehicle history, among other serious concerns : 1. Violation of Privacy Rights and Ignoring Opt-Out Request : Under the Privacy Act, as a federally protected consumer, I formally opted out of all authorized disclosures under PART 1016 - Privacy of Consumer Financial Information ( Regulation P ). Despite my request, Credit Acceptance Corporation has disregarded my opt-out directive by continuing to report transaction history to credit bureaus without my consent, violating 12 CFR 1016.1. Credit Acceptance Corporation failed to provide an initial privacy notice per 12 CFR 1016.4, denying me the opportunity to prevent unauthorized disclosures. They have also violated
my rights under 12 USC 531 by failing to honor my opt-out notice or provide a clear method to prevent disclosure.

2. Misrepresentation of Contract Terms and Security Interest : Credit Acceptance Corporation has misrepresented the nature of the contract associated with this account. They claimed a security interest in the vehicle without filing a UCC-1 financing statement or establishing a lien to verify their interest. My search of the UCC records revealed no lien on the vehicle, indicating their security interest is unfounded.

I also provided full payment for the vehicle, effectively relinquishing any supposed security interest. This action directly contravenes Indiana Code Title 26, Article 1, Chapter 3.1, Section 602, which governs the correct handling of such Under Indiana UCC Sections 26-1-3.1-602 and 26-1-3.1-603, a party tendering payment on an instrument has the right to expect that : The account will be credited in full, or If dishonored, the negotiable instrument must be returned to the obligor in its original form. Credit Acceptances failure to meet either of these requirements has caused undue harm by retaining my receivables without crediting my account, in clear violation of these statutory provisions. Additionally, per CFR 433.2 and CFR 444.3, Credit Acceptances handling of this matter raises concerns under federal consumer protection laws concerning unfair or deceptive practices. Specifically, the improper processing of my payment as a check
rather than as a negotiable instrument which now results into a billing error 15 usc 1666b. Credit Acceptance Corporation continues to inaccurately report the account status to credit bureaus, violating the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) under 15 USC 1681 by failing to accurately report account status and security interests. 
XXXX. Predatory Lending and Inflated Pricing : The original bill of sale reveals that XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX sold this vehicle to me at an inflated price of approximately {$18000.00}, while the market value was closer to {$11000.00}. The vehicle also had accident history and prior liens that were not disclosed at the time of sale, further reducing its value. 
This excessive pricing, combined with undisclosed defects and liens, constitutes predatory lending practices and a potential violation of TILA. Both Credit Acceptance Corporation and XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to disclose key information that would have impacted my purchase decision, including the true market value of the vehicle and its complete history.

4. Fraud and Misrepresentation by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  misrepresented the vehicles value and history, concealing information on prior accidents and liens that affect its resale value and my ownership rights. This failure to disclose critical details constitutes fraud and violates state and federal laws on fair market disclosure. Additionally, my down payment was not fully credited toward the vehicle purchase, raising further questions about their accounting practices and compliance with consumer protection laws.

5. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Obligations Under TILA and 15 USC 6802 : Under 15 USC 6802, Credit Acceptance Corporation has an obligation to respect my privacy rights and to provide an opt-out notice before disclosing personal information. They failed to notify me of my rights and continue to report inaccurately to the credit bureaus, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by misrepresenting my account status. 
Furthermore, they reported a late payment despite the fact that the account was fully paid on the equitable side. Given the lack of a valid security interest or lien, they lack grounds for this reporting, thereby infringing on my rights under both FCRA and TILA.

6. Organized Crime and Racketeering Concerns ( RICO ) : The pattern of conduct by both Credit Acceptance Corporation and XXXX XXXX XXXX, including inflated prices, hidden terms, fraudulent reporting, and disregard for consumer privacy, suggests a potential RICO ( Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act ) violation. This pattern of unfair and deceptive practices potentially points to an organized effort to defraud consumers through a combination of misrepresentation, overcharging, and unauthorized disclosures.

Requested Resolution : I request that the CFPB investigate Credit Acceptance Corporation and XXXX XXXX XXXX for : Failing to respect my opt-out rights and violating Privacy Act regulations by continuing to disclose my transaction history to credit bureaus. 
Violating TILA by misrepresenting the total cost of financing, inflating the vehicles price well above its market value, and not disclosing the vehicles accident history and prior liens. 
Engaging in predatory lending practices and failing to provide an accurate, complete account history. 
Reporting inaccurate information to the credit bureaus, including late payments and an improper security interest claim, in violation of FCRA requirements.

Possible racketeering practices under RICO by exhibiting a repeated pattern of fraudulent activity, misleading disclosures, and unfair treatment of consumers. 

I request that this account be removed from my credit report, or alternatively, corrected to reflect the accurate status of paid in full with no security interest. I also request that Credit Acceptance Corporation honor my opt-out directive and cease all unauthorized disclosures of my personal information. I further request a full investigation into XXXX XXXX XXXX and their predatory practices, which appear to have violated both state and federal consumer protection laws.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 states, " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have a right to ensure my PRIVATE INFORMATION isn't shared per 15 USC 6801 which states, " It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic information. XXXX, Wells Fargo, Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX, are financial institutions by definition under that title. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681 a, ( 2 ) Exclusions : ( A ) ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; Reporting Transaction history is illegal. Per 15 USC 1681b Permissible purposes of consumer reports-In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I never gave written instructions authorizing the credit to send my personal information to any credit bureau. The Creditors did not get my consent to add anything to my consumer report, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. -P.L . 90-321 ( 82 Stat. 146 ), states that any agency can on ly get my consumer report in response to a request by the head of a State or local child support enforcement agency ( or a State or local government official authorized by the head of such an agency ). 15 USC 1681 section 604 section 2 states that In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX, Wells Fargo, Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX institutions and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information. Also XXXX, Wells Fargo, Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ANY and ALL consent whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A Financial Institution may no disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise the nondisclosure option. XXXX, Wells Fargo, Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NEVER informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Talked to a third-party about your debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Phone : XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Debt Collection Practices Violation by Radius Global Solutions Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a recent interaction with Radius Global Solutions , which I believe constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). This call was in regard to my XXXX XXXX account. 

On XX/XX/year>, a representative from Radius Global Solutions contacted my mother directly on her phone, stating that the call was in relation to benefits concerning myself. My mother, believing it was legitimate and related to my well-being, merged the call with me. During this call, the representative requested that I verify my Social Security number, leading to the inadvertent disclosure of personal information with my mother present.

According to the FDCPA, debt collectors are prohibited from discussing details of a consumers debt or related personal information with third parties without explicit consent. Furthermore, they may only contact third parties to obtain location information, and they must avoid misrepresenting the nature of their call. The representatives misleading statement about benefits and the request for sensitive information in the presence of my mother is a direct violation of these guidelines and has caused me distress and concern.

I respectfully request that your office investigate this incident to determine if appropriate enforcement actions can be taken against Radius Global Solutions. Additionally, I would appreciate guidance on any further actions I should take to address this violation and ensure my privacy rights are respected. 

Please feel free to reach me at XXXX or via email should you require further information or documentation regarding this complaint. 

Thank you for your attention and assistance in addressing this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife and I purchased a solar panel system through XXXX XXXX XXXX back on XX/XX/XXXX who brokered the sale. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX was the company who installed our panels while Regions, formally known as Enerbank USA, financed the transaction. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX had explained to us that our monthly bill for the system would be $ XXXX at a 1.49 % interest rate. While filling out our application for the panels we also informed them that we only made $ XXXX. Their coach informed them to instead write that we made $ XXXX even after reiterating 3 times that, that was not the case. XXXX also explained to us that we didn't have to pay for the system for the XXXX year if we chose to and would also qualify for a tax credit to help us pay off the panels sooner. My husband and I decided to start paying on our XXXX year of having our panels and while doing our taxes we soon discovered that we were not eligible for the tax credit, and have since been paying a monthly charge of {$250.00} instead of the $ XXXX while our rate went up to 1.99 %. In the recent time of having panels we also experienced our local electric company giving us astronomically higher bills than we have ever paid before and continue to do so. We were told we would see lower bills, instead we are paying higher bills and a high monthly charge for our solar panel system. My wife and I sought legal advice through an attorney provided by XXXX XXXX. After reviewing the contract given to us by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, a year after purchasing the panels, our Texas attorney wrote a letter on our behalf stating the multiple Texas Business codes broken in this transaction. 

Furthermore, this entering of a XXXX XXXX and Install Agreement occurred at our home. Texas Business and Commerce Code Chapter 601 applies to the Agreement as a transaction between XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, being the installer and merchant, and my husband and I as the consumer, where their agent engaged in a personal solicitation of a sale to consumer at a place other than your place of business or the agreement to purchase is given by the consumer at a place other than their place of business. 

Section 601.052 requires XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX to provide us with a complete copy of a contract pertaining to the transaction, and such contract must contain, in immediate proximity to the space reserved in the contract for the signature of the consumer, in boldface type of a minimum size of XXXX points a notice that we may cancel the contract at any time prior to midnight of the third business day after the date of the transaction. The Agreement was not delivered to us at the time of the transaction and did not provide such notice. 

Section 601.053 requires in part that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX as merchant attach to the agreement a completed notice of cancellation form in duplicate that contains certain information in XXXX boldface type described in such statute. No such notice of cancellation form was attached to the Agreement.

Section 601.201 provides that a sale or contract entered into in violation of Section 601.053 ( b ) is void. Accordingly, the Agreement is void, and Section 601.202 provides that a merchant who violates the notice of right to cancel provisions is liable to the consumer for actual damages suffered by us as the consumer as a result of the violation, reasonable attorney 's fees and court costs. 

In this letter our Texas attorney encouraged XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to resolve this matter in a timely manner without the need for further legal action. Our attorney gave them 15 days after the date they received this demand letter to move on the matter. To which they to this day of XX/XX/XXXX have not responded. My wife and I were also told that our other contract given through Enerbank USA was under Utah jurisdiction. XXXX XXXX provided us with a Utah based attorney who also reviewed Enerbanks ' contract and discovered the Utah business codes that were broken. Our Utah attorney then sent out a letter on our behalf to Regions, or Enerbank USA, encouraging them to resolve this matter within XXXX business days as of XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX

On XX/XX/year> {$4900.00} was deposited into my checking account and immediately taken out. We never really use that account and the balance never changed. It was not brought to our attention until we received a letter dated XX/XX/year> stating a 1 time transfer debit in the amount of {$4900.00} was debited from an external account. After seeing that our checking account was now overdrawn for {$4900.00} we immediately called USAA. They took all the details and said they would be in touch. We received a letter dated XX/XX/year> stating they could find no fraudulent activity! 
We called again, and again they would look into it. We did then receive a letter dated XX/XX/year> stating the funds had been transferred from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I called again in XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX promised he would called me back as there was systemwide outage of their fraud tools! 
9 days later, here we are, no call back, no resolution. 
I have specifically asked for the transaction details showing where the money was transfer from and to. Which financial institution and what accounts so I can prove that I do not own those accounts. I also want the type of device and IP address where the transactions occurred. I am a flight attendant and was working on the airplane that day and show where I was. 
The phone call today again proved fruitless. The money came from XXXX ( finance ) The owner of that account said they had not authorized it and so it was return the same day. So how is it {$4900.00} XXXX drawn. Obviously the money was removed somewhere else that day. USSA do need seem capable of looking further into this and there is no was to speak to their fraud department as apparently it is " back end operations ''

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint against Flagstar Bank and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX concerning the mismanagement of my escrow account and failure to pay my homeowners insurance premium. This negligence resulted in the termination of my insurance coverage, ultimately causing substantial property damage and personal financial loss. 

Summary of Complaint : This complaint addresses the failure by Flagstar Bank and XXXX XXXX  to fulfill their obligations under the terms of my mortgage agreement by ensuring timely payment of the insurance premium from my escrow account. 

Background and Facts : Mortgage Transfer : My mortgage was serviced by Flagstar Bank until it was transferred/sold to RoundPoint Mortgage XXXX XX/XX/2024. 
I received Notice from Flagstar assuring me that : " This transfer will not affect the terms of your loan. It will be the same type of loan with the same terms and interest rate. If you have an escrow account with Flagstar, it will transfer to XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, who will make your tax and insurance payments for you. '' ( see attachment ) Escrow Account Setup : As per my mortgage agreement, Flagstar Bank had established an escrow account to cover my homeowners insurance premiums, with the policy set to renew in XX/XX/2024 through XXXX XXXX. 
Failure to Pay Insurance Premium : Renewal notices and billing statements from XXXX XXXX were sent to Flagstar Bank, however, no action was taken by Flagstar to ensure these payments were processed or properly transitioned to XXXX XXXX  Upon transfer, XXXX XXXX  attempted to coordinate with XXXX XXXX but failed to make the necessary payment from my escrow account. 

Resulting Impact Due to the failure of Flagstar Bank and XXXX XXXX  to ensure the continuity of my insurance coverage : My homeowners insurance policy was terminated, leaving my property uninsured. 
Shortly after the termination of my policy, my property sustained water and sewage damage, resulting in significant personal expenses that would have been covered if the policy had remained active. 

Specific Damages : The mishandling of my escrow account has caused damages to my property, including but not limited to : Carpet damage due to water issues. 
Damage to household items due to sewage backup. 

These damages have resulted in substantial personal expenses that could have been avoided if the insurance premium had been paid on time.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally request your assistance regarding an issue with the management of my escrow account by Select Portfolio Servicing ( SPS ). My escrow balance as of XX/XX/year>, was {$6100.00}. After making my regular loan payment on XX/XX/year>, including an additional {$540.00} escrow payment, the account should reflect a balance of {$6600.00}.

However, SPS disbursed a late tax payment on my behalf and deducted an additional {$6.00} from my escrow account due to their own negligence. This error violates the terms of our agreement, under which SPS is responsible for managing my escrow account in a manner that avoids penalties and fees. As such, any late fees or penalties due to SPSs failure to disburse payments in a timely manner should not be my responsibility.

I am requesting that the {$6.00} be reimbursed to my escrow account and that a sanction be placed on SPS for their unwarranted handling of my escrow funds. I have sent SPS multiple emails about this issue and have also contacted them numerous times by phone. I have recordings of these calls, which I believe clearly demonstrate SPSs predatory practices, aimed at undermining my property ownership.

I am hopeful that the CFPB will address this matter and take appropriate action to prevent further misconduct by SPS.

Thank you for your attention and assistance.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Debt Validation Request Dear SUNRISE CREDIT SERVICE, I am writing to formally request validation of the debt referenced in your records under account number XXXX. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to request documentation that verifies the existence and amount of the debt you claim I owe. 
Please provide me with the following information : 1.Validation of the debt : A detailed statement of the amount owed, including any fees or interest.

2.Proof of ownership : Documentation that proves you own the debt or have the authority to collect on it.

3.Account history : A complete account history that reflects all payments made and any adjustments made to the account.

4.Original creditor information : The name and address of the original creditor, including the original account number.

Additionally, please be aware that under FCRA 609, I have the right to dispute any information that is inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. If you are unable to provide the requested documentation, I expect that you will remove all negative entries associated with this account from my credit report.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please respond within 30 days to avoid any further reporting of this account to credit bureaus.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt XXXX, which falls under trafficking according to XXXX-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative: My Synchrony Bank, NA certificate of deposit at 5.1 % was to mature on XXXX XXXX, 2024 with a 10 day grace period. I called the bank on XX/XX/year>2024 to determine whether to roll the CD to a 4.1 % CD for another 12 months or move the funds. I decided to move the funds to the same bank 's high yield ( 4.3 % ) savings account. The bank reps told me that it would take between 2-5 business days to " close the account '' and another 2-5 business days to " move the funds '' to the same bank 's savings account. I asked where the funds would reside during those business days and was told that the funds would stay in the CD until credited to the savings account but would receive interest at the new 4.1 % rate, even though it was in the same CD at 5.1 % during the grace period. I asked why it would take up to 10 business days to move funds within the same financial institution when a brokerage account could move the funds the same day. The reason given was that that is " bank policy. '' It is ridiculous that the bank should have the use of my funds at the lower rate ( 4.1 % ) when I should be earning either the current CD rate ( 5.1 % ) or at least the savings rate ( 4.3 % ) on the business day after the maturity date of the current CD. While XXXX basis points may seem nominal, the bank does this to everyone and that adds up to significant interest lost to its customers.

On [ starting XXXX every single month till the last pull on XXXX ], USAA XXXX ] performed a credit inquiry without my authorization or any permissible purpose as defined by the FCRA. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, companies are required to have a permissible purposesuch as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer, a court order, or a business transaction that requires access to my credit informationto lawfully pull my credit report. I have no such relationship or outstanding debt with [ USAA XXXX ] that would justify this inquiry. This unauthorized credit pull has negatively affected my credit score and caused undue stress. As such, I am seeking the following : 1. Statutory Damages : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ), I am requesting statutory damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 2. Actual Damages : I have suffered harm, including emotional distress and potential damage to my credit standing, due to this unlawful inquiry. I reserve the right to seek actual damages in addition to statutory damages. Please investigate this violation of my consumer rights and take action against [ USAA XXXX ] to prevent future illegal activities. I also request that the unauthorized inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your timely response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have XXXX promotions with deferred interests expiring on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and a Balance Transfer Check with no interest until XX/XX/XXXX. I noticed that my minimum payment was applied more to the promotion expiring in XX/XX/XXXX than to any of the promotions expiring within 30 days. In billing cycles in which payments are allocated to deferred interest balances first, the deferred interest balance will be reduced before any other balance on the account ... .. '' I've been told over and over by many account specialists that payments must be applied to expiring promotions within 30-60 days first to avoid unnecessary interest. I'm being told that, but it doesn't actually seem to be happening automatically, unless I call. This is the first time I was ever told I couldn't have a payment reallocated to expiring promotions because they were locked. 

I spoke with XXXX, an Account Manger today, after two other reps, and she said my Balance Transfer check promotion has a minimum payment due, however I don't see that anywhere on my statements. In reviewing my statements though, I do see that my payments have been allocated willy-nilly and in a manner to which more interest than necessary can be calculated, which is what payment allocation guidelines were supposed to prevent. The Balance transfer checks applied a service fee upon use, and no interest until the promotion expiration date, so why would they say a minimum payment is due for that promotion, but it doesn't show that on my statements? My other promotions with a deferred and accruing interest show minimums due. 

I'm attaching my Credit Card Statements. Notice how Home Depot another Citi Retail Services card handles interest awareness and promotions. They indicate exactly how much to pay to avoid interest charges especially including promotional purchases.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Discrepancies in ChexSystems Report Preventing Account Opening Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding incorrect information reported about me by ChexSystems, which is preventing me from opening a bank account. I have reviewed the information provided to banks through ChexSystems, and I found that the personal detailssuch as my name, address, and phone numberare inaccurate. I have no knowledge of these discrepancies and have not authorized them to be reported. 

This situation is significantly impacting my ability to access basic financial services, and it is causing me considerable hardship. I need a bank account to manage my finances, receive payments, and perform essential transactions. However, the incorrect reporting in ChexSystems is making it impossible for me to open an account, despite my efforts with several financial institutions. 

I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this matter and intervene with ChexSystems to correct these inaccuracies. I believe this issue falls under the following regulations : 1. **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ** Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 et seq. ), consumers have the right to dispute any incorrect or incomplete information on their credit or consumer reports. In this case, the erroneous data reported by ChexSystems is inaccurate and needs to be rectified immediately. 

2. **Consumer Reporting Agencies ' Duty to Correct and Update Information** ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) The FCRA requires that consumer reporting agencies, including ChexSystems, investigate disputes and correct any inaccuracies in a timely manner. I have not received any communication or explanation as to how these errors were made, nor have I been informed of any previous attempts to resolve this issue. 

3. **Right to Privacy and Accuracy in Consumer Reporting** I assert my right under the FCRA to have accurate personal information maintained in consumer reporting agencies, including ChexSystems. The incorrect details on my report are impeding my ability to access services that are essential to my well-being. 

I request that ChexSystems immediately correct the false information on my report and provide written confirmation that the inaccuracies have been removed. Furthermore, I would appreciate it if you could ensure that no financial institution is allowed to deny me an account based on this erroneous data, as doing so is unlawful under the FCRA. 

I am attaching copies of any relevant documentation I have, including my ChexSystems report, to assist with the investigation. 

Please inform me of any further actions I need to take on my end and keep me updated on the progress of this investigation. I am confident that with your assistance, this matter can be resolved swiftly and fairly. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX XXXX bankruptcy case ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) was XXXX by the United States Bankruptcy XXXX for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Georgia XXXX This discharge included all debts owed to Pentagon Federal Credit Union ( PenFed ), legally releasing me from any liability for these debts under 11 U.S.C. 524 ( a ). 

In XXXX, despite the discharge order, PenFed sold one of the discharged debts to XXXX XXXX, a third-party entity. The sale of a discharged debt is a clear violation of federal bankruptcy law, which prohibits creditors from transferring, selling, or enforcing dischargeXXXX debts in any manner. 

Furthermore, PenFed has restricted my ability to establish an account with them, requiring me to " take care of the balance '' with XXXXXXXX XXXX before I can open an account. This restriction constitutes an indirect attempt to enforce the discharged debt, which also violates the discharge injunction.

Actions Taken by the Company : PenFed sold the discharged debt to XXXX XXXX in XXXX, contrary to the protections provided under bankruptcy law. 
PenFed refused to allow me to open a new account unless the balance was resolved with XXXX XXXX, indirectly attempting to enforce a discharged debt.

Actions Taken by Me : I notified PenFed that the debt was discharged in my bankruptcy and provided supporting documentation, including the bankruptcy discharge order.

I requested that PenFed lift the restriction on opening an account and confirm the debt was no longer enforceable.

I informed them that selling or transferring a discharged debt violates 11 U.S.C. 524 ( a ).

Despite these efforts, PenFed has not resolved the issue, and their unlawful actions continue to cause stress and inconvenience. I seek immediate corrective action to address these violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX IL, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX USAA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX Subject : Demand for Rescission of Consumer Credit Transaction Under 15 U.S.C. 1602, 1635, 1679a, and Related Provisions Dear USAA I am writing to formally address violations under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) concerning my recent consumer credit transaction with USAA. This letter serves as a notice of rescission due to insufficient disclosures regarding my right to rescind, as well as additional violations under relevant provisions of the TILA and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Consumer Credit Transaction and Rescission Rights Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1679a, a consumer credit transaction includes any transaction involving an extension of credit primarily for personal, family, or household purposes. I purchased my vehicle primarily for my familys personal use. My loan contract explicitly identifies this transaction as a consumer credit transaction. However, I was not provided with adequate notice of my right to rescind the transaction as required by 15 U.S.C. 1635. Had I been aware of my right to rescind, I would have exercised this right when title issues and accusations of foul play arose.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( a ), creditors are obligated to disclose the right of rescission for consumer credit transactions. Because USAA failed to disclose this essential information, I am exercising my right to rescind the loan immediately. 

Applicability of 15 U.S.C. 1635 and Definition of Consumer Credit Transactions According to 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( 4 ), the right of rescission applies to all consumer credit transactions consummated on or after XX/XX/XXXX, making my loan eligible for rescission. Additionally, I am aware that residential mortgage transactions are exempt ; however, this exemption does not apply here, as the loan was strictly a consumer credit transaction, not related to a dwelling mortgage as defined in 15 U.S.C. 1602 ( x ).

Additional Violations Under TILA and FCRA USAAs failure to disclose my rescission rights constitutes inadequate disclosure per TILA standards, violating 15 U.S.C. 1602 ( k ). Furthermore, I have experienced a lack of transparency regarding issues with multiple car titles and misleading information in my credit report, which may represent further violations under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2. USAA knowingly reported inaccurate information, creating financial harm and exacerbating my concerns regarding the transactions integrity. 

Request for Remedy As a result of these violations, I formally demand rescission of my loan in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1635. I expect to retain the vehicle and receive a full refund of all payments made to date, with finance charges zeroed. Furthermore, I request that USAA take immediate steps to rectify any inaccurate or misleading information reported on my credit report to reflect this rescission. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide details on the steps USAA will take to honor this rescission request in compliance with TILA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Each time I had to call the Cerulean/Continental Finance and explain that I made the payment. I would verify with my bank that the payment was made and could see the payment had been processed with a verification number. I called my bank ( XXXX ) and asked them to send me a " proof of payment '' which I had to send to Cerulean/Continental Finance . The last time this happened in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I called the company and told them this is now the third time that this has happened and told them that the payment was made and that they keep doing this. I told the representative that the last two times it was an error on their end and asked him to check their records to confirm and he refused. He told me the payment wasn't made and that they we're going to charge me a late fee and report it on my credit report. I offered to give him the verification number from my bank and told him I can send the 'proof of payment ' from XXXX like the last two times and he wasn't interested in it and hung up on me. I then called back and spoke to a much nicer women who gave me the info to send the " proof of payment '' which is the email XXXX So, I sent them a letter with the " proof of payment '' and told them that it was the third time this has happened and asked for an explanation and asked to be contacted by the CEO of the company to let him know of the situation. I never heard anything back from them so I called back and a representative told me that I had a XXXX balance and told him I wanted to close my account ASAP because of their unethical business practices. The representatives name as XXXX and his ID number was # XXXX and he assured me that the balance was XXXX and the account was closed. He said I may get a statement but do disregard it. I asked him if I could get a transcript of the call which he said to use the same email, XXXX and request a transcript which I did but never received the transcript. A couple weeks later I receive a bill from Cerulean/Continental Finance stating that my previous balance of {$10.00} was paid, however that I made another purchase of {$10.00}, which i never did, and that I had a fee of {$10.00} and a balance of {$10.00}. which doesn't add up or even make sense. Nope, I am now getting email and text messages over and over every day saying that my account is past due, that I owe them money, and to contact them. How is a company that is licensed to extend credit this inept? The only explanation I have is this is a predatory lender who purposely tells customers that they don't receive payments so they can charge late fees and make more money. THIS IS ILLEGAL! This company, Cerulean/Continental Finance needs to be investigated to see how many customers have had this happen to them. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX AR XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. My name is XXXX XXXX, and my Social Security number is. I have reviewed my credit report and found an error that needs immediate correction. 

Account Information : Creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account ID : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Date Last Active : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Date Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX Last Reported : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Current Status : Repossession Nature of Dispute : The account is inaccurately reported as a repossession. According to the attached " Notice of Proposal to Accept Collateral in Full Satisfaction of Obligation '' from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, the lender proposed to accept my vehicle ( XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX VIN : XXXX as full satisfaction of my debt. I accepted this proposal on XX/XX/XXXX, as evidenced by my signature on the document. The document clearly states that upon acceptance, I would have no further obligation to pay the remaining debt, and the vehicle would not be considered a repossession. Reporting this account as a repossession is inaccurate and misleading. 


FCRA Violations : Inaccurate Reporting : The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requires that only accurate information be reported. Reporting this account as a repossession violates FCRA provisions by misrepresenting the nature of the agreement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ).

Failure to Correct Errors : If I dispute this error and it is not corrected, it further violates the FCRA, which mandates that credit reporting agencies correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information within 30 days ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ).

Requested Action : I request that you : Correct the status of this account to reflect that the debt was fully satisfied without repossession.

Remove any negative marks associated with this incorrect repossession from my credit report. 

All credit reporting agencies involved stated they did an investigation and found the provided evidence as insufficient, which is severely incorrect. The first letter was sent and then the second letter sent less than 30 days later, because I received a response from the credit reporting agencies. XXXX nor XXXX properly responded to method of verification, instead once again stating the information was accurate and that I needed to contact the original creditor directly.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the recent decision made by First National Bank of Omaha ( FNBO ) regarding my XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. Upon receiving the bank 's letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, I noted the reduction of my credit line from {$17000.00} to {$1000.00}. This action signified a 94 % decrease in my revolving credit limit. Accordingly, I am providing additional context and elaboration in the sincere hope that we can reach a beneficial resolution that is also in alignment with FNBOs purpose : to improve the financial well-being of customers. 

As a valued member of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  since XXXX, I respectfully express my concern regarding the decision made by FNBO to base its assessment on outdated information from early XXXX that did not accurately reflect my present credit standing in XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. My XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX were XXXX and XXXX, respectively, in the middle of the month of XXXX. The XXXX XXXX Score XXXX, Score XXXX, XXXX Score XXXX were rated as very good at XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, respectively, in that same month. 
Presently, the XXXX scores through myXXXX are the following : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : XXXX First National Bank of Omaha took significant action based on the {$33.00} ( XXXX XXXX dollars and XXXX XXXX cents ) statement balance due on XX/XX/XXXX, despite the low credit card utilizationless than 1 % of the {$17000.00} credit limitand minimal debt. Unfortunately, I unintentionally missed the XX/XX/XXXX payment deadline due to mistakenly thinking I had no balance. However, I promptly rectified the situation by making a complete current balance payment on XX/XX/XXXX, which was posted to the account the following day, prior to receiving any correspondence from First National Bank of Omaha. Given my history of timely payments, I earnestly requested a reversal of the late fee from the bank, and FNBO promptly acknowledged and granted my request. 

Because of the actions taken by the bank, I am finding it difficult to continue using this credit card for XXXX ticket purchases due to its low {$1000.00} credit line. As an XXXX XXXX XXXX  member with XXXX XXXX status, I often travel on business or first class. When XXXX announced the launch of its new XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, you were quoted as saying, FNBO is proud to partner with XXXX to provide its customers with a high-quality, comprehensive card program that supports the superior experience and service they receive riding with XXXX XXXX XXXX Due to the financial inability to access the superior experience that you referenced, I now will have to redirect my XXXX spending to my other credit cards, which all have a much higher limit. 

In the correspondence with FNBO, I aimed to convey an unwavering commitment to meeting my financial obligation of nearly {$34.00}. The upward trajectory of my XXXX score served as a testament to this dedication. Moreover, I took proactive measures to prevent any future occurrences by enrolling in the banks auto-pay feature. On Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX, a First National Bank of Omaha supervisory representative called and left a voicemail from ( XXXX ) XXXX. I returned the telephone call and spoke with XXXX. While he was empathetic about the situation, XXXX, unfortunately, indicated that the bank was unable to reconsider its decision because of an internal policy. He added that the only available option was for me to wait XXXX months. In XX/XX/XXXX, the bank would be able to reassess the situation, but only through a hard rather than soft credit inquiry. As for the severe reduction in my credit limit, the programmed computer algorithm apparently viewed the {$33.00} statement balance even more negatively because the previous months balance was XXXX. Therefore, the credit card issuer evaluated the unpaid debt as a percentage of the total outstanding balance, which includes any unpaid amounts from the previous statement. This figure was calculated at 100 %. In contrast, had I carried a larger balance from the previous statement, it would have resulted in a smaller ratio and the impact may not have resulted in the severe action that FNBO implemented on my credit card account. 
Despite this situation, I believe that my background makes me an ideal customer for First National Bank of Omaha. Moreover, FNBOs website asserts that the bank considers itself a great big, small bank, large enough to provide the expertise and resources necessary to handle any financial need yet small enough to know its customers personally. 

Although I submitted written correspondence to FNBO, the bank has not replied in writing. Through a verbal communication only, FNBO ultimately did not consider this well-reasoned and thoughtfully articulated request to restore my credit limit to its previous level. This adjustment would have greatly assisted in ensuring the continuity of a mutually beneficial partnership that would have been in keeping with FNBOs mission of building and maintaining long-term relationships. The bank was unable to apply its purpose-led approach, which drives how the bank serves its customers to help them achieve their goals, which in my case would be to shift XXXX and other purchases back on my XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX.

2. Cease all credit reporting activities related to this debt until validation has been completed and shared with me.

3. Improve their communication practices to ensure consumers can promptly reach representatives to address debts.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Compliant Subject : WellsFargo Bank Reasons for Complaint : 1. Fraudulent and predatory actions by bank employee ( s ) resulting in theft of {$9000.00} from savings account 2. Lack of internal security measures or alerts to prevent and safeguard against fraudulent activity.

3. Bank Executive Boards lack of action to investigate theft. Even sending an email to the CEO did not elicit a response. Unwillingness to speak to customer or contact local police department to obtain the police report, which was written at the bank branch within minutes of the theft. Police officer discussed the next steps with the bank manager at that time. There was no collaboration with the police department to investigate this theft.

4. Weeks of misleading the customer to believe that they were actively investigating the facts of the case, only to learn that they opened the case 25 days ( XX/XX/XXXX ) after the theft occurred. Then they send an email on XX/XX/XXXX stating that the case was closed since they found no fraud. No details of the investigation were disclosed. The XXXX XXXX Police Department was never contacted. 

5. Complete failure of fiduciary responsibility to protect customers financial information. Demonstrated by : In response to one of my emails, the WellsFargo Assistance Center sent me an email with someone elses name, case number and the last 4 digits of his Account Number. This is an egregious example of total disregard for security of information. 

Fraud Activity : On XX/XX/XXXX, my daughter who has been on my account for almost 30 years, received a call from WellFargo at this number, XXXX which is the XXXX XXXX branch in XXXX. ( This is a legitimate number for this WellsFargo branch ) The phone number came up as WellsFargo. The caller announced that they were calling from WellsFargo 's fraud department and that they noticed fraudulent activity on my account. To confirm, the caller verified all account numbers, date of births and last 4 digits of social security numbers. He even knew how much money was in the account. Only a bank employee would have that level of specific information. 

The fraud dept representative instructed her to withdraw {$9000.00} in cash from my savings account ; the bank teller at our usual branch did not inquire about the large cash withdrawal she was making. The money was then deposited into the bank 's ATM machine at the branch where our accounts are held. The bank representative instructed her to deposit the money into an account number that he provided. When she then looked at the account the money was not there. Immediately, she informed the bank manager about this occurrence with the expectation that it could be immediately rectified. However, bank employees did not make any effort to trace the account numbers. This all happened in real time at our branch location in XXXX, GA, which we have been customers of for almost 9 years. Fortunately, there was a police officer, XXXX. XXXX, at a nearby parking lot and she asked him to come into the bank and make a report. He took all of the information and explained to the bank manager what the bank needed to do in order for the police dept to investigate this theft. 

Timeline : XX/XX/XXXX Bank manager XXXX gave the name and number for a contact at the executive office, XXXX XXXX XXXX. When I called, I was informed that she is not handling the case and instead XXXX is at XXXX. I left a message, but never received a return call. 

XX/XX/XXXX Called again and was informed that a person named XXXX ( XXXX possibly ) left message but did not receive a return call. 

XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX Called again and left message did not receive a return call. 

XX/XX/XXXX Spoke with XXXX  at XXXX. He advised that there is a new case number, and he will be working on the case. Advised that he would call back. 

XX/XX/XXXX Received a generated email response from the Executive Office stating that they are looking into my concern. See Document 1 XXXX I sent an email to the Executive Office responding to their general email response. 
See Document 2 XXXX Received a call from XXXX from phone # XXXX, she provided a new case number. We spoke and she advised that she will be checking into the case and will call me back. 

XXXX Received an Acknowledgement Email from WellsFargo which had another customers name ( a mans name ), his case number and the last 4 digits of his bank account. See Document 3 ( I blacked out the persons account number to avoid further breach of information ). 

XXXX XXXX called, from # XXXX. I did not answer my phone because it came up as Spam. She did leave a message, and I called her back ; however, she did not answer and I left a message. I never heard back from her. 

XX/XX/XXXX Not receiving any further calls or information, I again called the number above and asked for XXXX. Then I was the informed that XXXX was no longer handling my case. Instead a person named XXXX, located out of the US was in charge of my case. I then briefly spoke to him, and he informed me that XXXX was not capable of handling the case and that he now has it, and he just received it today, XX/XX/XXXX. He was very curt and dismissive. I asked to speak to a manager in the US and he connected me to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX who informed me that I had to work with XXXX because he was assigned to the case. ( During this conversation, I informed XXXX that I had received and automated response to one of my emails which was addressed to another customer and it contained the last 4 digits of his bank account plus his case number ; however, he gave no response ). No one could give me an explanation of why for almost two weeks I was led to understand that XXXX was actively investigating my case ; we had several discussions and now she was no longer was involved? I was then transferred back to XXXX who was clearly just going through the motions. When I informed him that I would be sending an email to the CEO, he responded, Go ahead. 

XX/XX/XXXX Following the phone call, I received another automated email from the Claims Assistance Center. See Document 4. 

XX/XX/XXXX Spoke with a secretary at the Executive Board and requested an email address that the CEO would actually receive. She provided me with one and I sent an email to his attention. See Document 5.

Received an automated response to my email. See Document 6. 

XX/XX/XXXX Received an email from XXXX stating that the case is closed as they determined that the transaction was authorized. See Document 7 In two days, XXXX was able to make this unsubstantiated determination. WellsFargo never collaborated with the police department, and never spoke with us. This was a calculated scheme on the part of an employee ( s ) of WellsFargo to involve the customer in order for it to appear authorized. Rather than investigating the origin of this fraud, to root out thieving employees and protect their customers, it is easier to just blame this on their customer. 

WellsFargo should be held in government oversight to investigate employees initial and ongoing vetting practices and security clearances. They should be held accountable for mismanagement of customers funds, the lack of security measures, ( exposing customer banking information is a clear failure in security measures ) substandard operational business practices as well as poor customer service. WellsFargos deficiency in all of these banking standards and their blatant disregard to uphold the primary function of all banks, which is to secure customers funds, are all the reasons that resulted in my {$9000.00} being stolen.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Unjust Loan Denial, Potential Collateral Misrepresentation, and Unwarranted Credit Inquiry by Citibank Complaint Details : 1. Creation of Loan Value from Application and Denial Despite Collateral Potential : I applied for a loan through Citibank on XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year> fully meeting the application requirements and providing all necessary personal and financial information, including my Social Security number. I believe that Citibank either : Created Loan Funds from My Application : In certain cases, loan applications are processed in such a way that banks create funds by balancing their internal ledgers against the application. Essentially, the application itself becomes an asset with intrinsic value, allowing the bank to balance its books. This would indicate that the application alone could serve as sufficient collateral to secure the loan. 
Utilized My Application as Collateral with the Federal Reserve : If Citibank went to the Federal Reserve to source funds for my loan, the application would act as a form of promissory note, which should hold value equivalent to the loan amount for the purposes of collateral. The Federal Reserve requires that applications used as collateral meet certain criteria, affirming that my signed application has intrinsic financial value. This should negate any reason for a loan denial based on traditional credit criteria, as the application itself provides the required collateral. 
XXXX. Securitization Practices and Secondary Market Value of Loan Applications : I understand that it is common practice for banks to securitize loans and sell them on the secondary market. For a loan to be securitized and sold, the underlying promissory note or application must hold recognized value. Once signed, the application transforms into a binding promise to pay, which gives it the necessary legal and financial value to be transferred or sold. This supports my belief that my application itself had value and could have served as collateral or an asset for securitization. This fact should have precluded Citibank from denying my loan solely based on credit factors, as the application already met the banks internal funding needs or asset requirements. 
XXXX. Hard Credit Inquiry with No Opt-Out Option and Potential FCRA Violation : During my loan application process, Citibank conducted a hard inquiry on my credit report, which impacted my credit score and limited future financial opportunities. Despite the possibility that my application was sufficient for funding without additional collateral, Citibank did not offer me an opt-out option for the credit inquiry. I believe this may be a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as the inquiry damaged my creditworthiness without my consent. If Citibanks internal processes would have allowed for loan approval by leveraging my application as collateral, then the hard inquiry was both unnecessary and detrimental. 
XXXX. Financial Damages Due to Denial and Credit Impact : The unjust denial of my loan application and the hard credit inquiry have led to measurable financial damages. Specifically, I missed a critical investment opportunity that required immediate funding. The loan denial prevented me from securing funds for a Special Purpose Vehicle ( SPV ) that would have facilitated investment opportunities valued at over {$8.00} XXXX, leading to substantial economic harm.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: For background, I have a number of CC that are mostly paid off every month if used at all and a perfect payment record on credit report and generally extremely good credit. I have had a Citi Bank Shop Your Way CC since XXXX  and it is one of my favorite cards to use for daily needs due to the bonus points and special rate offers they frequently send me. I happen to see the request for credit increase listed in the online portal and figured since I hadn't done that for this card in a long time I would request an increase. I normally do this for most of my CC periodically or the company automatically does it since I am an excellent customer. My request ( much to my surprise ) was immediately denied and then I got a message on XX/XX/XXXX saying it was due to " Unsatisfactory existing account payment history ''. This seemed odd. I called both the number on the paper and the number on the back of my card and talked to at least 3 people for over an hour and they couldn't give me much info, but they didn't see any late payments or anything in system. I was worried that someone had an unauthorized account under my name or something! Then next day on XX/XX/XXXX I get another message that the " system '' performed a review of my account and with no warning closed my account of 6+ years claiming " one or more occurrences of late or returned payments in the last 6 months ''. I immediately called and spent another hour on the phone trying to figure out where the heck they came up with that. Cycled through multiple unhelpful people ( probably more like a useless automated system that didn't let them do any customer service ) to a manager. She a least showed some concern but still said there was nothing they could do as it was an automated system review and the system rules did not have an override or any possible oversight. She concluded that 4 months ago I had 2 extra principle payments scheduled on the same day ( way over minimum required monthly payment that was already satisfied ) that got " returned ''. The only reason that happened is the scheduled payment account they were linked to had been shut down by XXXXXXXX XXXX fraud dept in an abundance of caution at the same time frame the payments were scheduled so the payments were " returned ''. Manager was nice enough to at least tell me she filed my complaint against the system, but I am not sure if she really did or if that helps anyone as there was no reference and she said it was internal use only. Really sucks to cut ties with a perfectly good customer and I find this to be a horrible business decision. And the fact that they can even do that with no human review from bank agent should be illegal, and who knows, maybe it is!
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
