As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under XXXX  according to XXXX-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( XXXX ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo Debit Card Dispute Claim number : # XXXX Account number ending in XXXX On XX/XX/2024 I called the Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX customer service department. I noticed several unauthorized transactions on my Wells Fargo everyday checking account ending in XXXX. I informed the customer service department and a claim was opened. 

On XX/XX/XXXX my claim had closed under the dispute reason of, dont remember this transaction, which is a statement I never made. Therefore, they denied my claim and I was not refunded for the unauthorized transactions on my account. 

I called the dispute team today at was told that because, I lost my my debit card I would not be refunded for the unauthorized use of my card. 

I have been banking with Wells Fargo for over 20 years, have had a good standing, with CDs and several accounts and credit cards with them. There is clear evidence that I have never used my cards in any other international country nor have ai traveled. 

Once I investigated the transactions on my account I found that there are several charges in other foreign counties. I have never traveled to other counties let alone purchase anything in another country. Additionally, I found that I received emails and text messages in which Wells Fargo flagged my account. On XX/XX/XXXX I received a text from the Wells Fargo Detection Department asking if I recognized the transactions. I replied No and received a text stating that the card was blocked and that I would have to call the Wells Fargo dispute department in order to allow transactions to process on my account. It is very concerning that although I did my due diligence and reported fraud, Wells Fargo did not do their part as my entrusted bank to take appropriate measurements in order to prevent fraud and protect me from outsiders using my card and earned monies. 

My great standing along with the insurance that is offered by Wells Fargo should suffice the credit I am owed. 


I ask that Wells Fargo reopens my claim and do thier due diligence and further investigate that the transactions do not belong to me. 

I have enclosed the following documentation for your review : Unusual activity email sent by Wells Fargo Text message in which I specifically stated that I did not authorize the transactions made List of highlighted unauthorized transactions on my Wells Fargo bank account Thank you in advance for your time and consideration, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint alleges that Credit Acceptance Corporation ( XXXX  ) engaged in multiple deceptive, unfair, and abusive practices in violation of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and other applicable federal and state laws. These violations created significant financial hardship and burden, misrepresented credit benefits, and failed to provide legally required transparency on loan terms. Below are the specific claims. 
Failure to Disclose Total Sale Price and Finance Charges Transparently XXXX failed to comply with 12 C.F.R. 1026.18 by not clearly disclosing the total sale price and finance charges separately, instead embedding these in the principal loan amount. This misleading representation of the true cost of credit violates Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) requirements, making XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Inadequate Disclosure of Add-On Product Costs ( XXXX  Insurance XXXX Extended Warranties ) XXXX failed to comply with 12 C.F.R. 1026.18 ( c ), which requires clear itemization and disclosure of optional add-on products. By embedding these optional costs within the financed amount, XXXX violated XXXX, making it civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Unfair Loan-to-Value Ratio on XXXX Vehicles XXXX financing exceeded the fair market value of the vehicle, creating an unfair loan-to-value ratio that burdens borrowers. This practice fails to meet fair lending standards and is considered exploitative, violating the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), 12 U.S.C. 5531 ( d ), and making XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Misrepresentation of APR Due to Hidden Finance Charges XXXX failed to comply with 12 C.F.R. 1026.18 ( d ), which mandates accurate APR disclosure, by embedding finance charges in the principal and underrepresenting the APR. This violation makes XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Deceptive Finance Charges and Principal XXXX XXXX obscured the true finance charges by embedding them within the principal, inflating the loan amount beyond the vehicles fair market value. This violates XXXX, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1638 ( a ) ( 3 ), and creates civil liability for XXXX under 15 U.S.C. 1640.

Failure to Provide Accurate Disclosure of Payment Allocation for Partial Payments XXXX did not comply with 15 U.S.C. 1638 ( a ) ( 8 ), which requires clear disclosures on how partial payments are allocated. This failure makes XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
False Claims Regarding Credit Improvement Opportunities XXXX falsely claimed that the loan would improve my credit, despite loan terms that made default likely. This deceptive representation violates FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681, and the CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), making XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Unconscionable Contract Terms and Excessive Interest Rates The contract terms included high-interest rates and repossession conditions that are unconscionable and exploit borrowers. This violates UCC 2-302, CFPA 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), and Michigan Compiled Laws 438.31 regarding usury limits, making XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Misrepresentation of the Loans Purpose and Terms XXXX  misrepresented the loans purpose by implying it could help with credit repair, which is deceptive. This violates CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), and FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. 45 ( a ), rendering XXXX civilly liable. 
Unclear Arbitration Clause and Restricted Legal Recourse The arbitration clause restricted my right to pursue claims in court, violating CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), and FAA, 9 U.S.C. 1-16, due to lack of transparency. This makes XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Incentivization of Unnecessary Add-On Products XXXX  encouraged unnecessary add-on purchases, such as warranties, without proper disclosure, violating CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5531 ( a ) and TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1605 ( a ), making XXXX civilly liable under 15 U.S.C. 1640. 
Violation of State Usury Laws by Concealing Excessive Interest By embedding finance charges in the principal, XXXX effective interest rate XXXX exceed state usury caps. This violates New York General Obligations Law 5-501, Michigan Compiled Laws 438.31, and CFPA 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), making XXXX civilly liable.

Failure to Provide Required Privacy Opt-Out Rights XXXX privacy notice does not clearly inform of opt-out rights, violating GLBA, 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) and FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b, making XXXX civilly liable. 
Improper Reporting of XXXX Information tXXXX Credit Bureaus XXXX reported loan information in a manner that misrepresented my creditworthiness, violating FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, and CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), making XXXX civilly liable. 
Deceptive Terms Regarding Required Insurance The contract misrepresented requirements for insurance coverage, failing to inform me of my rights to choose my insurer, violating GLBA, 15 U.S.C. 6802, and CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5536 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the removal of inaccurate information that appears on my credit report. I got a call on or about XX/XX/year> who left a voice mail : Good morning my name is????? and this urgent message for ( my name ). My office is trying to reach you in reference to a formal complaint that's about to be filed against you regarding case file D A ( random numbers ). In order to receive assistance and address this matter, it is important to contact the firm handling file at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and then calling in reference to file Please be advised this call has been logged and is proof you were notified of this matter and failure to respond or result in the firm moving forward without consent again that phone number is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I ignored the call thinking it was a spam until my son called me to inform me this company had called my ex-husband trying to contact me. So I returned the call. They knew all of my informationi, had my SSN, address and email. So I asked politely who they were. They said XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

They said that I had assists valuable enough to go through with pursuing a lawsuit against me : a home, vehicle, ect. 

They said I had an over {$6400.00} debt to Old National Bank from an account that closed nearly XXXX  years ago and needed to make a payment right now to avoid being a lawsuit and that they had served me at my current address, which I advised they I had not received any notices. Also, if I did not pay this now I would be served the next day. They offered me discount if I made the payment that day, which was {$2300.00}. Or I could come up with a partial payment and commit to a payment plan and pay the original total amount due. 

I asked for documentation of this debit and was told they did not have the document and I would have to go through the bank. They continued to harass me for payment with the threat of a lien on my car or house and/or jail. I am a XXXX XXXX on XXXX with limited income and several health issues. I was afraid and paid the amount. They also told me it would be reported to the credit bureau as paid in full. I did ask them why this debit was not on my credit report. I was told " I can not answers ''. Then I talked with my son and his girlfriend works for the bank in question and said it was a scam. I looked on line only to find a complaint with exactly the same threats on XXXX. This person also stated that telephone numbers on line do not match the firm. 

The more I thought about it, this made my sick to my stomach thinking I was scammed. I contacted the Better Business Bureau on XX/XX/year> and filed a complaint. My case is now closed as an " UNANSWERED '' complaint in their file. They had made several attempts to contact the business regarding the complaint, with no response. 

I am asking for your help with this matter. 

Thanking you in advance.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife and I have been engaged with Truist BANK and in particular their Client Resolution senior XXXX in their MORTGAGE DEPARTMENT for over a year for their improper payment of my real estate taxes. As a result of our disputing their payment of our real estate taxes, the issue escalated into over XXXX phone calls, several trips to the local Truist branch, requests to meet in person with any lawyer or bank executive, letter requests for information and finally requests for them to cease calling our home as we felt harassed. All this took place over our objection even though we never missed a payment or were late with a monthly payment. Some person acted without checking our status as senior citizen and unilaterally paid our taxes and that caused the chaos we have suffered through for more than a year.

I am over 80 years of age and they overwhelmed my wife and I with complicated calculations and demands for payment. We made payments and still wanted to dispute their actions but they continue to seek ways to inflict emotional distress rather than resolve the problem.

As we continue to try and resolve this, they keep adding on penalties and fees. I am sure their executives and chief legal counsel in charge of client resolution could not be aware of the pain and suffering that have been inflicted on us by their Client Resolution Specialists as well as violations of the consumer protection laws. If an executive of Truist or their attorney in Texas would just meet with us and review our communications with the senior specialists then I am sure this can be resolved before we take to social media and involve other government agencies or attorneys to assert our rights for the violations committed by their Client Resolution department.

We have not reached out to other government agencies as we hope your department can bring about the meeting we have requested. Truist actual said in writing they have no one to meet with us and their attorneys are too busy and not allowed to talk to us. I am sure the leadership of their organization would want to know how they treat their customers irrespective of our senior status.

I actually think the Client Resolution specialist department are protecting themselves by not escalating our requests for an in person meeting because we have the documentation to assert our claims above and expose their malfeasance and dereliction in meeting their obligations to consumers who are their customers.

I would hope their senior management would want to improve the process that we have had to deal with going forward. At the very least I would if I were in their position of leadership and trust I would want to understand what has taken place.

While we would like to get on with enjoying our retirement, I am not going to be denied the opportunity to educate their management and make the public aware of how Truist treated customers in our position. 
I hope you can assist us by getting the in person meeting and bring this information to light so that our outstanding issues are resolved. Please note that our payments on our mortgage are not in default because we did not want to risk foreclosure our lose our mortgage .Our concern and the treatment we received is more than about money at this stage. They need to correct how they deal with their customers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I attempted to make a cash deposit of {$850.00} into my Wells Fargo Checking account via the ATM located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. The ATM rejected {$200.00} ( Two {$100.00} Bills ) and my deposit total read {$650.00}, the ATM asked if I would like to submit anymore additional bills to my deposit. I flattened out the my two remaining {$100.00} bills and fed them back into the machine. The machine stated again that it could not accept the two bills and it would again be rejecting both of the TWO {$100.00} bills. However this time only ONE single {$100.00} bill came back out of the machine and the ATM deposit total still read {$650.00}. 

I immediately called the Wells Fargo ATM customer service support number and they opened a investigation on my behalf and a few days later gave me a credit for my {$100.00} bill. 

Over a month later on the week of XX/XX/year> I received notice that Wells Fargo had completed their investigation and they had determined the machine did not make any error and that they would be pulling the {$100.00} credit back out of my account. 

I called customer service again on XX/XX/year> to inquire about their investigation because clearly their had been a mistake. The customer service agent said that because the machine hadn't reported any error they closed the investigation and determined it had not incorrectly kept my {$100.00} bill. I asked if anyone had physically audited the machine to make sure the money inside matched what it showed for total deposits. The customer service agent said no. I asked what exactly were the steps they took to determine the machine did not incorrectly keep my {$100.00} bill. The agent told me she couldn't disclose that information fully but as the machine itself was not reporting that any error had been made that ultimately my claim was denied. I told the agent that relying on a machine to send back an appropriate error code when it had already incorrectly kept my bill didn't seem like a reliable investigation to that she had no answer for me. 

I find it very suspicious and bad business practice that Wells Fargo has come back well over a month later to deny my claim and then admitted that during the course of this time no one physically audited the machine ( as I have seen written online is typically how these matters are handled with other banks ). But that they simply rely on the machine itself to tell them if it is has made an error.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I have not received a validation response to my request for verification on the debt. you have not sent me designation or proof of ownership of the debt or identification of the original creditor and subsequent assignees of the debt. As you know under 15 USC 1692g ( a ) the CFPB recently increased the requirements of a debt collectors validation response to the following : Name and mailing information of the debt collector ; and Name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; and Account number ( if any ) associated with the debt ; and An itemization of the current amount of the debt that reflects interest, fees, payments, and credits since a particular date that you may be able to recognize or verify with records ; and, the current amount of the debt as of when the validation notice is provided. 
None of the above were provided to me. 

PURSUANT TO THE FDCPA, I WOULD LIKE THE FOLLOWING PROVIDED : 1. THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF THE ORIGINAL AND CURRENT CREDITOR 2. VERIFICATION OF THE DEBT AMOUNT THAT YOU ARE SEEKING TO COLLECT 3. ASSIGNMENT FROM THE ORIGINAL CREDITOR WITH MY NAME AND ORIGINAL ACCOUNT NUMBER ON THE ORIGINAL DEBT 4. ALL INFORMATION ON THE SECURITIZATION OF THE DEBT AND PROOF THE DEBT WAS ASSIGNED BACK TO UNDER FEDERAL LAW : Pursuant to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and 15 USC 1692g ( b ), you are required to cease and desist from collecting upon the debt ( including contacting a debtors credit ) until you properly validate and verify the debt amount. 
Please do not look at my credit or report anything to my credit reports as I dispute I owe this debt to you and that dispute should be stated on my credit report. Do not contact my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Unlawful Charges and Safety Concerns at XXXX XXXX  To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a series of incidents that occurred while I was residing at XXXX XXXX under the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, as well as subsequent issues related to unlawful charges being levied against me by the property management. 

In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, I was approved for relocation through the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, a government program designed to assist XXXX XXXX XXXX  in relocating to safer housing. The program required that I meet certain safety and living requirements, and I was approved prior to my move. I subsequently moved into an apartment at XXXX XXXX, with the understanding that my safety and well-being would be prioritized. 

During my two-month stay, I experienced multiple serious safety concerns that I reported to the property management office. Within the first 30 days of my residence, I discovered that a neighboring tenant was actively using XXXX which I could smell through the vents in my entire apartment. ( our units shared a wall ) I also observed that this tenant was engaging in peeping XXXX XXXX, as he was caught looking through my window on multiple occasions ( I was living in a studio with a single window, through which the entire apartment was visible ). 

Despite repeatedly reporting these issues to the office, I received no meaningful action or support. When I reported the neighbors behavior, I was advised by the property office to not involve the police. I also expressed my fear for my safety and requested to be relocated to a different unit on the property, as I felt vulnerable living alone as a XXXX woman and had already relocated for safety reasons. My request was denied, and I was left feeling unsafe and unsupported by management. 

The situation escalated further when the maintenance staff entered my apartment without prior notice or consent. When I inquired about this intrusion, I was told it was a " wellness check, '' though no one had requested such a check. This invasion of privacy was the final straw, and after two months of distress, I decided to vacate the unit.

I returned the keys and left the unit in its original condition, with no outstanding balance. However, nearly XXXX years later, I was informed that the property management was charging me for XXXX XXXX months of rent for a unit I had not occupied. Also left under Nevada Tenants Privacy and Landlord Harassment policies that are in place that allows me to vacate without any extra costs. So, I immediately contacted the office to dispute these charges, but the response I received was unprofessional and dismissive. I was told, " you will figure it out, '' and the staff became unreasonably aggressive and unhelpful. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter, as I believe I am being wrongfully charged by the property. I would also like to express my concerns regarding the failure of the property management to address the serious safety risks I faced during my time there, as well as the lack of adequate response when I reported these issues. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the CFPB will help ensure that my rights are protected and that the property management is held accountable for their actions.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint regarding Barclays USAs handling of my JetBlue credit card account ending in XXXX. Recently, Barclays unilaterally reduced my credit limit, which caused an immediate and significant increase in my credit utilization. As a result, my account was reported as " over the limit, '' which has severely impacted my credit profile and made it nearly impossible for me to obtain a debt consolidation loan. 

This action by Barclays not only led to an increased utilization rate but also negatively affected my payment history as reported on my consumer reports. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( c ), the law defines a " consumer report '' and excludes " transactions or experiences '' directly between the consumer and the furnisher. The FCRA was structured by Congress to ensure that such information, including utilization and payment history resulting directly from credit limit changes, is not automatically included in consumer reports. 

By reporting my utilization and payment experience resulting solely from their unilateral credit limit reduction, Barclays USA has effectively violated my rights under the FCRA. This reporting has led to unfair consequences and undermined my ability to responsibly manage my finances by affecting my eligibility for debt consolidation options. 

I am requesting that Barclays USA take corrective action in the following ways : Immediate Removal of this Account from All Consumer Reporting Agencies I request that Barclays cease all reporting of this account to the credit bureaus to comply with FCRA regulations regarding the exclusion of direct transactions or experiences. 

Adjust Utilization Reporting Alternatively, if Barclays intends to continue reporting this account, I request that they revise the utilization rate to reflect no more than 5 % utilization. This adjustment would better represent my financial responsibility and eliminate the damaging effects caused by Barclays decision to reduce my credit limit without consent. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I am hopeful that the CFPB will assist in ensuring Barclays USA upholds my rights under the FCRA and takes immediate corrective actions to address the harm caused by their actions.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: My main complaint is referring to the known predatory lender Credit Acceptance, as well as XXXX 's XXXX XXXX in XXXX PA XXXX XXXX County ). The first loan was made on XX/XX/XXXX, my husband and I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXhrough the lender stated above. We were required to pay a specific amount for down-payment in order to secure the loan because our credit scores were very low. The down payment was made in cash. The truck immediately had issues and some were repaired by XXXX XXXX  and some we had to cover. Fast forward to XX/XX/XXXX we once again needed to purchase a vehicle. We went back to XXXX XXXX  and used the same sales rep as before stating he would see what he could do. Once again we had to make a down-payment ( {$2000.00} cash ) and were able to secure another loan. This car also suffered failure within 29 days. I took the car back and that was fixed. A year later for inspection all XXXX tires failed with a tred of XXXX. When i was told this I called XXXX XXXX and demanded new tires and they stated " the vehicle was sold with legal tred ''. My mechanic stated otherwise. About XXXX of XXXX we realized we absolutely could not keep up on payments for the vehicles and found we were haggled. Comparing the exact same vehicles with XXXX XXXX XXXX we were way overcharged. Even our bank ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) stated we shouldn't have even been able to secure the XXXX loan let alone a XXXX. They referred to this as predatory lending. Our debt to income ratio was extremely high after obtaining second loan and impossible to pay all of mandory bills. When told this I personally called and spoke with sales rep we went through both times and was told there's nothing I can do. Credit Acceptance made different arrangements for both vehicles and we have been continuously changing them due to not being able to afford the loans. Credit Acceptance also uses threatening and abusive language regularly regarding missing and late payments. The most recent incident was Monday XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX, the Credit Acceptance representative who answered my call started yelling and screaming at me because he was " holding me accountable '' for back balance on the account that started in XX/XX/XXXX ( my car ). I expressed I was calling to try to get help with account and also stated why I couldn't pay next arrangement. XXXX continued his rage filled and nasty rant even though I repeatedly stated I was not going to speak with him anymore and to transfer me to another agent. He then replied by saying they will hold you accountable as well and would not transfer me. I hung up and called back tp speak with a new agent. I informed her about XXXX and she made a report to his supervisor. This agent told me if I paid {$350.00} today my car wouldn't be in danger of being repossessed. I explained I didn't even have that much money in my account. Then she said if I called tomorrow she couldn't guarantee the same plan as described above. Bottom line is Credit Acceptance and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  knew we couldn't afford these vehicles and still gave us the loans. Now our credit is absolutely horrible and have 2 years of " missed '' payments for both vehicles reported on our credit. We have made payments the whole time. The standard monthly payment plus additional money to lower back balance. Our bank has told us there is nothing they can even think of to do to help us. Credit Acceptance also expressed even if they did do repossessions of vehicles they will come after us for remaining balances after vehicles are taken to auction and possibly court action. Also, an arbitration agreement was included in sales but is not clear and was not explicitly explained. This is not the first case against Credit Acceptance. They need shut down for their predatory practices. Telling customers they are guaranteed to be approved for a loan every time is exactly how they got my husband and I. I would like to point out the APR is insanely high and I also was not made aware that it would make the monthly APR payments different each month. Some were {$73.00} and some I have recently discovered were in the {$300.00} range. Credit Acceptance also stated that they will not refinance your loan and upon researching refinancing options, no lender would even consider it because Credit Acceptance was the current loan holder. Included in this complaint is a copy of sale from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Credit Acceptance, my husband, and myself. Complaint also filed with Pennsylvania Office of Attorney General.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: WEST LAKE FINANCIAL is in violation of multiple laws set forth by Congress in regards to the following account # XXXX ] 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the person ( WEST LAKE FINANCIAL ) making the report. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) states that A person ( WEST LAKE FINANCIAL ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( ME ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. WEST LAKE FINANCIAL can not collect on a discharged debt. This is now considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes reporting of this account inaccurate! I provided a screenshot from the IRS website. By Definition, the IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is inaccurate. I never received a 1099-C from WEST LAKE FINANCIAL for the cancelled debt of { { {$37000.00} } in order to file as ordinary income. Where is my 1099-C WEST LAKE FINANCIAL is clearly writing off debt with the IRS without sending out 1099-C as required by the IRS for debts greater than { { {$600.00} } }. This is unsatisfactory! WEST LAKE FINANCIAL has been HEREBY PUT ON NOTICE that they are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. In WEST LAKE FINANCIAL terms and conditions they agreed not to share my information with non affiliates.equifax, XXXX and XXXX is not an affiliate of WEST LAKE FINANCIAL nor are they " bureaus ''. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and non verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant 15 U.S. Code section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. WEST LAKE FINANCIAL must also refund the remaining balance of the consumer account upon its termination. This is your 7 day notice to return ALL money due from this consum er account. XXXX Treatment of credit balances ; account termination. ( a ) Credit balances. When a credit balance in excess of { { {$1.00} } } is created on a credit account ( through transmittal of funds to a creditor in excess of the total balance due on an account, through rebates of unearned finance charges or insurance premiums, or through amounts otherwise owed to or held for the benefit of the consumer ), the creditor shall : ( XXXX ) Credit the amount of the credit balance to the consumer 's account ; ( XXXX ) Refund any part of the remaining credit balance within seven business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer ; ( 3 ) Make a good faith effort to refund to the consumer by cash, check, or money order, or credit to a deposit account of the consumer, any part of the credit balance remaining in the account for more than six months. No further action is required if the consumer 's current location is not known to the creditor and can not be traced through the consumer 's last known address or telephone number. ( b ) Account termination. ( XXXX ) A creditor shall not terminate an account prior to its expiration date solely because the consumer does not incur a finance charge. ( XXXX ) Nothing in paragraph ( b ) ( XXXX ) of this section prohibits a creditor from terminating an account that is inactive for three or more consecutive months. An account is inactive for purposes of this paragraph if no credit has been extended ( such as by purchase, cash advance or balance transfer ) and if the account has no outstanding balance. ( c ) Timely settlement of estate debts ( XXXX ) General rule. ( i ) Reasonable policies and procedures required. For credit card accounts under an open-end ( not home-secured ) consumer credit plan, card issuers must adopt reasonable written policies and procedures designed to ensure that an administrator of an estate of a deceased accountholder can determine the amount of and pay any balance on the account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Application to joint accounts. Paragraph ( c ) of this section does not apply to the account of a deceased consumer if a joint accountholder remains on the account. ( XXXX ) Timely statement of balance ( i ) Requirement. Upon request by the administrator of an estate, a card issuer must provide the administrator with the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account in a timely manner. ( ii ) Safe harbor. For purposes of paragraph ( c ) ( XXXX ) ( i ) of this section, providing the amount of the balance on the account within 30 days of receiving the request is deemed to be timely. ( XXXX ) Limitations after receipt of request from administrator ( i ) Limitation on fees and increases in annual percentage rates. After receiving a request from the administrator of an estate for the amount of the balance on a deceased consumer 's account, a card issuer must not impose any fees on the account ( such as a late fee, annual fee, or over-the-limit fee ) or increase any annual percentage rate, except as provided by 1026.55 ( b ) ( 2 ). ( ii ) Limitation on trailing or residual interest. A card issuer must waive or rebate any additional finance charge due to a periodic interest rate if payment in full of the balance disclosed pursuant to paragraph ( c ) ( 2 ) of this section is received within 30 days after disclosure.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I identified an unknown payment made from my Bill Pay service to a XXXX XXXX from a shared Wells Fargo acct. for {$1600.00}. All account holders spoke with a Wells Fargo fraud agent that day & found out that someone hacked into my online banking profile, sometime before XX/XX/XXXX and added XXXX unknown Payees ( XXXX XXXX & XXXX XXXX ) to my bill pay service in order to pay off credit cards. XXXX XXXX set up payment for a XXXX  XXXX credit card from the shared checking account and XXXX XXXX set up payment for a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX credit card from my personal checking account. The {$1600.00} payment was initiated on XX/XX/XXXX & completed on XX/XX/XXXX. The Wells Fargo XXXX assured us that no payment had been made to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX credit card, assured us that she would delete all payees, make a fraud claim for the stolen {$1600.00} payment to XXXX XXXX & temporarily revoked my online banking access for security purposes. On XX/XX/XXXX I called Wells Fargo to reinstate my online banking access & found out that neither fraudulent payee had been removed from my " Bill Pay '' service, as I was initially promised and another fraudulent payment of {$5000.00} had been made on XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX credit card. During that call, The Wells Fargo agent remove the payees & made an additional claim for the stolen {$5000.00}. I made a third call to the bank on XX/XX/XXXX, to follow up on the progress of my claim. During that call the fraud agent informed me that the claim had been denied but that the initial phone call was set to be reviewed, so all hope was not lost. He also informed me that during my initial call on XX/XX/XXXX, the agent should have immediately closed my account and transferred my funds to a new one. As this was never done, the agent proceeded to close my personal checking account and transferred my remaining funds to a new checking account and filed a complaint on my behalf for the mishandling of the initial claim. 

I went into a local branch in XXXX, XXXX and met with the bank manager who was shocked at my story and worked with me to submit another statement of information on my behalf and encouraged me to file a police report. I then filed a police report with the XXXX, XXXX police department for both claims. Submitted them to all three banks involved. I also spoke to my complaint representative who saw many irregularities in the way the payees were added, as it appeared they were added and payments were initiated on the same day, which is not typically possible through the bill pay system. There was also no email sent to me notifying me that bill payees had been added like the the wells fargo system typically will do automatically. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was sent an email from my Wells Fargo customer complaint advocate that Wells Fargo had denied my claim again, stating that this was not fraud and that it appeared that me or someone I know added these payees with my login credentials. I am reporting this here now as I have found out that many others have experienced this exact same fraudulent scenario and Wells Fargo will not stand by them either, aside from one case I discovered that was reported to the CFPB. This is my final hope for a just resolution and an attempt to inspire others to report these incidences so that Wells Fargo can be held accountable to standing behind its customers as any trusted financial institution should.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Experian for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX. 
Despite multiple requests for correction, my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
XXXX. FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case. 
Additionally XXXX and XXXX reflect that all payments on this account were made on time, with no late payments reported. However, Experian continues to indicate that there were late payments on this account. This inconsistency is adversely affecting my credit standing, as Experian is the only bureau reporting a negative payment history on this account. 
I am entitled to have inaccurate information removed from my credit report. Given that both XXXX and XXXX have confirmed that my payments were made on time, I request that Experian align my report to accurately reflect my positive payment history. Please investigate this matter and update my report to remove the erroneous late payment status. 

XXXX. TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act emphasizes the necessity for accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The inaccurate reporting of late payments has caused undue harm to my creditworthiness. 

3. Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act ( PAANL ) : This act reinforces the responsibility of creditors to provide timely statements, preventing unfair penalties to consumers. 


I am formally requesting that the inaccurate late payment notation be removed from my credit report immediately. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>2024 I wrote to SYNCB/AMAZON XXXX via USPS Certified Mail , `XXXX requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( section 1692g ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with XXXX XXXX XXXX Administrative Code ( section 20-493.2 ). XXXX XXXX XXXX regulations require all debt XXXX to send specific written documentation validating the debt. Under section 2-190 of the Rules of the City of New York , validation requires all of the following : Proof of my agreement to pay the original creditor ; A copy of the final account statement issued by the original creditor ; A breakdown of the total amount due, showing principal, interest, and other charges ; and For all other charges, the date of and basis for each charge. 

SYNCB/AMAZON XXXX received my letter and signed for it at XXXX XXXX  on XXXX XXXX, 2024 ( see USPS Tracking printout attached ) to which I received no reply. 

On XX/XX/year>2024 I wrote to SYNCB/AMAZON XXXX for the 2nd time via USPS Certified Mail, informing them of their failure to place a notice of dispute on my account within 30 days as required by federal law, citing the FCRA and FDCPA laws and even enclosing a printout of 623 - 15 U.S.C 1681s-2 clearly defining a data furnishers duty to provide notice of dispute within 30 days. 

I received a reply from SYNCB/AMAZON XXXX on or around XX/XX/scrub>, 2024, stating " no physical copy of the application is available ... '' and that the account was " charged off as a loss... and sold off to XXXX ... since [ SYNCB/AMAZON XXXX ] have reported accurate... are unable to delete or modify the status as reported '' totally ignoring their violation of Federal law which compels them, as a data furnisher, to add a notice of dispute within the timeframe required by law. This appears to be gross negligence and disregard for the law and for affected consumers like myself nationwide. If they are unwilling to cooperate, hopefully the CFPB and US Attorney General can induce a correction of their behavior.

Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Sub-issue: Talked to a third-party about your debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Formal Complaint Against ProCollect , Inc . Multiple Violations of Consumer Protection Laws and XXXX XXXX Compliance To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against ProCollect , Inc., regarding their egregious violations of federal consumer protection laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and XXXX XXXX Compliance Guidelines, related to an alleged debt that they reported to the credit bureaus without following proper legal protocols. Their actions are not only unlawful but have caused me significant harm, including undue stress, credit denials, and reputational damage. 

Violations Committed by ProCollect 1. Failure to Provide Initial Communication Before Reporting ( FDCPA and CFPB Debt Collection Rule ) 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( a ) of the FDCPA requires that debt collectors provide a written notice of the debt within five days of the initial communication, detailing the amount, creditor, and my rights to dispute or request validation. ProCollect failed to send any written notice prior to reporting this alleged debt.

The CFPB Debt Collection Rule mandates that debt collectors must contact the consumer before furnishing information to credit bureaus and wait at least 14 days to ensure their communication was not returned as undeliverable. ProCollect did not attempt to contact me prior to reporting this fraudulent account, violating this requirement.

2. Failure to Validate Debt Before Verification ( FDCPA 1692g ( b ) ) After I disputed the alleged debt, ProCollect claimed to have verified it without providing proper validation as required by law. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
General Obligation : Commencing on or around XX/XX/year>, I fell victim to a multi-layered scam operation run by XXXX which involved me making deposits for a total amount of XXXX USD from my Bank of America account to fraudulent investment firm ( XXXX ). 
I was looking for a job, so I decided to put my resume on XXXX. Then, someone contacted me and offered me a job. The job description was that they were doing reviews for the company called COMPLAINT FOR DAMAGES AND OTHER RELIEF Page 2 of 6 XX/XX/year> Page 2 of 6 XXXX operating under the domain - XXXX. At first, I thought this was legit, and the scammers convinced me that this was an easy way to earn money, which I needed at the moment. 
For that reason, I thought this was a good idea. 
I would've never sent the funds if I was aware that this could happen. I didnt know that there are criminals tricking people like this, and the bank did nothing to warn me about this and inform me of the risks involved. 

When determining whats reasonable and fair, we should focus on the issue of liability ; common queries include, but are not limited to, the following ( i ) whether Bank of America did not take notice of any rule, law, or regulation, and/or possibly missed any material elements of the relevant bylaws or codes of conduct, that may have prevented them from protecting my financial safety ; ( ii ) whether by virtue of Bank of Americas custodianship over my funds or by its control over them, they owed a fiduciary duty to the me and if so, whether that duty was breached ; ( iii ) whether Bank of America promoted the transaction ( s ) in question despite being aware of the nature of the transaction ( s ) in question ( iv ) whether Bank of America was in compliance with its own policies and procedures ; ( v ) whether Bank of America owed duties to myself, what the scope of those duties was, and whether Bank of America did not uphold those duties ; ( vi ) whether Bank of Americas conduct was unfair ; and ( vii ) whether Bank of America has within its power the ability to, and should, compensate me for the harm that has befallen me. 
Upon identification of such unusual or suspicious activity, it is crucial that the relevant staff member adequately describe the factors making an activity or transaction suspicious, thoroughly depict the extent and nature of this activity and properly communicate to the customer that such activity meets the relevant criteria of fraud. 
In providing its services to a customer, a financial institution is required by law to exercise the care and skill of a diligent, prudent banker. In this case, this means that the payment service provider should not turn a blind eye to known facts pointing to a real possibility that their customer is being scammed. In other words, Bank of America must have had special knowledge of what was occurring or been alerted to a real possibility of fraud taking place. The financial institution must have known or reasonably ought to have known that I was dealing with a scammer. 
Granted, there is room for diversity of view insofar as reasonableness is concerned. Indeed, there is a sense in which the standard of care of the reasonable person involves in its application a subjective element. 
However, it must be remembered that the correct test is always reasonable care in all circumstances, not average care. The fact that most people behave in a certain way may be good evidence that the conduct is reasonable, but this is not necessarily the case. Although reasonableness is a very fluid concept, all of the evidence suggests that Bank of America did not foresee the fraud and disregarded even the most obvious dangers in this respect. 
Situations do tend to repeat themselves and it is advisable to examine previous outcomes to see how the standard of the reasonable person should be applied, and that lessons can be learnt from the errors of the past.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Citibank Most recently I called XXXX and spoke to a representative named XXXX. I asked him to speak to a manager. He told me that one of my security questions failed, which was what is your mothers maiden name. I said XXXX that is her maiden name. He told me that was incorrect. I asked him was there anything else I could confirm to be able to speak to a manager, long story short, he did not connect me with a manager and hung up on me. 
I have had nothing but difficulties with basic banking needs going back to last year when I attempted to do business with them the first time. I opened an account and encountered many issues in just establishing my pin and accessing online services. I called several times and spoke to different representatives And everything they told me did not work. Under frustration I set it aside. This year when I attempted to use my Citibank account, I was informed that my account was closed. That was the first time I heard that : I never got any emails nor mail correspondence for statements or in regards to the closing of my account plus the 25 that I deposited, when I open the account was eaten up by fees and Closed. 
At that time, I opened a new account and have run into the same issues. I keep getting transferred over and over again. Everybody says something different. One time I was actually transferred to a manager and she told me that I could obtain my account number at a branch. I accepted that and got off the phone when I looked for branches near me. There are none. She was not knowledgeable enough to look at my address and know that they had no branches in XXXX. 
Once I attempted to use my new card at the gas station, It didnt work, I was on The phone for 20 minutes. The representative assured me that the card was active I got off the phone and attempted to pump my gas and it did not work. When I called about the card, they told me that I needed to order a new one, even though I had just received that one and when I received the new one CVC code was CIL. AGAIN! I just so happened to be on the phone with a representative because my XXXX wont work And ask him why my new card had CIL as the CVC code and he informed me that is because this is only an ATM card. I had no idea. And with all the calls I made about the card no representative informed me And every representative that I talked to in regards to this did not pick up on the fact that it was only an ATM card. Nobody told me. I can not understand why I would not be issued a debit card That is also an ATM card?? Very confused? Before my direct deposit came in I was charged for checks and it put my account in the negative. When I establish the account over the phone with a live representative, I was told that those checks would be free. When I called to ask why I had been charged, the representative told me that they no longer issue free checks. When I informed her that the live representative that set up the account said they were free she went ahead and issued a refund.. Whenever I call, I get transferred over and over and have to repeat myself over and over. Today when I asked the first person, I spoke to inform the new representative that I have already identified myself and explained the situation and could he tell the next representative what was going on? He said OK. And did another cold transfer. The level of customer service is unhelpful, ubknowledgeable, and rude. Nobody knows anything, and even when I was in distress and trying to speak to a manager, the representative hung up on me TODAY! XXXX XXXX. Every single thing that is normal for a bank account. I have to call them and inquire on why mine isnt working. XXXX is not working right now. Every time I try to use it it says that my account says its unavailable due to my current account status. My account status is active and there are funds in my account. I set my direct deposit to be sent here and in order to access my funds. I have to transfer to my other bank because none of this other access points are available. Overall Consistently Citibank fails in the services in the knowledge of the representatives and being Able to identify and resolve issues. I am totally dissatisfied with my experience as it continues to be poor. With the amount of problems I have incurred I am surprised that they are still in business. They should not be rated as one of the top financial institutions.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> FirstSource Advantage , LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX Subject : Final Demand for Verification and Removal Due to Inaccurate Reporting Dear To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal and final demand for FirstSource Advantage , LLC, to provide adequate verification of the alleged debt and cease reporting it to any credit bureaus if validation is not provided. This request is made under my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. 

I previously requested validation of this alleged debt and expected a response in compliance with the FDCPA, which mandates providing sufficient verification and details beyond a mere bill statement. The law requires the original creditors identity, amount owed, and validation that this debt belongs to me. Providing a statement or account summary does not fulfill these requirements, nor does it substantiate the accuracy of the debt. 

As FirstSource Advantage has failed to provide proper validation, I demand that : All inaccurate information be removed from my credit report within 15 days of this letter, as its continued reporting constitutes a violation of the FCRA and may result in damages to my creditworthiness. 

No further contact be made with me about this alleged debt, as outlined under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ) of the FDCPA. I hereby issue a formal cease-and-desist on all communications regarding this matter. 

Failure to comply will leave me no choice but to file a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state attorney generals office. Additionally, I reserve the right to pursue all available legal remedies for violations, including damages under 15 U.S.C. 1692k. 

Please consider this letter as my final demand to resolve this matter amicably. I expect prompt and full compliance to prevent escalation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the repossession and charge-off entry related to the auto lease with Hyundai Finance ( Account Number : XXXX ), currently reported on my credit report. The entry shows a balance of {$8100.00}, and indicates a repossession was conducted in [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ]. 

According to UCC Article 9, specifically Section 9-613, a secured party is required to provide the debtor with a Notice of Sale prior to the sale of the repossessed vehicle. To date, I have not received such a notice. As a result, I believe that the repossession entry on my credit report is inaccurate and does not comply with the legal requirements set forth under UCC Article 9, which mandates that the debtor be notified before the sale of repossessed property.

In light of this, I am requesting the following from Hyundai Finance or the credit reporting agency : 1.Proof of the Notice of Sale that was sent to me regarding the sale of the repossessed vehicle.

2. The exact date and method by which the notice was sent to me.

3. A copy of the sale or disposition of the vehicle, if the property was indeed sold.

Since the repossession and charge-off appear to be in violation of my legal rights under the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) Article 9, and since I never received the required Notice of Sale, I respectfully request that this entry be investigated and either corrected or removed from my credit report.

Please provide the requested documentation or correct the account information in accordance with UCC Section 9-613. If I do not receive this documentation within the required 30-day period, I will consider this entry inaccurate and will take further action to have it removed.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to investigate the accuracy of this information within 30 days. Please confirm the outcome of your investigation to me in writing.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

18 U.S. Code 1581 : Makes it illegal to hold someone in peonage, or debt servitude, by using force, threats, or legal coercion. It also prohibits obstructing the enforcement of this law.

42 U.S. Code 1994 : Abolishes peonage and declares null and void any laws that establish or enforce it.

18 U.S. Code 1593A : Prohibits financially benefiting from peonage or slavery.

A tender of payment has been submitted to and received by US Bank.

UCC 3-603 Tender of Payment. 
( b ) If tender of payment of an obligation to pay an instrument is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument and the tender is refused, there is discharge, to the extent of the amount of the tender, of the obligation of an indorser or accommodation party having a right of recourse with respect to the obligation to which the tender relates.

UCC 3-604 Discharge by Cancellation or Renunciation.

( a ) A person entitled to enforce an instrument, with or without consideration, may discharge the obligation of a party to pay the instrument ( i ) by an intentional voluntary act, such as surrender of the instrument to the party, destruction, mutilation, or cancellation of the instrument, cancellation or striking out of the party 's signature, or the addition of words to the instrument indicating discharge, or ( ii ) by agreeing not to sue or otherwise renouncing rights against the party by a signed record.

The Constitution Article 1 Section 10 states : No state shall make Anything but gold and silver coin a tender of payment of debts. 
From House Joint Resolution XXXX, On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX enacted XXXX to suspend the gold standard and to abrogate the gold clause. This resolution declared that " Whereas the holding or dealing in gold affect the public interest and are therefore subject to proper regulation and restriction ; and whereas the existing emergency has disclosed that provisions of obligations which purport to give the obligee a right to require payment in gold or a particular kind of coin or currency... are inconsistent with the declared policy of congress... in the payment of debts. 
This resolution declared that any obligation requiring " payment in gold or a particular kind of coin or currency, or in an amount in money policy ; and... Every obligation heretofore or hereafter incurred, shall be discharged upon payment, dollar for dollar, in any coin or currency which at the time of payment is legal tender for public and private debts. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : MONEY. In usual and ordinary acceptation it means gold, silver, or paper money used as circulating medium of exchange, And does not embrace notes, bonds, evidences of debt, or other personal or real estate. 
Bills of Exchange Act ( definitions ) Bill means bill of exchange, and note means promissory note.

US Bank has access to The Federal Reserve Window. 
The Federal Reserve Act section 16 ( 2 ) states : 2. Application for notes by Federal Reserve banks Any Federal Reserve bank may make application to the local Federal Reserve agent for such amount of the Federal Reserve notes hereinbefore provided for as it may require. Such application shall be accompanied with a tender to the local Federal Reserve agent of collateral in amount equal to the sum of the Federal Reserve notes thus applied for and issued pursuant to such application. The collateral security thus offered shall be notes, drafts, bills of exchange, or acceptances. 
It is very odd that no one from US Bank has responded back to the letter of Default or to my registered security Payoff and Legal Notice, except for this default threat of foreclosure.

18 U.S. Code 1581 Makes it illegal to hold someone in peonage, or debt servitude, by using force, threats, or legal coercion. It also prohibits obstructing the enforcement of this law.

22 CFR 92.36 Authentication defined. 
An authentication is a certification of the genuineness of the official character, i.e., signature and seal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX my husband received a fraud alert from USAA that stated two people we did not know had been added to his banking profile. We called in to the main USAA number ( XXXX ) and were told that someone unauthorized had accessed one or more of our accounts, but they would not provide any specific information. The person we initially talked to took a fraud report, but we were cut off when they transferred us. I called in and spoke to another representative who froze our accounts and walked us through changing our PINS and passwords. We were told the fraud department would launch an investigation and would contact us right away. In the meantime we would have no access to our accounts. They said this would take XXXX days. We would only be able to gain information by calling in ( we can not see anything on online banking ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX my husband I seperately talked to XXXX in the fraud department. We were asked a lot of questions about whether we had shared our account information, clicked on potentially fraudulent links, talked to someone other than USAA. We had not done any of those things. When I pressed her for more information, XXXX told me that two people unknown to us had been added to two of our joint accounts. That person had deposited a {$100000.00} check and then sent our wire transers for the same amount to unknown accounts. They were also added to a Savings account but took no action.

When I asked what our liabiity was in this situation she was cagey with me and said it depended on what they found in their investigation. I looked up the information and learned that the bank is responsible unless we authorized the transaction, which we most certainly did not. 

On XXXX I followed up with the fraud department, concerned that the payments I sent out via bill pay for our mortgage and XXXX bills would not be paid. I was assured that those checks had been sent and would be honored. On XXXX I received a notice that our gas bill had not been paid because XXXX was denied the funds. I also received notice of an overdraft for insufficient funds on the account where the fraud was committed. 

Now ( a week later ) all of our accounts are frozen, we have no access to our money, can not pay our bills and USAA has not notified us of the results of their " investigation. '' We have been USAA members for 30 years and our accounts have always been in good standing. We have several checking accounts, a savings account, CD and annuity with them. They also handle our auto insurance. When my husband called in to check the status of the investigation, he was told that they were leaning towards blaming us for the {$100000.00} fraud. 

What doesn't make sense to us : WHY did USAA allow someone to add themselves to my husband 's profile as a relative without contacting us for permission? 
WHY did USAA allow this fraudster to deposit a {$100000.00} bad check in our account and then send out immediate transfers? When we have deposited a large check in the past we have had to wait for funds to clear before being able to access the funds. This is bad business practice on their part. 

After 30 years with USAA, we are being treated like criminals. We can't access our accounts and no one is communicating with us, unless they are trying to trick us into saying something incriminating that makes this our fault. I used to think USAA was a great company, but his experience has changed my mind.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I applied for a construction loan with XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX around XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX of the requirements to be approved was to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, therefore I hired XXXX XXXX and XXXX. The construction of the house began in XX/XX/XXXX. Throughout the process oXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX submitted to XXXX XXXX  requesting funds to be released to finance the project. Draw requests were forms that were to be signed by both XXXX XXXX and XXXX and I, in order for XXXX XXXX  to disburse the funds. In XX/XX/XXXX, after putting information in chronological order due to the breach of contract and thinking of seeking legal matters against XXXX XXXX and XXXX, I realized that XXXX out of the XXXX draw requests that were approved from the bank had a forged signature, and that XXXX that were sent to me by the XXXX to sign, only XXXX had been submitted. I immediately contacted XXXX XXXX  to notify them of my findings, and they advised me to seek legal advice. Thereafter, a police report was made ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 

Due to the negligence and breach of contract from RXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXhe lack and unavailability of finishing the XXXX, I was forced to seek remedy and hire a competent General XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX  also made it a requirement to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX able to disburse the remanding funds left in the construction loan. A couple months went by, and the XXXX  was complete ( XX/XX/XXXX ). XXXX XXXX XXXX and I submitted the last draw request to XXXX XXXX, and XXXX Disbursed the remaining funds of {$74000.00} in XX/XX/XXXX from the construction loan. I attempted to cash the check at XXXX XXXX  XXXX, with both XXXX XXXX XXXX signature and my own ; however, XXXX XXXX  refused to cash the check and educated me on what avenues I had to take to cash a joint check with proper endorsement. Thanks to the education that XXXX Bank provided me on cashing a joint check, I went back to my records to review the form of payments that were disbursed and realized that XXXX XXXX and XXXX received the disbursement via XXXX joint checks. I reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, to make them aware of the forgery and asked for a copy of the back of the cashed checks. On XXXX XXXX I received the copy of the back of these checks and found that these checks were cashed with a forged endorsement and/or missing endorsement. 

On XXXX XXXX a notarized forgery affidavit of check fraud was completed at a XXXX XXXX  location. On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX check fraud claim analyst reached out to me to begin the investigation. It was found that Well Fargo Bank was the bank that cashed these checks and neglected their due diligence when cashing XXXX joint checks. Per the back-and-forth conversation XXXX Bank was going XXXX XXXX Well Fargo liable for the checks. On XX/XX/XXXX, my attorney and I received a letter that was sent to the owner of Reliable Construction and Design that funds were going to be withdraw from his account because XXXX XXXX  XXXX requested reimbursement because Forged Endorsement, however I never received any funds. As of XX/XX/XXXX, I, have not received payment from Wells Fargo bank. Per California law, a check that is payable to XXXX parties with an and in between the payees ' names that is cashed without proper and verifiable endorsement, finds that the depository bank is liable to reimburse for this negligence. 

Because of the banks failure to comply with the California law, my family and I experienced loss of earnings, economical, emotional and mental distress.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Back In XXXX I requested Credit Acceptance Corp to repo my XXXX XXXX XXXX, because it would not pass XXXX XXXX even after putting over {$2000.00} into it. When I registered it I had transferred the plates from another vehicle and the registration was due to be renewed. With out the vehicle passing NY state inspection they will not allow you to renew a registration. There for the vehicle could not be used.A week after my Husband purchased the vehicle the check engine light came on We took it to the dealer who apparently only reset it cuz the light came right back on. Over and over we requested that they come and get it. They never did they never even attempted to. In the XXXX of XXXX Ny you are not aloud to have an unregistered vehicle in your driveway or yard so we put the XXXX in the garage so we would not be fined. Credit acceptance claims they tried to repo the vehicle for over a year but never once came to our home which we have lived in for 30 years. They never once knocked on our door. They never once went to my place of employment. They are crooks and liars. 
Back in XXXX of XXXX they took it to the Supreme Court XXXX XXXX and got my wages garnished 4 years after they were told to come and get it. This vehicle was still sitting in my garage unregistered since XXXX. And they garnished my wages for almost {$14.00}. 
Had they of repoed the vehicle the bill would not of been that high. In XXXX of XXXX I received the discharge of lien they claim they sent me because of already having the judgement against me. But the Lawyer for Credit acceptance told me straight out they sent me the discharge of Lien because they did not want to repo the vehicle. 
Some one is lieing and trying to cover there XXXX. 
I guess what they didnt seem to take into consideration is me quitting my job and them not being able to garnish my wages. They cant get a new garnishment because they no longer have the Lien to hold against me.

Theres also the fact that I was the co signer on the vehicle and never once did they try to collect the money from the buyer. 
I need this garnishment stopped I am the soul provider for my household and its affecting my whole life. Currently I am being evicted from my home of 30 years because I cant keep up with bills ext because of this garnishment I guess my next step will be quitting my job and collecting social services or going bankrupt because of this company. 
I need them to stop sending false information to my XXXX just 2 days ago I had a decrease on my credit score cuz they claimed I didnt pay {$160.00} dollars to credit acceptance when they have my wages garnished. I called Citi about this 3 different times and they would not give me any information on when it is processed or why it is missing. I will include my deposit statements and account opening proof. I will also include the promotion that I meet all activities for. I am very upset with Citi and do not want to bank with them again. This whole experience has been awful and I just want my bonus so I can not bank with XXXX and keep being faced with lies/ignorance. 

Also, Citi has a mobile banking app feature to check your bonus status and promotions. It seems that either Citi app or some employee has switched the active ongoing promotion from my account to a different one that I never signed up for. Images included.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
1. Incorrect Name : The name listed on this account is incorrect. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. As this is a material error, I request the immediate correction of the name associated with this account to reflect the correct details. Please update this entry accordingly.

2. Multiple Charge-Off Entries : Additionally, I have noticed that the account has been reported as charged off multiple times, which is an error. Under FCRA 605 and FCRA 623, a charge-off can only be reported once. The repeated reporting of charge-offs on this account is misleading and inaccurate.

As per FCRA 605, charge-offs are a one-time event and should only be listed once. The repeated reporting of charge-offs violates the guidelines set forth by the FCRA, as it misrepresents the status of the account.

I request that the multiple charge-off entries be corrected by ensuring that only one charge-off is reported for this account.

Request for Immediate Investigation : In accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681i of the FCRA, I request a thorough investigation into both of these issues. Please provide proof from the creditor regarding the date and legitimacy of the charge-off ( s ) and ensure that the account is reported accurately, with the proper name and a single charge-off entry.

If the creditor can not substantiate the multiple charge-offs or correct the name, I request that the inaccurate entries be removed from my credit report. Please send me an updated copy of my credit report showing the corrections made as I requested XX/XX/year> Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely resolution of this dispute.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX  Credit Bureau Associates XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX Subject : Demand for Verification and Immediate Removal of Inaccurate Information Dear Credit Bureau Associates, I am writing to formally demand that you verify and substantiate the accuracy of the information reported on my credit report, pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681. This information, which has been reported inaccurately by Credit Bureau Associates, is causing undue harm to my credit profile, and I am requesting an immediate investigation into the following : Verification of Debt and Creditor Information I demand that you provide documentation and verification of the alleged debt, including the full name, contact information, and proof of ownership by the creditor. I am requesting evidence of the original agreement and a detailed account history to verify that the information reported is both accurate and verifiable. 

Immediate Removal of Inaccurate Information As per the FCRA, you are required to ensure the highest standards of accuracy and completeness in credit reporting. Failure to verify or provide proof within 30 days constitutes a violation under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which mandates deletion of inaccurate or unverifiable information. Due to the lack of verifiable documentation on this item, I demand its immediate removal from my credit report. 

Cease and Desist Communication Additionally, I am formally requesting that Credit Bureau Associates cease all forms of communication with me regarding this account, as mandated by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ). Any further attempts to communicate regarding this debt will be viewed as a violation of federal law, and I reserve the right to pursue legal action if this request is not respected. 

Please confirm in writing the results of your investigation and any actions taken, including the name and contact information of a responsible agent at your organization who will oversee this matter. Failure to respond in good faith will result in my taking further legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. 

This letter serves as an official and final notice. I look forward to a prompt response and resolution. You may contact me at the address listed above, or by email if further clarification is needed. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
