Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>, I mailed two personal checks in two different envelopes to two different tax authorities ( IRS / U.S. Treasury, and the Colorado Dept. of Revenue ) on the same day from a local XXXX XXXX XXXX. The checks were stolen out of the postal system, altered, and cashed by a criminal. It should be noted that while the checks themselves were altered, the amounts of the checks were not altered. The check made payable to the Treasury was for {$63000.00} and the check made payable to the Colo. Dept. of Revenue was for {$12000.00}. 

These two checks were estimated quarterly tax payments made voluntarily by me using personal funds in my USAA Federal Savings Bank checking account. I was not paying tax bills. That is important to note because when the IRS and the Colo. Dept. of Revenue did not receive my quarterly payments, they had no obligation to notify me of that. So, when the checks I wrote cleared my bank account, I believed it was because the IRS and Colo. Dept. of Revenue had received the money when in fact they never received the money and did not tell me. 

I was alerted to the crime by the XXXX XXXX XXXX months after it happened. I immediately notified my bank USAA and provided them bank with copies of all the criminal investigation reports available. USAA refunded {$63000.00} to me, but refused to refund {$12000.00} to me, saying my request for a refund was outside their 60 day window for making such requests. 

While I'm grateful to have my {$63000.00} back, I don't see why I was allowed to have that amount refunded and be refused a refund of {$12000.00} when everything happened at the same time. I asked USAA how to appeal their decision but my request was ignored.

as alleged in your demand letter.

This Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. Now this situation in its self is very complicated and I understand there were multiple times I couldve done something to change my fate but unfortunately Im very young with no prior understanding of a lease or what it means to not pay certain things. In XXXX of 2023 The complex reached out to me as an act to discuss my balance of {$200.00} that I had inquired in late fees or just a payment I didnt make in XXXX. Nonetheless when I returned in XXXX after the break I went to the office and spoke to the manager. She advice me that XXXX   XXXX had this one time waiver fee that would give me the {$200.00} I paid back to me. But in order to do that I had to pay that plus XXXX rent. They also advise me that any late fees I rack up in that time will be covered because I signed that form. Everything had to be payed by the last day in XXXX. I informed her of my financial situation and she instead that this would be a good idea and I should just make sure my school and job pay me on time. I worked in XXXX and I was expected to get payed before the due date of when I needed to pay the money to the apartment. I was in the clear with my job but unfortunately the amount they were going to pay me wasnt enough and I still wouldve been short. I told her and she asked me to ask friends and family and see if anyone would help me. I know trust a few friends and family to ask for money and unfortunately they all didnt have it I even had people who owed me money still and I asked them for the money they owed me and none of them could or would give it back at that time. The other issue was my school I called them to see when I was going to get my refund money but they informed me that because I already have my school payed for they can give me my money sooner and that it would be sent to me on XX/XX/XXXX which was 2 days after the date XXXX  XXXX and I agreed on. I informed XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX manager ) about the situation. I asked her if I could just pay with the money I currently have which was around {$800.00} and but amount I needed to pay was {$1000.00} I believe and she said the form I signed would t be null void and they wouldnt pay me the {$200.00} back or cover the late fees Ive gather and I would have to pay way more money. Obviously because I didnt want to pay more money then what we agreed I didnt pay with the money that I had and I waited. I continued to beg my school but they said I had to wait for XXXX because I didnt need the money sooner since my school was covered. Finally the time came which was XXXX and I begged XXXX to please extended the date so I can pay what we agreed. The amount of late fees that I had racked up by XX/XX/XXXX were so much that I only had enough money for what we agreed on. I asked her what could be done and she said I had to just pay everything at that point and our agreement was now voided. I tried to pay but they wouldnt let me pay on the resident app anymore. She said I could get a cashiers check, or a money order. Due to the fact that my bank wasnt in XXXX I couldnt get a check from them. Also money ordered apparently werent only sold at certain places and the 3 places I went were either closed or being difficult. I informed XXXX about all of this because she told me to keep her updated. Her communication towards the last week of XXXX and me finally leaving XXXX  XXXX was so horrible for a manager. A lot of things couldve been avoided or communicated better but she wasnt responding until hours to days on end later. Finally I asked her what options I could do now if I dont want to pay because I couldnt even do a payment plan at they point. And she informed me that I could just forfeit my lease. The crazy thing about all of this is that in XXXX I wanted to leave the XXXX  XXXX and I had no bills or anything to pay them I just hated the place and it had bugs but, they said they said I couldnt leave and if I did I would still have to pay rent. I thought this was crazy because I dont remember seeing this in my lease but it wasnt highlighted nor did they state this when I was signing. They mentioned everything else but the important stuff they practically hid stuff from me so I could sign my lease. They took advantage of my being naive and young. I know for a fact they couldnt be able to pull half the craziness they did if I was well knowledge in the world of owning a lease and living somewhere. But when I had a huge balance thats when they allowed me to leave which is very unfortunate. I decided to choose the last option in her email which said I could give up my lease and theyll just send everything to their other office. But the way she explained it made me believe that I was feeling if any payments and I can move on with my life. Unfortunately this wasnt true. Im writing this letter to plead with whomever is reading and can understand what its like to be hoodwinked and wrapped into a tricky situation. I understand at any point I didnt have to listen to XXXX or The complex and I couldve did my own thing but I was young and its their company so they know whats best, ( well at least thats what I thought ), I truly apologize that you guys even have to deal with such a situation but Im not a criminal I have done XXXX  XXXX no wrong. In fact I payed my bills on time and I was very rarely late. The sad part is that is wouldnt even mind paying the 1 and 1/2 month of rent I owed. But the complex failed me tremendously. I was a good tenant and I took care of their property and kept my apartment clean always. This caused my new total monthly payment to increase from {$530.00} to {$1200.00}! My condo unit is only XXXX square feet. My apartment is one of XXXX units in my condo building. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I advised Shellpoint via their " Contact Us Page '' that the XXXX XXXX XXXX Insurance premium is not paid through my escrow account ; that I pay my monthly XXXX fees to my condo association and the condominium association pays the {$7100.00} premium to the insurance company because this policy covers the ENTIRE BUILDING which consists of XXXX condominium units, including mine. I also faxed a letter with the same explanation to XXXX and mailed the letter to Shellpoint, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. In all of my communications, I requested the monthly payment amount be recalculated once the erroneous {$7100.00} " Anticipated Payment '' was removed. I attached a copy of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to each correspondence. It shows that the insured is my condo association. 

I also spoke with Shellpoint 's insurance department on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX advised she updated the XXXX XXXX XXXX payout to XXXX and that I was to contact Shellpoint Customer Service to request a rerun of the escrow analysis recalculating the monthly payment amount after the erroneous {$7100.00} " Anticipated Payment '' was removed. I did so on XX/XX/XXXX. I have followed up with phone calls on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX to inquire as to the status of my request and was always told Shellpoint was working on it. 

To keep my account current, to avoid late fees, and to keep Shellpoint from reporting a late payment to credit bureaus, I was forced to pay the incorrect amount of {$1200.00} for XX/XX/XXXX. 

My online account with Shellpoint reflects that the {$7100.00} was removed from the Taxes and Insurance page, but Shellpoint has not yet provided a corrected escrow analysis nor have they reduced the monthly total amount due to the correct amount. It still shows a monthly amount due on XX/XX/XXXX of {$1200.00}. 

Shellpoint has sent me letters - none of which address the issue at hand and all of which are vague, indefinite form letters which include no reference to my specific issue nor what steps Shellpoint is taking to correct their error. My correspondence, Shellpoint 's correspondence, the Escrow Analysis, and the erroneous XXXX XXXX monthly mortgage statement are attached. 

Shellpoint has been advised they made a mistake, but it is not taking any action to correct it. With every month they do nothing, Shellpoint is demanding I pay more money than the Lender is entitled to.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Response to Unauthorized Access and Disclosure of Information Dear Eastern Account System, Thank you for your response. However, I maintain that my primary concern lies with the unauthorized access and improper handling of my personal information in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), as well as potential state privacy laws.

The FCRA and GLBA, along with state privacy laws, impose strict guidelines to protect consumer information from unauthorized access and disclosure. Unauthorized access and use of my information without my explicit authorization raise serious concerns about data protection and compliance with these regulations. As such, unauthorized handling of my information by Eastern Account System or any other third party can subject both entities to criminal and civil penalties. 

Request for Further Investigation and Action I am formally requesting that : Eastern Account System undergo an investigation to determine if unauthorized access or disclosure of my information has occurred. 
Criminal charges be pursued if it is found that my information was improperly accessed or shared with XXXX XXXX without my explicit consent. 
While I understand that Eastern Account System may have processes in place for notifying consumers, it is my position that these processes should not override the fundamental privacy rights outlined by federal and state regulations. My agreement with the original creditor does not grant permission to share my personal information without appropriate authorization or compliance with all legal protections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received an email in XXXX, saying that my terms and conditions with my Fortiva Account were changing and they pretty much going to charge me {$100.00} USD every year. The problem was that this email was sent to spam. 

The email said that me not doing anything about was a confirmation of the new terms, if I wasn't on board with them I would have to email them back saying no, but since this email went unnoticed because it went straight to spam, I never saw it. 

And now they're trying to charge me out of {$100.00} because it was on the email I never read nor agreed to. 

No signs or agreements on my behalf were ever agreed. They just suddenly did this to everyone, expecting from us to pay {$100.00} when no agreement was ever signed. 

This is what's wrong with this credit card companies like Fortiva, they just empty the pockets of the people who are trying to get by. Fortiva is scamming the people hard.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have communicated with New Rez / Shellpoint over the summer about about setting up reoccurring weekly and/or biweekly payments and requested a start date. At first, the representatives set up weekly payments advised me that I needed to mail in a form authorizing the weekly withdrawals, which I did. 

I then called to confirm and another representative told me that New Rez / Shellpoint does not do weekly payments, instead they do biweekly payments. I cancelled the weekly payments that the previous representative set up because the payments were considered incomplete and would not be applied to interest or principal. 

I then mailed and uploaded the biweekly payments authorization to commence on XX/XX/XXXX. The payment was not withdrawn and when I called, the representative told me it takes one month to commence the biweekly withdrawals. 

I then called on XX/XX/XXXX, and the representative told me that there is no record of my form being uploaded on the Newrez XXXX Shellpoint portal ; that no biweekly payments are set up ; that I need to send in the form again ; and that it takes 48 - 72 hours to process. The representative confirmed that my account shows all of the calls and attempts to set up this weekly payment schedule. 

All I want is to set up equal weekly payments to pay off my loan quicker instead of making one monthly payment. I have been able to make in progress with Newrez/Shellpoint, and my account is up to date because I continue to make my scheduled monthly payment at the beginning of every month.

Consumer complaint narrative:
US Bank This started in XXXX of 2024. I received an e-mail from the CDDO department with U.S. bank. CBD OC stands for consumer outreach. They requested that I fill out a form called the Beneficial Owners Certificate. I complied with their request and filled it out and sent it back to them, they contacted me and requested changes to the form. I made the changes and sent it back to them, this continued through XX/XX/year> they had closed the credit card that was associated with this business account. I went to see the branch manager to show him a letter that stated that they were going to close my accounts by XXXX the XXXX if I did not reply. And they did close the credit card on XX/XX/year>. This caused several problems for my company as I have marketing fees that are taken out along with other company related fees. The branch manager called the department CDDO and they stated that they had received the form and that we were good. After waiting a couple of days, the credit card would not work again so I went into the branch location and talked to the branch manager again and he presented me with a form that he helped me fill out that they had rejected the one I had sent in previously, and said my credit card would be opened again. 
On Monday XX/XX/XXXX I got a notice at my checking account that was overdrawn and there was no money in the account. I went into the branch and the branch manager got a hold of the department again and they stated that they had closed the account, but had determined this was a mistake and they closed it on Monday morning and opened it again with insufficient funds, and they said that they had mailed me a certified check that I would receive in a week or so. The problem is that they drained all the money out of my corporation, and I am not able to pay my bills or to pay my payroll. 
I'm still waiting to receive the certified check, there is no way to track the check or to know if it's even in on the way and I can't make payroll. When I mentioned to the branch manager that this was a concern and that I would be turning this over to an attorney, he stated that I signed a waiver that the bank could close my accounts for any reason whenever they wanted to. 
The Branch manager offered to put the funds back into the account for me from the banks general account and when I received the check I would give it to them. The Department said that they would not do this. I feel they are punishing me for making life difficult for them

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative:
Navy Federal Credit Union Attention : Customer Service po box XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Overdraft Fees and Class Action Settlement Dear Navy Federal Credit Union Customer Service Team , I am writing to formally express my concern regarding the excessive overdraft fees imposed on my account, which I believe to be part of a broader issue that has led to a class action settlement. Like many Navy Federal Credit Union members, I was dismayed to discover that these overdraft fees had accrued in situations where they appeared to be unjustified, particularly in light of the circumstances detailed in the recent class action lawsuit. 

I have consistently managed my account responsibly and feel that these fees do not reflect fair treatment, nor are they in line with the standards I expect from Navy Federal Credit Union. Based on information from recent settlement proceedings, I believe these fees have caused significant financial inconvenience and undue hardship, which I feel should be addressed both in terms of immediate remedy and in preventing future occurrences. 

Given these concerns, I kindly request the following : Refund or Credit for Past Overdraft Fees : As part of the resolution for this matter, I request a refund or credit for overdraft fees that I believe were unfairly charged to my account. Please provide me with a detailed history of these fees and any options for reimbursement. 

Clarification of Settlement Terms : I would appreciate further clarification on how the terms of the class action settlement apply to my account. Specifically, I would like to know whether I qualify for any relief under this settlement and how I can participate if I am eligible. 

Commitment to Fair Overdraft Practices : I urge Navy Federal Credit Union to review its overdraft policies and ensure they are aligned with transparent and ethical practices. This step would go a long way in restoring the trust of members who have been negatively impacted by these fees. 

Please provide a written response outlining the steps Navy Federal Credit Union will take to address my concerns and any relevant information regarding my eligibility in the ongoing settlement. I am hopeful that Navy Federal Credit Union will take this opportunity to rectify these issues and improve its commitment to fair and transparent banking practices. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:

Case # XXXX I was told by the representative that I would have to call for each transaction on my accounts- as they would remain frozen. I did this before anything else had transpired. I believed that representative that my accounts would remain frozen - unless I called to request a specific transaction. No one from ALLY Bank will confirm if this message was ever put on my accounts- and, apparently not, because I have lost all of my money and my accounts did not remain frozen. How else would any representative not read the message and allow XXXX fraudulent wires to be sent out- in addition to a transfer from spending account to savings account in the amount of XXXX? I DID NOT AUTHORIZE this transfer. How would no XXXX suspect ANY suspicious and unusual activity that amounted to {$54000.00} wired out in the matter of XXXX days? I have never wired funds ever and don't know how to - and the balances in my account remained consistent for months. I only called to make XXXX transfer of {$9400.00} from savings to spending at the demand of the fraudulent XXXX from Ally in the beginning of this nightmare - with him always reminding me that this was an inside job and that I couldn't discuss anything with anyone. 

Initially, I was called by the fraudulent 'Alex XXXX Ally ' from Ally 's Fraud Department on a spoofed Ally Bank number - telling me that there were transactions going in and out of my accounts in a very sophisticated manner and Ally Bank needed to investigate because this was the XXXX case like this- with the other XXXX being 'inside jobs '. I was told to transfer the {$9400.00} from savings to spending because they were going to try to get the funds back to the defrauded individuals by sending the wires to the XXXX 

Today, I received an email from XXXX for the XXXX Customer Relations which I have attached. In the last paragraph of the email I was told that if I had any questions I just needed to call Ally Bank. XXXX, as with the many other escalation employees at Ally Bank, do not leave their contact information and I was on hold for XXXX hour and XXXX minutes - never able to talk to anyone from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did what I could but Ally Bank did not protect my accounts or my funds- and their employees are untrained and can't read that I asked for my accounts to be frozen. Apparently, only XXXX employee understands that if an account is to be frozen that it is for XXXX transaction without approval and unfortunately that was the initial employee on XX/XX/year> only- before anything had happened. XXXX only says that I wanted a 'restriction ' - when I had said that I was a victim of identity theft and a money laundering scheme and want my accounts frozen. Big difference. At the fraudster 's request, I was told that I had to transfer {$9400.00} from savings to spending - and my accounts should have remained frozen. 

XXXX states that on XX/XX/year>, Ally Bank received XXXX outgoing wire transfer request via AOS from my savings account. I have stated a XXXX times that the fraudsters were on my computer with the screen locked as I was threatened that if I got on my accounts that I would be considered a XXXX party in their 'inside job ' investigation. I was constantly reminded that I couldn't speak to anyone. If it is an 'inside job ' - what could I say to anyone from Ally Bank XXXX as it is a money laundering scheme. Why wouldn't anyone from Ally Bank read the message on my account and protect my funds? Why couldn't anyone from Ally Bank recognize the unusual and suspicious activity? I have NO IDEA what XXXX is- as I did not request any of the wires, submit any of the wire forms or whatever happens- and I merely 'verified " wire information that was told to me by the fraudster - threatening me to not say anything in order to complete their investigation of the inside job. XXXX states that the {$9400.00} and {$15000.00} wires went to XXXX XXXX. Not true- but when I was asked to verify the wire for {$9400.00} - I was asked for the bank name. I said - I don't have the bank name - only the account information. Why wouldn't anyone in the wire department recognize that if I didn't even know the bank name that should have been a major red flag - especially since I had said I am a victim of identity theft and a money laundering scheme and want my accounts frozen. On XX/XX/year>, I did call Ally Bank because I received an email from the IRS that my estimated tax payment had been returned. I was so angry because that is a requirement to be posted to my account- or I will have a penalty. The same thing happened with my automatic debit to the XXXX Department of Revenue- as both payments were returned for estimated tax payments. I was informed by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year> that the accounts were now unfrozen and I said that I wanted those XXXX payments to go- but too late. XXXX states that I confirmed that I said that I had wanted the wires to go- which is what was perhaps said under great duress from the fraudster who had initiated the wires, submitted the wires and I merely confirmed wire information - because of the threatening of the fraudster who was on my computer doing all of this with the screen locked. XXXX leaves out a very important fact - that on XX/XX/year> I called Ally Bank between XXXX am and finally got to the Fraud Department XXXX after I realized that my accounts were missing the approx $ XXXX ( first XXXX wires ). My boss was sitting at my desk and when we finally got 'XXXX XXXX of Ally Bank XXXX XXXX department XXXX the line, XXXX wouldn't talk because I had my boss, XXXX XXXX speaking as well as myself on my cell phone ( on speaker ). I kept saying that I had fraud on my account and was upset - as XXXX said to calm down and we tried to talk to XXXX about the situation. XXXX kept saying that she couldn't talk to me because a XXXX party was on the line and HUNG UP ON ME. TRIED TO REPORT FRAUD. In the closing sentence of the email from XXXX she states that Ally Bank has award-winning customer care. Had XXXX shown ANY award-winning customer care, the remainder of my funds might have stayed 'intact. However, fraudulent XXXX from Ally immediately called and said that there wasn't a problem at all and he transferred me to XXXX XXXX - cohort in crime and the rest is history. I tried to inform Ally Bank of the fraud- under extreme duress and continuing threats- but no one could read a message that should have been on my account- as well as the 'suspicious and unusual activity that has wiped out my funds. Before the XXXX wire in the amount of {$29000.00} was sent I had a call from Ally Bank asking if I had made a transfer of $ XXXX. I said " XXXX, I will have to call you back ''. If Ally Bank is constantly protecting accounts and watching for fraud - what about that phone call? Why are none of the recorded phone calls that I have asked about show no fraud or suspicious transactions. XXXX states that 'Additionally, I requested to have the restriction removed from my spending account in order to make another transfer. '' THAT IS NOT TRUE - as the ONLY call I made to make a transfer was the initial {$9400.00} from savings to spending. When did I call - and what amount did I request? When I don't answer the representative whether I made a transfer of XXXX - with XXXX, I will have to call you back and never did - no fraud? I NEVER authorized that transfer because I didn't even know about it - as they WERE ON MY COMPUTER requesting the wires, submitting the wires, transferring funds- and I merely 'verified " the wire information as told to me by the fraudsters- as the money is going to the BBB under great duress. There was another phone XXXX from Ally Bank ( women ) on the XXXX as well - asking if I have an XXXX and a XXXX Computer - and I answered 'yes ' since that is what I have. Apparently, that VERIFIES something according to ALLY BANK. Did you listen to the phone call? For the XXXX wire, I was told by fraudster that I had to call Ally Bank and find out why the wire hadn't gone out even though the fraudsters has requested the wire in the morning and by the wire cutoff time of XXXX XXXX that wire had not been verified. No suspicious activity with me calling asking why the wire hadn't been sent. XXXX 's email states that on XX/XX/year> Ally Bank emailed a Hold Harmless Letter of Indemnification - XXXX DAYS LATER? I was led to believe that the wires were recalled on the XXXX - not the XXXX- which shows no protection of my accounts in a timely manner under the circumstances. If nothing is fraudulent - then Ally Bank has no liability. Who authorized the phone call from XXXX in XXXX on XX/XX/year> where she stated : 'I finally have some good news that your funds were be returned with interest '? XXXX also said that Ally Bank has XXXX fraud liability along with another person - but those recorded phone calls mean nothing- just to cherry pick and twist what I said for 'authorized wire transactions '. I only verified wire information under great duress and threats. 
XXXX empathizes with any 'inconvenience ' this MAY have caused and appreciates the opportunity to respond to my concern. I have probably made XXXX phone calls to ALLY Bank since XX/XX/year> - and have been violated, humiliated, embarrassed and now just angry. Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have disputed this account several times because I do not own this debt. Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) accuracy of report whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, they shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) in general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 
Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately. 
Please send : 1. A calculation of balance and payment history. 
2. Proof of the agreement that grants this company the authority to collect this alleged debt. 
3. A copy of the company 's state license including the license number. 
4. Proof of how the company assessed the debt. 
5. Copy of the original contract bearing my signature. 
6. Chain of title on this debt. 
7. Do they own it or was this debt assigned? 
8. Copies of all letters sent to me from you and the original creditor. 
9. How much did you buy this debt for? 
10. What fees/interest was tacked onto this debt? 
11. How were the fees determined? 
12. Proof that this company carries a bond. 
13. Proof that this company has the right to collect this debt in my state.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt XXXX, which falls under XXXX  according to XXXX-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Consumer complaint narrative: I recently obtained a mortgage with PenFed end of XX/XX/year>. In XXXX we thought we had set up auto pay to start with the XXXX payment. In XXXX I received an alert saying I was 30 days late from XXXX XXXX. We called in to find out why payment did not pull and were told we did not set up autopay. I let the person know we have not received any statements. It has been confirmed the address in the loan system was set up wrong. The closing paperwork did have a correct mailing address that we were using. In addition we were told that PenFed did try to call but did NOT leave voicemail messages so we had no idea that there was an issue. The number that they call from does not indicate PenFed so we had no idea they were calling or it would have alerted me to an issue. In addition they indicated they did not have my contact number which I find strange since I can see it on the final application paperwork. Customer Service is now saying on XXXX we made a 1 time payment and then setup auto pay and then deleted autopay at the same time which does not seem correct or was an system error. If we had received any statements I would have known my payment was missed and made it prior to the 30 day late which has now impacted my credit greatly. We had also prior to the XXXX payment had the address updated but it was only updated in the retail side. We were not told until recently that you have to contact each department to update information. Customer service spoke with collections who has indicated that they will not change the reporting. Based on the fact that the company had information to reach me and provide a monthly statement I feel like PenFed contributed to my payment being late. I pulled up my final loan paperwork and show the mailing address was not the physical address and my phone number was on final loan application. PenFed would have received this paperwork from the escrow company prior to my loan funding. I am trying to work with customer service to get this resolved but have now been told 4 times that they will not fix this. I feel this is poor customer service and that they did not meet the requirement to send me my mortgage statement monthly. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Having meticulously reviewed the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681, 602 ), I am both enlightened and resolute in my understanding of its mandate : " There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, being consumer reporting agencies, are bound by this statutory duty, and I, as the Sovereign Consumer, command that my private information be protected, as upheld by XXXX5 USC 6801, which declares, " It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' The financial institutions that furnish information to these credit reporting agencies fall under this obligation by definition. Furthermore, 15 USC 1681 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) explicitly states : " No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report except in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' I hereby affirm that no such written instructions have been provided by me to XXXX, XXXX, or any furnisher of information, and any alleged consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, implied, or otherwise, is unequivocally revoked. 

Additionally, pursuant to 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ), " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' I have never been informed of this right by the furnishers of information. This failure constitutes a blatant violation of federal law.

Moreover, 15 USC 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) mandates that no consumer reporting agency may include in its reports adverse information predating seven years, except for criminal convictions. Yet, these agencies continue to unlawfully report adverse items without my consent, flouting legal boundaries.

The furnishers of this information are further restrained by 15 USC 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which forbids the transmission of any information that is inaccurate or that they have reason to believe is inaccurate. Similarly, 15 USC 1681e commands all consumer reporting agencies to maintain procedures that prevent such violations. XXXX and XXXX have failed in this regard, disregarding the statutes that bind them.

Finally, under 12 CFR 1016.7, I exercise my unalienable right to opt out of these reporting services at my discretion and at any time. As of this declaration, I am opting out.

Let this serve as an authoritative decree : my rights as the Sovereign Consumer shall not be infringed. All parties are hereby noticed of their violations and compelled to cease and desist from further unauthorized reporting or sharing of my information. 

Signed, By My Own Hand, XXXX XXXX House of XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
US Bank has assessed an unknown amount of fees on an account after the account holder 's death. They refuse to provide details about the account or refund the fees. 

My father was a US Bank checking account holder. He passed away unexpectedly on XX/XX/XXXX. Needless to say, I was very devastated. I contacted US Bank following my father 's passing in XX/XX/XXXX. I was asked to provide my father 's death certificate as well as my personal information to establish I am next of kin. I provided all of those items. 

US Bank then advised that Missouri requires a small estate affidavit to release the account. 
I contacted a probate attorney in Missouri who advised me that I needed the account number and balance to provide to the Court ( they need to verify the account and amount to ensure statutory compliance for small estates ). 
I was refused the account number by US Bank on claimed legal grounds, but never provided grounds outside of " policy ''. 
My attorney then advised that I was required to wait for the creditor claim window to close if I could not provide the account details. 

We waited until that window closed to file the petition with the Court. 

I received a letter on XX/XX/XXXX from US Bank indicating that they were charging " dormancy fees '' on the account. 

My attorney filed the probate petition in XXXX and I received the affidavit of XXXXourt allowing the funds to transfer on XX/XX/XXXX. 

After the petition was filed, I emailed U.S. Bank on XX/XX/XXXX to alert them the petition was able to be filed and request someone to address these fees on the account. I did not receive any response. 

My father 's account started at a balance of {$8100.00} in XX/XX/XXXX. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, the balance was {$7600.00}. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX, the balance was {$7400.00}. 
As of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX, the balance was {$7300.00}. 

I have requested a daily accounting of the account and a refund of any fees assessed by U.S. Bank. They refused to provide me any other account details, so if any auto-withdrawals were being taken following his death, I do not know and could not stop them. I requested dormancy fees be refunded, as it was US Bank 's own policies that prevented me from initiating " customer activity '' on the account. 

I requested all internal policies as well as legal bases for denying me the account I am unclear as to what was withdrawn from my father 's account following his death. They refuse to refund the fees, and refuse to cooperate to provide account details. They stated, contrary to any legal authority I could find, I was required to open a full probate estate. That would cost over {$5000.00} in attorneys fees. I have indicated that I will issue a subpoena ; however, they are refusing to provide any details or bases for their denial of this information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I am a XXXX veteran and my wife and I originally had out home loan through XXXX XXXX. In less than 2 months we were notified out of the blue that NewRez would be taking over our home loan which we did not want because my wife and I never heard of them and they had REALLY bad reviews on XXXX but we did not have a choice. I now see why!! I am a XXXX & XXXX veteran so I receive a discounted rate on property taxes through the state of MN due to me being XXXX. I went though my county assessors when buying the house and they reviewed my XXXX paperwork and changed the amount I should be paying to escrow each month. 

After they reviewed everything they sent all the required documentation over to NewRez to change the monthly property tax amount/escrow I should be paying since its built in. I noticed after almost a year nothing changed so I reached out to my assessors office and informed them nothing has changed and they then tall me they never got a response which has never happened before .... of course my luck! 

They instructed me to try and get a hold of NewRez and inquire on what's going on and why they haven't changed my rate or reimbursed me. This whole process took multiple months, I called multiple times but they have such long wait times through customer service and no callback which made it difficult a even get a hold of someone cause waiting over an hour on the phone is ridiculous. I could go on and on about that whole process in itself. 

But after a year I finally got the monthly rate/escrow changed even though it was an absolute headache but I was happy it got done and changed. I then told them that I have been over paying them by {$400.00} a month for now like 15 months and that needs to be reimbursed to me since I should never have been paying that in the first place. 

I showed all the proof and dates of receipts and they told me they would start a claim for the reimbursement part of it. Well we are now at another over XXXX months since then and XXXX claims later and not one response/call back or email. 

When I call I and actually get a hold of someone the service representative has no idea how the veteran/escrow process works and just state they are going to notate the account and that they can not put me in hold with someone from that dept. I tell them no I need to speak to someone but in the end they just start a claim with the escrow department. 

This has been an absolute nightmare and after talking to my other XXXX vet buddies I am completely alone and they have never had an issue with this before. They are the worst company I have ever dealt with and are so disorganized on so many different levels. I have now filed complaints with XXXX  and other sources and was informed to make a claim on this site. 

I really need a third party to help me out because I am unprepared on how to go about this since it is my first mortgage and this feels extremely illegal. I dont want to go the lawyer route since then I will just pay lawyer fees and loose money in the end. 

Thank you so much for reading this! I am so thankful for your time!

Consumer complaint narrative: There are ( XXXX ) inaccurate charge-offs reporting on my credit report from this which I believe is misleading and misrepresents the nature of the debt in question. The entry reported as a charge-off is, in fact, a cancellation of debt that has been processed with the IRS. I have received a Certificate of Indebtness from the creditor, confirming that the debt has been officially canceled. As per IRS guidelines, this cancellation of debt is considered taxable income, not an unpaid debt. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), only accurate and complete information should be reported on a consumer 's credit report. Since this charge-off represents a cancellation of debt and not an outstanding obligation, it should not be classified as a charge-off. Reporting it as such is inaccurate and has lead to mis information to potential creditors about my creditworthiness. i received from the company a 1099c canceled debt. i have also opt out with the companies as well in written, unwritten, verbal, and nonverbal authorizations they have been opted out. The Credit bureaus have been Violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) definition of accuracy under Section 1681e ( b ) requires a focus on objectively and readily verifiable information, which may require consumer reporting agencies to accurately report information derived from the readily verifiable and straightforward application of law to facts.

Sub-issue: Loan sold or transferred to another company
Consumer complaint narrative: I originally purchased a car using Bank of the West as the lender. At some point the loan was sold to BMO Bank. I did not know this until BMO Bank called telling me that they needed a payoff amount of {$1700.00} immediately or they would start reporting delinquent notices to my credit report. My payments have been {$550.00} for the term of the loan. I explained to BMO Bank that at the beginning of XXXX, Bank of the West called me and offered to defer payments for 3 months due to mass layoffs. My wife and I had just been laid off so I had them explain how the deferment would work. It was explained to me that if I took advantage of the deferment offer that it would extend my loan term by the amounts of months that I deferred payments for however it would not affect my loan amount or interest paid. I accepted the offer to help due to the strain of my wife and I both being laid off and my new payoff date would be extended 3 months. When I explained this to the customer service representative for BMO, they told me that it was 4 months but they had no record of it so I would have to pay the full amount. I told them that was not the agreement and that I would need to speak to someone that can help me resolve this issue. They put me in touch with a gentleman named Irony. He listened and said he would take my problem to the proper people and get back with me in what was 3 days. When he called me back, he said that they couldn't find the deferment paperwork and they wanted me to send them the deferment paperwork and loan contract. I didnt understand this since they told me that it wasnt 3 months like I thought but it was 4 months. Yet they know nothing about the deferment? Also when Irony told me that it would be 3 days before he could get back to me, I asked if they would be reporting any delinquency to the credit reporting agencies. He told me that he couldnt guarantee that they wouldnt but I could just have them remove it if it came to that. That seemed completely unreasonable and I now had no faith that they were willing and/or capable of holding up any bargain or contract so I chose to just take on the financial hardship and pay off the loan amount seeing as how I didnt feel I should be responsible for Bank of the West or BMO Banks purchasing/selling my loan. I had never been late on a payment ( automatic payments ) and I dont understand how this type of thing happens. I held up my end of the loan and BMO seemed to not want to honor the loan that they purchased. I feel deceived and taken advantage of by BMO Bank and this has caused significant financial hardship on my family due to no actions by me. There needs to be some accountability from BMO Bank to understand the loans in which they are purchasing. To force this upon me, although I had nothing to do with their transaction, is inexcusable. I will be speaking with legal representation due to the unnecessary hardship BMO Bank is forcing onto me and Im sure other customers due to no fault of the customer. Something needs to be done about aggressive collections like this when Banks like BMO are the ones purchasing these loans.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

My personal items are very valuable. I have never received any noTice from repo company or USAA about my personal belongings.

USAA does not have a right to keep my personal property or to charge me a fee to recover it. They have a secured interest in the vehicle only ; my personal property is unsecured. If they do not return my personal property, they are liable for conversion, negligence, and remedies provided by the Uniform Commercial Code. See RCW 62A.9A.625.

Contact me as soon as possible to tell me when I will receive my property and the vehicle tags.

USAA forced me to lock in my mortgage rate by giving me inaccurate information. I had provided USAA with all of my income information, including both of my jobs, upon applying for my mortgage loan in XXXX. Both my Loan Officer, XXXX XXXX, and my Mortgage Processor, XXXX XXXX, had overlooked this information until XX/XX/XXXX when, while reviewing my income information over the phone, my secondary income with the City of XXXX, was not included. When I brought this to their attention, they asked to me to provide my W-2 's for the past two years, my most recent pay stubs, and to provide contact information for the Human Resource Office for my secondary job. I provided all of this information on the same day, XX/XX/year>. 

Upon confirming with my realtor our desired closing date of XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX stated that he would verify my employment with the City of XXXX on XX/XX/year>. I was advised by XXXX XXXX that in order to complete the loan package in time, I must lock in my loan rate no later than XX/XX/year>. This date was provided because XXXX XXXX stated that the loan review process took 7 business days to complete, and the XX/XX/XXXX holiday would not count towards the 7 days. 

On XXXX XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX sent me an email stating that the final review of my loan application would have to be delayed until XX/XX/year>, since the Human Resource Officer at the City of XXXX would be on leave until XX/XX/XXXX. I had just locked in my loan rate with XXXX XXXX around XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Had this information been provided sooner, I would not have locked in my interest rate. This lack of coordination is now costing me, my family, and the seller unnecessary financial strain. We may even lose this home because of this incident. 

Once I was notified of this delay, I requested that my rate lock be removed immediately. XXXX XXXX stated that he could not do this. 

The Duty and Integrity exhibited by our Veterans should also be emulated by the USAA employees who serve them. This level of service is very discouraging and unexpected from USAA as I have been a member with them for nearly 20 years.

The following inquiries appear on my report without any authorization and should be removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX These inquiries were not approved by me, and no legitimate application or request for credit was made to warrant these entries. Per the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are responsible for removing unauthorized or erroneous entries from my report once they are brought to their attention. 

Additionally, credit reporting agencies have previously been sued for failing to remove unauthorized inquiries, as in the case of " XXXX v. XXXX '', which highlights their duty to act promptly in such matters. Despite my attempts to resolve this directly with the agency, the inquiries remain. 

Thank you for your attention on this matter

Consumer complaint narrative: My wife and I are XXXX Citizens in good standing. We recently moved to XXXX XXXX and applied for residency. We found a lot that fits our needs and we wish to build a house in the near future. On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated an international wire for {$15000.00} to send to our respected attorney in XXXX XXXX. The wire was not released until XX/XX/XXXX because the USAA compliance office had questions about the recipient as she has a very common name in latin culture and apparently there is someone with her same name and date of birth who has a XXXX  and XXXX passport that must be on some kind of list. All of the communications with their office of XXXX  were done by email which allowed me to verify the authenticity of the requests. They did finally release the wire 10 days after I submitted the initial wire. We were able to pay the earnest money for the lot and we have a signed contract to buy the property. On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated the final payment to the same recipient. The amount of this wire is {$170000.00}. I specifically asked before sending the wire if we would go through the same issues with the second wire as we did with the first because there are some very important time deadlines involved with this transaction. I was told the intial wire was released, the questions or issues were resolved and this second wire should go much smoother than the first one. The money was deducted from my account on XX/XX/XXXX, the same day I initiated the wire. During the first week of XXXX, we received confirmation of an incoming wire to our attorney. On XX/XX/XXXX, our attorney told us that money never made it to her bank and requested that I call USAA in order to see what happened. I called USAA on XX/XX/XXXX only to find out that the wire had been cancelled. When I asked why, all I was told was that they tried to call me twice and left voice messages and since I didn't respond to these, they cancelled the wire. I know this to be a blatant lie because I monitor my messages very carefully and they never left any voice messages. In addition, if the wire had been cancelled, the money would have been returned to me. I am making as much noise on my end as I can to try to get a resolution but the bank is now stonewalling me.Because of the delays, we are now in jeopardy of losing our earnest money and they have locked up my money leaving me no way to make this transaction. They will not tell me why they have not put the money back into my account. I have an account at USAA because my father who passed away XXXX  years ago was a career veteran in the XXXX XXXX XXXX. CITIBANK account # XXXX According to the FCRA : XXXX. Right to Dispute Inaccuracies Section XXXX : Consumers have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on their consumer report. Reporting agencies must investigate disputes, usually within XXXX  days. 
XXXX. Notification of Dispute Results Section XXXX ( a ) ( XXXX ) : Once a dispute is resolved, the consumer reporting agency must provide the consumer with a written response detailing the results of the investigation and any changes made to the report. 
XXXX. Notice of Disputed Information to Furnishers Section XXXX ( b ) : When a consumer disputes an item, the reporting agency must notify the entity that provided the disputed information. The furnisher is required to investigate the matter and report back to the consumer reporting agency. 

EWS violated my consumer laws according to the laws listed above by not providing written results detailing the results of the investigation and providing documents used to validate the debt. Please find attached all disputes sent to EWS and their response.

And this payment was withdrew from my XXXX XXXX checking account on XX/XX/XXXX with the following description : XX/XX/XXXX - Withdrawl from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT WEBPMTS ( - {$1000.00} ). But then around XX/XX/XXXX I tried to make the payment for the XXXX due date ( XX/XX/XXXX ), I noticed my XX/XX/XXXX payment ( fund already taken out of my XXXX  account ) were never applied to my HELOC account balance. Shellpoint 's agent told me they never saw this payment in my payment history. So, I called XXXX  XXXX to reverse the XX/XX/XXXX payment on XX/XX/XXXX. This is how it's displayed in the bank statement XX/XX/XXXX - Withdrawal from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT WEB PMTS Reversal Effective XX/XX/XXXX. I then call the bank and made the payment with the help of their agent and it's posted on my bank on XX/XX/XXXX. It's display as the following on my bank statement : XX/XX/XXXX - withdrawal from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT ACH PMT ( - {$1000.00} ). So, I thought this will cover my XXXX payment and for sure my HELOC balance should be now lower. So, around XX/XX/XXXX, I logged on to my account and found that the XX/XX/XXXX payment were never received and my balance has grown because they said since I had reversed the XX/XX/XXXX payment. So, I filed a complaint to correct the accounting error. And made the XXXX payment on the phone with the help of an agent. This was posted on my checking account on XX/XX/XXXX. It was displayed as this on my bank statement : XX/XX/XXXX - Withdrawal from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT ACH PMT ( - {$1000.00} ). Then around XX/XX/XXXX, I called the agent to see if the accounting error with the wrong balance has been resolved. They said still pending. And They did not see my XX/XX/XXXX payment, nor the XX/XX/XXXX payment. So, that's when I said that's it. this is getting too crazy. I am going to have my bank reverse those two payments since you said you never received them, yet the funds were already withdrawn from my checking account. So, I called XXXX XXXX to reverse the payments for XX/XX/XXXX and the XX/XX/XXXX. They appeared on the statement as follows : XX/XX/XXXX - Withdraw from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT ACH PMT REVERSAL Effective : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XX/XX/XXXX - Withdraw from NEWREZ-SHELLPOINT ACH PMT REVERSAL Effective : XX/XX/XXXX. And then now they said although they can't see the payment that has been withdrawn from my account ( taken out of my checking account ), but they can see payments that have been reversed. So, now they are saying I still owe them for the XXXX payment as well. ( because I reversed the payment that they never received ). I provided them with my bank statement showing them that I have made three payments to them on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX. And I have reversed these three payments on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX So, that should prove that my balance should stay the same {$31000.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX when the XXXX, XXXX, XXXX payments were applied. And I only owe XXXX, XXXX and XXXX payments. I have filed support tickets and have provided the my bank statement to prove that. But I never gotten any confirmation or follow up. And when I called again today and the agent said no they don't go by my bank statement. They go by their accounting system. And that I still owe them {$32000.00}. And I still owe them XXXX, XXXX, XXXX And XXXX payments. 

This is insane. Please investigate this shady company please. I am at wits end. We need help proving that they did received my payments. And that the reversals were merely reversing the payments that have been withdrawn from my checking account that they claim they have never received. XXXX  XXXX claim department said they have successfully reversed the three payments and there is nothing else they can do. Please help!

Shellpoint stated they sent me correspondence via mail I acknowledged as not received. They also stated they didnt receive my application online but I have proof of my attempt. Shellpoint mentioned in response to my dispute that I was supposed to submit the request within XXXX business days of my forbearance ending. I also did not receive a call providing this information. Your instructions state on your website to submit a request for extension. My attachment proves I did in fact do that. I requested that Shellpoint provide the outbound call log of attempts made by their loss mitigation team. Your correspondence confirmed my forbearance but it it isnt reflective on my credit report in XXXX? 

I also requested the audio transcript be pulled that indicated the contradictory information provided but after XXXX complaints that information was not confirmed as accessed. 
I am writing to dispute the accuracy of the late payment information on my credit report. I have reviewed my credit report from [ Credit Bureau XXXX ], and I have identified discrepancies in the reporting of late payments. 

Below, I have outlined the incorrect information as it appears on my credit report : I am bringing to your attention that under the provisions of the Truth in Lending Act, XXXX XXXX XXXX, it is required that creditors provide accurate information regarding account status and payment history. I believe that the reported late payments do not accurately reflect my history and payment status. I have attached relevant documents, such as bank statements or payment records, to support my claim. 

I kindly request that you investigate this matter and rectify the inaccuracies on my credit report promptly. It is within my rights, as granted by XXXX XXXX XXXX, to have accurate information on my credit report. 

Please provide me with a written response regarding the results of your investigation within 30 days, as mandated by law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response I am also sending a copy of this complaint to the CEO of Shellpoint as it is my last attempt to rectify the errors on my credit report. This is now considered a demand letter. I will be seeking monetary damages. Responding youve found no errors but also admitting you made mistakes is a violation under the FCRA.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a complaint against Central  Bank located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, MO XXXX, in which I have outlined below. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I opened auto loan with Central Bank in the amount of {$19000.00} for a term of 72 months ( six years ) with the monthly payment to be {$310.00} XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : Every month I faithfully paid my monthly payment of {$310.00} via the online bank site XXXX of XXXX : I missed making my standard car payment in the month of XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : I resumed making my monthly car payment of {$310.00} online XX/XX/XXXX : I began trying to pay off all outstanding debts to include this auto loan. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I accessed the online banking site to review my loan balance, which revealed the balance to be {$4000.00}, and I went ahead and made a {$3000.00} payment online. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I proceeded to make an additional payment in the amount of {$1000.00} through the online site. 

Month of XX/XX/XXXX : Payments that I made in the month of XX/XX/XXXX totaled {$4000.00}. After payments, the online site reflected that the remaining balance of the loan was a total of {$400.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I made my regular loan payment of {$310.00} online XX/XX/XXXX : I went online to pay the remaining balance of my loan, in which the site reflected the remaining balance to be {$93.00}, in which I paid {$93.00} to satisfy the loan. 

The Next Several Months : With the loan paid in full, I awaited the lien release to arrive in the mail. I planned to keep my vehicle, therefore there was no urgency in receiving the lien release. 

A Saturday, between the end of XX/XX/XXXX and the end of XX/XX/XXXX : With months passing since I paid the last payment, I called the bank to question the status of the lien release. Due to it being the weekend, the only information I could obtain was the name of a supervisor of whom I should call and speak with during the week. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I became aware of derogatory remarks on my credit report that were negatively affecting my credit score and found the impact was from my auto loan with Central Bank. 

Concerned with the negative impact to my credit score, I attempted accessing my loan information online, just as I had done when making my payments online ; however, the bank had deactivated my online account, and I was unable to view any information. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I called Central Bank and asked to speak to XXXX, who was the supervisor that I had been referred to in my earlier call. Unfortunately, I never thought to obtain XXXX last name ; however, to my knowledge she is still employed with Central Bank. 

My phone conversation with XXXX on this particular day, consisted of me explaining all the details which are outlined above and up to this point. XXXX stated that she needed to review the details of my account, and that she would return my phone call within a few business days. 

Mid-XXXX  XXXX : I had not received a call back from XXXX as promised, therefore I decided I would call to follow up with her. XXXX stated she had reviewed my account and though I might have paid the remaining balance of my loan showing online, the online balance did not include the late fees on my loan. I was then informed that late fees had been assessed to my account from the time of my missed payment in XXXX of XXXX through XXXX of XXXX. In XXXX of XXXX, Central Bank charged off my account as a Profit and loss write-off and reported this to the credit reporting bureaus. 

When asking why the payments in XXXX of XXXX, which totaled {$4000.00} did not cover any outstanding late fee ( s ), I was told that this would have required me providing specific instruction to the bank. Though the {$4000.00} payment exceeded my monthly loan payment of {$310.00}, the bank did not put any of the payment towards the prior late fees and left them outstanding. 

XXXX offered to remove two of the late fees assessed, but claimed there was nothing more she could do, and said that I should have called the bank for a pay off balance. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I called Central Bank and spoke with XXXX XXXX, who was the Vice President/Consumer Loan Office, and we went over the same material that is outlined throughout this complaint. At the end of our conversation, I received the same exact response that I had received from XXXX, in the call documented above. 

Since I was unable to access my account information online, I requested that XXXX XXXX provide me with a full statement of my loan activity, in which she mailed to me and is attached hereto. 

The account activity confirms that from XXXX of XXXX through XXXX of XXXX, that XXXX of XXXX was the only month during the entire loan that a monthly payment was not made. 

Needless to say, I was highly upset as the bank and I both agreed that the auto loan of {$19000.00} was paid in full, but the bank claimed I had not paid the account in full, due to the assessed late fees. 

What is more upsetting is that Central Bank reported this loan as a charge off and a Profit and Loss Write-Off to the credit reporting bureaus, which is and has been damaging to my credit. The bank refuses to release the lien on my vehicle, and to this day, late payments continue to be reported to the credit reporting bureaus. 

So what has happened is Central Bank was assessing late fees on late fees. Is this legal, because I don't believe it is? 

XX/XX/XXXX : After reviewing the statement of my loan activity, I personally went to Central Bank and spoke directly to XXXX XXXX, in attempt to work out a resolution ; however, I got no further on XX/XX/XXXX, then I did in my previous phone conversations with the bank, which is the reason why I am now turning to your agency. 

Additional Upsetting Factors to Resolve : From XXXX of XXXX, when the auto loan was opened through the end of XXXX, I never communicated in person or via the phone with Central Bank. All loan payments were paid online and I always retrieved my account activity online as well. Therefore, when the online site listed the remaining balance of the loan as {$93.00}, I assumed that was the " actual '' balance of loan. I paid the {$93.00} and assumed the loan was satisfied in full. 

Central Banks online site allowed me to successfully pay the remaining balance of {$93.00} and did not provide any obvious online instructions that directed me to call the bank for a pay-off amount. 

The printed statement of my account activity, in which Central Bank provided to me reveals that my {$4000.00} loan payment in XXXX of XXXX was not substantial enough to cover late fee ( s ) previously assessed to my account. The account activity also reflects that after I paid the actual loan in full, the bank continued to assess {$10.00} late fees up to the time the bank reported my account as charged off and a Profit and Loss Write-Off. 

Upon review of my credit report, which is attached hereto, you will see that the bank is reporting 15 late payments, beginning in XXXX of XXXX, the date of my last online payment of {$93.00}. 

The 15 late payments reported by Central Bank and are shown reported from XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, showing that only 81 % of payments to be made on time. This has impacted my credit in such a way, that I can not even obtain a credit card. 

Though the actual auto loan is paid in full, Central Bank has not released the lien to the vehicle to this day.
