Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I went to Ornate Skin 's booth at the XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year> and was going to make a purchase for skin case products however wanted to cancel my transaction right away. The employee I was working with while at the booth confirmed the charge was canceled and stated it was okay as I asked right away and I walked away without any of their products as I did not purchase them and saw they had placed the items back on display. 

When I checked my Citi credit card account at a later time, I noticed that the purchase was processed and I filed a dispute to the best of my knowledge from the options given on their website app on XX/XX/year>. Citi began their dispute process and I made multiple calls for follow up on the case status and obtain further guidance as I wanted to ensure Citi knew I did not receive any products, therefore I shouldn't have to pay the charged {$330.00}. The representatives from Citi told me to reach out to the vendor for a resolution to my case as it XXXX be the easiest path. 

I followed their guidance and reached out to the vendor XXXX XXXXn via email between XX/XX/year> - XX/XX/year> who stated they have been assured by their employees that I had received their products, and asked if I could speak with them over the phone to review the products I had supposedly obtained. I did not feel comfortable engaging further as I wanted to have conversations written in writing versus having a verbal conversation reviewing items, as it did not make sense to have a conversation about items that are non-existent. I was never provided from the vendor any details about a cancelation policy, and found it confusing as the employee confirmed the cancelation. 

In addition, the vendor XXXX XXXX seems to make quick errors as they sent me a confirmation of registering a device through them called " XXXX XXXX '' which costs around $ XXXX to my recollection. I was introduced to the device and provided with an explanation, but I did not agree to make a purchase and was sent a lifetime warranty for a purchase I never made. 

I called Citi once again to obtain further guidance and was advised not to reach out to the vendor if I feel uncomfortable and they would handle it for me. Upon review, the representative stated I had filed incorrectly that it was a " cancelation '' when it should have been " non receipt of goods ''. I stated I filled out the form to the best of my knowledge as the verbiage was confusing with the representative agreeing with me. I have attached the options for Citi 's dispute process and to the best of my knowledge I chose " I have canceled or attempted to cancel this transaction for goods/services from this merchant '' as it made more sense than choosing the supposed appropriate option " I ordered XXXX services from the merchant but I never received the goods/services '' as I didn't order the goods online and was there in person. The Citi representative stated he would rectify the situation and place it into the appropriate category and it should be resolved very quickly as it is a simple case of not receiving the items. 

I was notified on XX/XX/year> that my case was closed with Citi and my credit would be reversed. I was given an option to appeal the decision and I had made another call to fully understand the situation and was guided to write my statement of what occurred which I completed on XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year> I received a letter from Citi stating I did not fulfill the cancelation proof, however I didn't understand how I was supposed to obtain it if the vendor wasn't providing it to me and Citi stated the vendor was not responding to their request as well. 
If the vendor does not provide the evidence to Citi, how is a customer supposed to provide that? I kept asking each Citi representative for help as I needed protection from a vendor that is lying as it was a large amount of money to lose for not receiving any items. The Citi representative stated they would try again to open my case and ask to investigate my case. 

On XX/XX/year> Citi sent another letter stating the debits and credits to my account. I was confused with this letter and thought it was a latter stating facts and continued to wait. 

I called Citi XX/XX/year> and was told that my case was closed as I did not provide sufficient evidence of cancelation. I reiterated again that I could not provide evidence as I could not obtain it after requesting it from the vendor with Citi stating they could not obtain it either. I asked the representative if Citi could not obtain the evidence, how could I? Citi then told me that there was nothing that could be done as they went through their investigations. I stated it did not make sense why they were giving me such a hard time when I always pay off my purchases unless I did not receive the product as it was in this case. I should not have to pay for a product I did not receive. The Citi rep then stated she could only reopen my case in XXXX circumstance and proceeded to ask me questions as if I was supposed to know the right answer. To my understanding, I gave the wrong answer as I did not fully understand the technical verbiage they were using. I then got another run around as to why I can not reopen a dispute as their investigators did their job and because I had failed to provide supporting evidence, my case was closed. I reiterated I did not receive the product, therefore I should not have to pay. The Citi representative was very rude and the conversation escalated so I requested to speak with her supervisor. When speaking with the Citi supervisor, she was rude as well and stating incorrect facts about my case upon which I was trying to providing clarification however was unable to do so as she refused to listen and kept talking over me which further escalated the situation. For example, the supervisor stated the investigators were currently working on my case which was not true as the representative stated my case was closed and no action is being taken as there is no solution to my case. The Citi supervisor continued to speak over me which again increased the conflict and then hung up on me. 

After the phone call, I filed a complaint to Citi regarding the matter and received a phone call on XX/XX/year>. The representative stated he reviewed my case, listened to all the phone calls between myself and various Citi representatives, and apologized for the poor management of both representative and supervisor on XX/XX/year>. He then stated there was nothing that can be done to get my refund back as I had filed it under a cancellation versus non receipt of goods. He added that there was no response from the vendor after their initial attempt to contact, therefore the responsibility is upon me to provide evidence. I stated the vendor had confirmed my transaction was canceled and I walked away from the booth after they had said it was and did not take any products with me. In addition, the vendor had sent me another email with a product that costs about {$3000.00} - {$4000.00} thanking me for the purchase when I did not authorize it. The Citi representative continued to state that my case was filed under the wrong category as cancellation when it should have been non receipt of goods, and apologized that the other multiple representatives had provided me the wrong information. I stated I thought they had transferred my case from cancellation to non receipt of goods in my previous call, and received the response that because my transaction has been done in person it didn't matter which option I chose to file it under as I would have lost either way as they are dealing with XXXX and XXXX policies. I stated I can not understand how I can't get a refund of my money when I did not receive any goods. The representative stated he knew I wasn't comfortable with speaking to the vendors anymore however advised the only option was for me to reach out once more to the vendor to see if I could get a refund. I responded I did not feel comfortable as they have already swindled me out of my money and I do not wish to speak with them anymore. I asked if there was anything else I could do and received the answer that there is nothing I could do to get my money back, and I lost the money. They stated they can not submit another case as they already placed it under the cancelation category and can only be submitted once to the vendor. I asked why they couldn't open a case as it was filed under the wrong category as XXXX of the Citi representatives I had spoken with in the past stated they had moved it to the appropriate category of non receipt of goods. I was given a response that unfortunately I was provided with inaccurate information by multiple representatives I spoke with. I added I should not be penalized for multiple Citi reps telling me inaccurate information, and stated the verbiage used was very confusing with the Citi rep agreeing and adding the letter from Citi dated XX/XX/year> is confusing and does not provide any details. 

He apologized that I was given the wrong information and there was nothing I could do to get my money back as both the vendor and I can not show proof that I did not receive the goods or the transaction was canceled. I asked how either party would be able to show evidence and he stated he was not sure. I asked then, why is it that the vendor has so much power when they are swindling me out of my money without anything to show for it, with the representative stating that they aren't protecting the vendor but following policies. He then confirmed and stated there is nothing else I could do and that there was no other entity that was above him or his department that could assist me after the call placed on XX/XX/year>. 

I have exhausted all means to rectify this situation and in dire need of help and protection. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Select Portfolio Servicing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute of Late Payment Inquiries on Credit Report for Account with Select Portfolio Servicing Account number : XXXX Dear Select Portfolio Servicing Representative, I am reaching out to address a matter of significant concern regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, specifically relating to late payment inquiries on my account with Select Portfolio Servicing that do not accurately reflect my credit history. These inaccuracies have unjustly impacted my credit score, and I am compelled to request their immediate rectification in accordance with federal regulations. 

Upon reviewing my credit report, I identified late payment inquiries that are erroneously reported. These inaccuracies stem from incorrect reporting of payment status. Consequently, I urge you to expeditiously remove these inaccuracies from my credit report to rectify the harm inflicted on my financial reputation. 

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., empowers consumers to dispute any inaccuracies on their credit reports. Under the FCRA, both credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) and furnishers of information, such as your entity, are mandated to ensure the accuracy and completeness of all reported information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Moreover, the FCRA obligates CRAs and information furnishers to conduct a thorough investigation of disputes and to delete or correct any inaccuracies within a reasonable timeframe, not exceeding 30 days ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ). Non-compliance with these provisions may result in liability for damages, including attorney 's fees ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ). 

Additionally, the FCRA prohibits the reporting of outdated information. Specifically, it mandates the removal of any adverse information, including late payments, that predates the seven-year threshold, measured from the date of the initial delinquency ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) ). 

In light of the above, I formally request the immediate removal of the disputed late payment inquiries from my credit report. I also expect written confirmation of this removal within 10 days of your receipt of this letter. Failure to address this dispute promptly will compel me to take further action, including but not limited to, monitoring my credit report closely and seeking legal remedies as afforded by the FCRA. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and expect your cooperation in resolving this dispute in a manner that upholds the integrity of my credit report and complies with the FCRA. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX -- - Federal Statutes Cited : 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Duty of furnishers of information to ensure accuracy and completeness ) 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ) 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( Civil liability for willful noncompliance ) 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) ( Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports )

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Attention : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Barclays XXXX XXXX [ undisclosed last name ] Thank you for your letter of XX/XX/XXXX. As I am not able to reach you by telephone, I am responding via the CFPB XXXX. I think that a further conversation may help us to understand one another. 

Regretfully, neither your above-referenced letter, nor its attached letter of XX/XX/XXXX, resolve the XXXX-year-long dispute. 

The issue, first reported on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, is an overcharge in the amount {$280.00}. I never claimed that the merchant altered the amount charged on my account, as Barclays incorrectly alleges in its XX/XX/XXXX letter. More than once, I provided Barclays with the merchants own receipt of payment in the amount of {$13000.00}. I am now attaching e-mail correspondence with the merchant wherein the merchant states that on XX/XX/XXXX, it received payment of XXXX {$13000.00} ( calculated at an exchange rate XXXX XXXX $ XXXX ). Barclays, on the other hand, charged my account {$13000.00}. I should mention that Barclays separately charged me a foreign transaction fee, so this overcharge is not a foreign transaction fee. 

Barclays claims to have resolved the claim in my favor, because it did the following without my authorization : As per the merchant, Barclays contacted the merchant, reversed its original XX/XX/XXXX payment to the merchant in the amount of {$13000.00}, and then paid the merchant {$13000.00}. Meanwhile, I had paid Barclays {$13000.00}, as Barclays acknowledges in its XX/XX/XXXX letter. The credit Barclays claims to have provided basically allows for the charge on my account to be {$13000.00} ( what I paid ) instead of Barclays original charge on the account of {$13000.00}. However, since Barclays received {$13000.00} from me and subsequently reversed and paid the merchant about {$13000.00}, Barclays continues to overcharge me. It then suggests, as you do again now, that I bring up the matter with the merchant, attempting to distance Barclays from the dispute. Yet, from my perspective as a client, the unanswered question persists : Why does Barclays pay a merchant XXXX amount and charge its client a higher amount? 

If customer service is very important to Barclays and if it honestly regret [ XXXX ] the hardship it continues to impose upon me, as expressed in some of its letters, then Barclays should be transparent about the transaction and the overcharge. 


Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> FMS FINANCIAL SOLUTIONS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Demand for Immediate Removal of Inaccurate Eviction Record from My Credit Report FCRA Violation Failure to Properly Report Eviction Dear FMS FINANCIAL SOLUTIONS, I am writing to formally dispute and demand the immediate removal of an inaccurate eviction record from my credit report, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C.

1681. This eviction listing is incorrect, unlawful, and outdated, and it is harming my creditworthiness.

As per my rights under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, you are required to investigate and correct any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report within 30 days. I request that you remove this erroneous eviction entry immediately, as it violates the following provisions : Inaccurate Information : The eviction record you are reporting is either erroneous or incomplete.

It is critical that all information listed on my credit report is both accurate and verifiable. If the eviction record can not be verified by the landlord or property manager, it must be removed from my report as a matter of law. 
2. Failure to Provide Complete Verification : Under the FCRA, any information that is not adequately verified or substantiated by documentation must be removed from the credit report. I request you provide detailed proof that this eviction record has been thoroughly verified according to the law, including any signed contracts, eviction judgments, or other relevant documentation.

3. Outdated Information : If this eviction is over seven years old, it is a violation of the FCRAs time limitations. 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 1 ) explicitly prohibits reporting of negative information older than seven years. If the eviction entry falls outside of this window, it must be deleted immediately.

As you are well aware, failure to comply with the FCRA may result in legal action, including but not limited to claims for damages, statutory penalties, and attorney fees under 15 U.S.C.

1681n and 1681o. I have kept records of all relevant communications and documentation regarding this matter, and I will not hesitate to take further action to protect my rights.

Please remove this eviction from my credit report within the legally mandated 30-day investigation period. If you fail to do so, I will escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states attorney generals office. 
Please confirm the removal of this eviction by sending an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the corrections made. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Lender trying to repossess or disable the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
Florida Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles It is with a XXXX XXXXXXXX that I share this experience, as integrity means everything to me. I had high expectations from a reputable dealership, I considered family when I purchased a vehicle from them on XX/XX/year>. The next day, I drove it from XXXX to XXXX. Later that afternoon, I noticed a large amount of oil had leaked onto the concrete where the car was parked. Knowing my parking space was clean before, I immediately documented the issue with photos and reached out to the dealerships general manager, sales manager, and salesperson on Monday.

To my surprise, the general manager admitted that he was aware of the oil leak. As someone familiar with carsmy father is a mechanicI know that oil is essential for an engines health, just like blood is to a body. When I asked why the issue wasnt resolved before selling it to me, especially given our supposed family bond, he replied that he didnt think it was worth fixing for the price. This response was deeply disappointing, and I was left to address a problem I hadnt created. 
As if this wasnt bad enough, I also discovered roaches in the car, which intensified my frustration and XXXX. When I shared this with the general manager, he advised me to use foggers to solve the issue, as if it were a minor inconvenience. Given our historyhe had previously resolved a minor oil leak on a vehicle I purchased in XXXX was shocked by his dismissive attitude this time around. 
Since that day, Ive been back and forth with XXXX XXXX in XXXX, pleading with them to take the vehicle back and resolve the situation by providing an alternate truck. I even offered to return it, but circumstances beyond my control, including two hurricanes and financial constraints, prevented me from making the trip. Eventually, I found a local mechanic who examined the vehicle and concluded that the issue was too severe and should NEVER have been sold to me in the first place. 
On XX/XX/year>, I took the vehicle to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, where the team, including General XXXX XXXX, Service Advisor XXXX, and Service XXXX XXXX, went above and beyond to help. Despite not being responsible for this sale, they treated my situation with the urgency and respect I had hoped for from the original dealership. Lead Service Mechanic XXXX discovered the oil leak had not only damaged wires but also flooded the vehicles entire computer system, making the car unsafe to drive.

Throughout this ordeal, I have repeatedly asked the original dealership to retrieve the car, acknowledging it as a lemon, but they have refused. I contacted my insurance company, ( XXXX XXXX ) made a claim, and notified my lender ( First Investors ) that I am unwilling to pay for a defective vehicle. I am exhausted from fighting this battle and simply want the situation rectified! 
Due to the delays in obtaining title documentation from XXXX XXXX, I am now on my SECOND temporary tag, which is about to expire, and I suspect the car wont pass Georgias emissions test. The oil has literally flooded the wires and the trucks computer system!! The check engine and oil light are constantly on!! This isnt a regular oil leak!! The XXXX general manager offered to split the costs with me to fix the vehicle, a solution I find unreasonable as the issue was pre-existing. When he said, Its just a car, XXXX, I felt utterly dismissed. This car is unsafe and infested, and I deserve better treatment. XXXX XXXX has CONSISTENTLY reached XXXX XXXX XXXX with no resolve to date. **Do not call me, answer the General Manager 's call!! 
XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX has shown me there are still people/businesses who uphold integrity in this industry. They have consistently prioritized my safety, even prohibiting me from driving the car due to its dangerous condition. I never wanted to make this situation public, but I can no longer tolerate being strung along by the dealership in XXXX, which has failed to make things right. This has impacted my financial stability, and all I seek is fairness. I have reached out to the automotive group that owns the XXXX dealership ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), only to be told that the XXXX XXXX would be handling the situation. Nothing! Absolutely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ive submitted this information briefly to journalists in both XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) via XXXX. 
My goal is NOT to ruin anyones career ( as everyone needs to provide for their family ), but simply to have this situation resolved in a way that restores my faith in this business and in basic decency!! Someone had to inspect the car, sign off on the inspection of the car in order to ensure that it was SAFE and fit for sale!! I believe that had I not had to drive home to Georgia, the oil situation wouldve presented itself down the line, they werent banking on it happening as soon as fast as it happened!! XXXX XX/XX/XXXX!! The insurance adjuster has received the information as of XX/XX/year> and will investigate the truck!! The video is just a snippet!! 
I would like to Thank these groups, PUBLICLY for their support, advice & efforts during this challenging time : -The entire staff of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX*I have a total of 84 Photos, videos, emails, texts & documentation of my ENTIRE EXPERIENCE and all are readily available!!

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Debt Validation Request Dear SUNRISE CREDIT SERVICES GROUP I am writing to formally request validation of the debt referenced in your records under account number XXXX. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to request documentation that verifies the existence and amount of the debt you claim I owe. 
Please provide me with the following information : 1.Validation of the debt : A detailed statement of the amount owed, including any fees or interest. 
2.Proof of ownership : Documentation that proves you own the debt or have the authority to collect on it. 
3.Account history : A complete account history that reflects all payments made and any adjustments made to the account. 
4.Original creditor information : The name and address of the original creditor, including the original account number. 
Additionally, please be aware that under FCRA 609, I have the right to dispute any information that is inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. If you are unable to provide the requested documentation, I expect that you will remove all negative entries associated with this account from my credit report. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please respond within 30 days to avoid any further reporting of this account to credit bureaus.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I was logged into my XXXX XXXX account and purchasing two tickets. At check out, I was given the opportunity to apply for the Citi AAdvantage Credit Card with the offer being XXXX miles after spending {$3500.00} w/i the first 4 months, a {$200.00} statement credit for XXXXXXXX XXXX purchases made in the first 6 months and no annual fee the first year ( {$99.00} thereafter ). 
Since my ticket was just shy of {$3500.00}, and this is a great mileage reward, I decided to apply for, and was approved for, the credit card, which I used at checkout. 
I then used my card for various other small purchases to achieve the {$3500.00} needed. I watched my account, but was never given any more than XXXX reward miles. I inquired with Customer Service, only to be told that I must provide a screenshot of the offer, and that it must have my name on it. I explained that I did not take a screenshot at the time of applying, as I had no reason to suspect they would not honor their offer. They gave me an email to submit any evidence to, and said I would hear back in 7-10 business days. I waited, and after I did not hear anything, I inquired with Customer Service again. I was told that I was given the wrong email address, and was provided with a different one. 
I did a XXXX XXXX of the offer, took a screenshot of what I found, and provided that, as well as a very detailed explanation to the new email address. I received a letter back stating that I was only being given the normal promo for XXXX miles. 
I called Customer Service AGAIN to explain everything that had happened, and ask why they were not honoring the offer I applied to, and was approved for. They said they do not honor promotional offers unless it is a personal letter sent directly to me, and that I would have to prove to them that I received such letter. 
This is not only false advertising, but fraud. They gave me a personalized offer on the XXXX XXXX website, as I was logged into my personal account. This offer was the only reason I applied. They are now refusing to honor the contracted offer they gave me. After doing some research, I am finding that this is a common occurrence with Citibank.

( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this dispute regarding a fraudulent account reported by ServiceMac on my credit report without my knowledge or consent. Additionally, ServiceMac failed to provide me the legally required opportunity to opt out before sharing my personally identifiable financial information with third parties, including other financial institutions and consumer reporting agencies. This unauthorized disclosure of my information constitutes identity theft against me, as my personally identifiable financial information was shared without my legally obtained consent. This action violates my rights under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), which mandates that consumers must be given the right to opt out before their information is shared with non-affiliated third parties. 

This situation also breaches the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which stipulates that information on consumer reports must only be accessed or shared for permissible purposes and with consumer consent. The unauthorized dissemination of my information for a fraudulent account, without providing me an opt-out opportunity, disregards my FCRA rights. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) of the FCRA requires consumer reporting agencies to establish reasonable procedures to ensure maximum accuracy in reporting. The presence of this unauthorized account indicates a failure to comply with these procedures.

In addition, this situation violates New Jersey 's Consumer Fraud Act ( CFA ), N.J.S.A. 56:8-1 et seq., which prohibits creditors and financial institutions from engaging in deceptive and unfair practices that harm consumers. By failing to provide me with an opt-out option and reporting a fraudulent account to my credit report, ServiceMac has engaged in unfair practices that have caused both emotional and financial harm. I request an immediate investigation into this matter, the removal of the fraudulent account from my credit report, and enforcement of my rights under federal and New Jersey laws to prevent further unauthorized use of my personal information.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), consumer reports may only be accessed for permissible purposes, such as evaluating creditworthiness for a legitimate credit transaction initiated by the consumer. As the consumer, I am the lawful owner of my credit information, which means any entity seeking to access or use it must do so with explicit authorization and solely for permissible purposes. 
XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, as data furnishers under the FCRA, have a legal obligation to ensure that credit inquiries are conducted in compliance with this law. The continued presence of these inquiries on my credit report, despite the denial of credit, raises serious concerns about whether my credit report was accessed properly and for a permissible purpose. Additionally, the handling of my personal information by these companies may violate the Privacy Act of 1974, which mandates that personal data be accessed and used only for legitimate and authorized purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX, 2024 NATIONAL ENTERPRISE SYSTEM XXXX XXXX XXXX OHIO XXXX XXXX Re : Dispute of Alleged Debt Dear XXXX, Please be advised that this letter serves as a formal dispute of the alleged debt referenced in your correspondence and sent to me in relation to an account that you claim I owe. I am writing to request full validation of the debt as permitted by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ). This letter is not a refusal to pay the debt, but a request for proper documentation proving that I owe the amount you claim. 

As per my rights under the FDCPA, I request that you provide the following information and documentation : The name of the original creditor on the alleged debt, and the corresponding account number. 
The original amount owed, including a full, itemized payment history starting from the date the debt was first incurred with the original creditor. 
Legal documentation that proves I am legally obligated to pay this debt. 
The original date of delinquency on this account. 
A copy of the agreement granting you the authority to collect this alleged debt, or proof of assignment or transfer of the debt to your agency. 
The amount you paid to acquire this debt and how the current balance owed was calculated. 
Please provide all requested documents within XXXX  days of receipt of this letter, and please do so via certified mail. Failure to provide the requested documentation will result in the immediate removal of any claim against me and the corresponding entry from my credit profile. 

Additionally, I am formally notifying you that you do not have my consent to contact me through any means other than in writing, and you do not have my authorization to access, possess, or report any of my private information. Any such unauthorized actions are considered a violation of my rights and may constitute aggravated identity theft under applicable law. Furthermore, I did not grant you permission to report my information to any credit reporting agency. I demand that you cease reporting this information immediately until full validation has been completed. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I expect that you will flag this account as disputed with the credit bureaus during the validation process. You are also required to cease reporting this information to any credit reporting agency while the dispute is ongoing. 

Please be advised that a copy of this letter has been forwarded to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and all three national credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) to initiate their own investigations concurrently with your review. 

If I do not receive the requested validation within the specified XXXX  days, I will take appropriate action, including filing complaints with the FTC, CFPB, and relevant state authorities. Additionally, I reserve the right to pursue private civil action for damages caused by this matter. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX c/o XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Texas XXXX Transworld Systems Inc XXXX 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Certified Mailing # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RE : Reference/ XXXX ID : XXXX To whom it may concern : Please note that this is not a refusal to pay off the account but a notice sent as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( F.D.C.P.A. ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( G ) Section 809 ( B ). This notice states that your claim is disputed and validation of the account is required. 

This notice is not a request for verification of the account or proof of my mailing address but a request for validation made pursuant to the F.D.C.P.A. laws. I humbly request that your agency/ office sends me valid proof of claim that I am legally obligated to pay you. 

Please provide me with the below mentioned items : * Evidence that the debt has not been discharged * Evidence that this debt has not been disputed * An explanation showing me how you have computed the amount.

* Copies of any original wet ink signature documents that prove I agreed to pay the alleged amount * The identity of the original creditor * Proof that the original creditor has assigned you security interest as the holder in due course * Evidence that you are a licensed debt collector * Evidence of your license numbers and your registered agent. 

I would like to inform you that in case your agency has reported invalidated account information to any of the three main credit bureaus such as XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, then it will be regarded as a fraudulent action under both federal and state statutes. Due to this reason, if any negative item is reported to any of my credit reports by your agency or the agency that you represent, then I will be compelled to take legal steps against you for the below mentioned reasons : * Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( F.C.R.A. ) * Violation of the F.D.C.P.A. 
* Defamation of character * Use of my copyrighted property I would like to further inform you that if any action is taken during the validation period which could be regarded as detrimental to any of my credit reports, then I will seek advice about initiating a potential lawsuit. This includes listing any information on a credit report that could be incorrect or invalidated, or confirming an account as correct when, in fact, there is no provided evidence that it is. 

If your agency can provide me with the requested documents, I will need a minimum of thirty ( 30 ) days to investigate this information, and during this period of time, all collection activities must be stopped. 

Also, I request that you provide evidence that I must pay you in anything other than appropriate commercial paper should the debt be proven valid because, to my knowledge, the U.S. Congress provided the appropriate remedy for me to settle my debts via the remedy in House Joint Resolution ( H.J.R. ) 192 of XX/XX/XXXX under the United States, Public Law 73-10, and Public Law 48 stat. 112 ( among others ).

If your agency/ company fails to respond to this debt validation request within a period of ten ( 10 ) days from the date of your receipt of my notice and affidavit, then the account information must be completely deleted from my credit report, and a copy of such deletion request should be sent to me at once, or I will take legal action. 

I would also like to request, in writing, that no calls should be made by your agency or company at my residence or workplace. If your agency attempts to make unlimited or computer generated calls to me or any third parties, then it will be considered harassment, and I will have no option but to file a lawsuit. All future communications with me should be done in writing and sent to the address mentioned in this letter. Further, any correspondence must be made in the form of a commercial affidavit under penalty of perjury and sent by certified mail. Any other form of service shall be deemed defective upon its face. 

It would be advisable that you assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. This is an attempt to correct your records. Any information obtained shall be used for that purpose. 



Respectfully, _________________________________ XXXX XXXX All Rights Reserved Authorized Agent for XXXX XXXX, Creditor

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
The credit card company, Care Credit, has created schemes to fraudulently overcharge its customers with high interest rates and fees. Care Credit is primarily used to pay dentist bills. The company initially offers a plan with an APR interest, credit limit, late fee, and deferred interest due date. It appears to be a normal credit card at first. However, when the account is actually charged, the deal changes each time at the point of sale. A new deal is generated with a different interest rate and due date. At the point of sale, the customer can not see the new deal and is unaware of the changes. Employees at dentist offices charge Care Credit accounts without informing their patients about the new deal. The employees simply print out a receipt for the patient without an explanation. The dental staff unknowingly participate in Care Credits fraud. In turn, most customers are unaware that the deal has changed and eventually get caught up in significantly high interest charges. Care Credit starts calculating interest at the point of sale. The company offers a deferred interest rate for a specific time then adds all the calculated interest to the customers monthly statement the second a charge is late. For example, whenever a charge is deferred for XXXX months, Care Credit will bill for the full XXXX months of interest, if the charge is not paid-in-full within XXXX months. No matter how much money has been paid toward the initial charge. And, usually the interest is extremely high, around 29.99 % +. Care Credits fraud takes place each time the card is used. Care Credit changes the due date and interest rate for each deal at the point of sale to confuse its customers who are dealing with dental issues. Most people who use this card do not have law school degrees and are taken advantage of repeatedly. Care Credit floods its customers with email schemes to entice its victims into charging more. When the card is not being used often, Care Credit repeatedly sends offers promising statement credits when large purchases are made. They have sent offers for chances to win a {$5000.00} XXXX XXXX with {$500.00} Weekly Winners and other Sweepstakes. Care Credit uses gambling tactics to lure their victims into spending more to Earn More Entries! Care Credit has never sent emails about the changes to their interest rates, due dates, etc. Care Credits deceitful activities should be deemed illegal. My own experience with Care Credit started in XX/XX/XXXX. The office manager described Care Credit as insurance and created an account for me on her computer. I could not see her computer screen nor what she was typing. She did not inform me of what she was reading or approving while she created my account. She simply wrote down my account number on a sticky note and said I had 6 months to pay off all charges. I knew nothing else about Care Credit nor its policies and simply used my Care Credit account number that was stored on their computer each time I visited. I thought Care Credit was connected somehow. I recently was informed about Care Credits schemes. I called the company and, for the first time, was told that I had nearly {$300.00} of interest that had accumulated within several months. I called the office manager and she insisted that every charge had 6 months deferred interest as she told me in the beginning. However, she was wrong and Care Credit has forced me to pay high interest. Additionally, they closed my account without warning after having the account XXXX year and XXXX month, XXXX month after updating their new terms and conditions without offering me an opportunity to participate in their new terms and conditions, due to XXXX late payments, in which I was charged {$30.00} for each late payments. This brings me to my next point of them unexpectedly raising the interest rate to 32.99 %. They did this to accommodate their new terms and conditions ( XX/XX/XXXX ), while holding me accountable for their new interest rate of 32.99 %, yet holding me responsible by closing my account for their old terms and conditions, per their words, for making late payments. This can cause my utilization to go up, and credit score to drop. 

The employees at dentist offices are selling a product they know little about without fully disclosing the terms and conditions to their patients. Again, these activities should be illegal.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
hello I am filing to formally lodge a complaint against [ Agency of credit control ] acct # XXXX regarding their handling of a debt that they have claimed as a loss on their taxes but continues to report on my credit report. This situation raises significant concerns regarding compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

According to the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, a furnisher of information, such as a collection agency, is required to provide accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Additionally, 1681i mandates that consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate information on their credit reports. 

In this instance, the collection agency reported a debt that they have classified as a " loss '' for tax purposes. This classification suggests that they have written off the debt, which raises questions about the legitimacy of their ongoing reporting of this account on my credit report. The continued presence of this account is not only misleading but also detrimental to my creditworthiness. 

I have attempted to resolve this issue directly with [ Agency of credit control ] but have not received a satisfactory response. I also requested a copy of schedule c again no response Therefore, I am reaching out to the CFPB for assistance in enforcing my rights under the FCRA.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing a hard inquiry on my credit report initiated by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and STELLANTIS which occurred on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX. These inquiries were conducted when I applied for financing for a vehicle. Despite my legitimate need to secure transportation for my family, the application was denied, and the inquiry remains on my credit report. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), consumer reports may only be accessed for permissible purposes, such as evaluating creditworthiness for a legitimate credit transaction initiated by the consumer. As the consumer, I am the lawful owner of my credit information, which means any entity seeking to access or use it must do so with explicit authorization and solely for permissible purposes. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and STELLANTIS, as data furnishers under the FCRA, have a legal obligation to ensure that credit inquiries are conducted in compliance with this law. The continued presence of these inquiries on my credit report, despite the denial of credit, raises serious concerns about whether my credit report was accessed properly and for a permissible purpose. Additionally, the handling of my personal information by these companies may constitute a violation of the Privacy Act of XXXX which mandates that personal data be accessed and used only for legitimate and authorized purposes.

The denial of credit and the resulting inquiry have caused significant harm to my family and me, and I believe my rights under these federal laws have been violated.

On XX/XX/year> the transaction had fully processed and I was ready to pay back the {$2500.00}. I went to pay off the loan on the app but there was no where to direct the payment directly to the loan but rather just the card itself. I called the XXXX number to seek further directions. At that time the agent told me that there wasn't a way to pay directly to the loan and that the disclosure statement, states that if I paid the {$2500.00} it would go to the highest interest rate balance first and then once it is at XXXX the loan would then be paid. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was put on hold for a supervisor. I explained the situation again and was given the same canned answer from the script. I expressed my frustration with the deceptive way CITI offers the XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX that are 2 entirely different products but are easily confused. I also expressed it was deceptive to tell customers they could pay off the loan early without penalty when in fact they can't if they have a card balance. The card balance will always be paid first even if you have paid the minimum for the month. I asked based on the situation could we simple reverse the loan and move on. the CITI representatives stuck to the company script and made no attempts to assist me on the situation. 
I notified them I would be writing CITI and asking for a correction and in addition I would be reporting them for vague and deceptive marketing practices. The need to clearly state that you can only pay off the loan early if you have a {$0.00} card balance. They also need to insure the consumer does not inadvertently select the wrong product that are named very similar but have very different offerings.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX MO XXXX XXXX Subject : Follow-Up on Disputed Debts Due to Identity Theft Request for Validation ( Account number XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to follow up on my previous disputes regarding the account referenced above. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you provide verification of these debts, including but not limited to the following : 1. The amount of the debt and a breakdown of any charges or fees applied to the balance.

3. Proof that I am legally obligated to pay this debt, including any documents or agreements signed by me.

4. Verification that this debt is not the result of identity theft, including supporting documentation or proof of how this account was opened and who authorized the charges.

Please be aware that until I receive proper validation of these debts, I consider it disputed. I request that you cease all collection activities, including reporting this debt to the credit bureaus, until you can provide the requested documentation to prove the legitimacy of the said debts. If you are unable to provide the necessary verification, I expect the this account be deleted from my credit file.

I expect a response within 30 days, as required by law. If you fail to provide the requested documentation, I will take appropriate steps to protect my rights, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and my states Attorney General. I will also consider taking legal action to ensure that my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act are upheld. 
Please respond in writing to the address above. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX )

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently opened an account with Citi and completed the required steps to verify my personal information. I also provided my contact information, including my telephone number ( XXXX ) and email address ( XXXX ). After opening the account, I deposited checks via mobile check deposit, waited for them to clear, and then used XXXX to transfer money to my wifes account since I have not yet received a debit card and there are no Citi branches in my area. 

Initially, there were no issues with these transactions. However, after receiving a XXXX payment of {$650.00}, I sent {$310.00} from that amount to cover a bill. While Citi shows the transaction as completed, the funds never arrived in my wifes account. As I tried to resolve this issue, I suddenly lost access to my online account and was instructed to call the fraud department. 

When I contacted the fraud department, I experienced extremely poor customer service. Representatives were dismissive, unhelpful, and even mocking. Despite my ability to verify my Social Security number, drivers license number, and other personal information, I was unable to verify my debit card number because I have not yet received it. This is precisely why I had been relying on XXXX for transfers, all within the allowable limits. 

Additionally, Citi informed me that they could not verify my phone number, even though it is registered in my name through XXXX XXXX XXXX and was the number I used to sign up for the account. They also claimed my email address couldnt be verified, despite the fact that I received fraud alerts at this same email and used it when opening the account. 

As a result, I was told that I would have to wait up to XXXX business days to receive a code in the mail to regain access to my account. This delay is unacceptable, as I urgently need access to my funds. The situation has caused significant financial hardship and disrupted my ability to manage essential expenses. 

Throughout this ordeal, Ive faced repeated challenges : Customer service representatives have been rude, refused to provide their names or employee IDs, and hung up on me multiple times. 
Ive been told on at least XXXX calls that the system is down, and the call ends abruptly. 
Attempts to escalate the matter to supervisors have been consistently denied. 

I have made every effort to cooperate and offered to verify my identity through other means, but the resolution Citi has proposed ( sending a code via mail ) is not viable given the circumstances. I need immediate access to my account and my funds to avoid further financial and personal hardship. 

I urge Citi to address this matter promptly and fairly.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to demand the immediate cessation of all unauthorized disclosures and activities related to my personal information, including transaction history shared with XXXX XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX. These actions have been conducted without my explicit consent and constitute violations of my rights as a federally protected consumer under various laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, and the Privacy Act. 

I am issuing the following STOP ORDER and demands for action, effective immediately : Immediate Cessation of Data Sharing : All sharing, reporting, or dissemination of my personal information to third parties, including XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, or other similar agencies, must immediately cease. This includes the unauthorized reporting of any transaction history or personal data. 

Opt-Out Notification : In accordance with 15 USC 6508 , I am exercising my legal right to OPT OUT of any and all disclosures of my personal information. I withdraw any and all previous authorizationswhether written, verbal, implied, or non-verbalunder the following laws : 15 USC 6802 ( Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) Preventing the further disclosure of my non-public personal information.

12 CFR 1016.7 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( ii ) ( FCRA ) I formally revoke any previous consent, whether expressed or implied, for the use or disclosure of my data by your organization.

Revocation of Consent : I fully revoke any and all prior written, unwritten, verbal, or non-verbal authorizations provided to your organization for the disclosure of my personal information, effective immediately.

Social Security Number Protection : In accordance with 5 USC 522a ( Privacy Act ), my Social Security number must not be disclosed to any third parties except for federal agencies as required by law. Any unauthorized disclosures are strictly prohibited and must be corrected immediately. 

Removal of All Inquiries : As per 17 CFR 424, I demand that all inquiries related to my personal information be removed from your records and from any third-party reporting systems, including credit agencies, within 10 business days.

Inaccurate Reporting : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 ) and 16 CFR 313.6 & 313.7, I dispute any inaccurate or unauthorized reports regarding my personal information. All errors must be corrected and removed immediately. 

Interest Payments from Account Trading : Additionally, I require that all interest payments generated from the trading or use of my account be immediately directed back to me. These payments belong to me, and failure to return these funds may trigger a securitization audit. Such an audit could result in IRS scrutiny and potential legal consequences for all involved parties. I expect full transparency regarding any funds accrued through trading activity associated with my account. 

This letter serves as my final notice to demand full compliance with the actions outlined above. Failure to immediately halt the unauthorized sharing of my data and direct all relevant interest payments to me will result in further legal action, including the filing of complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and other appropriate agencies. Additionally, failure to return the interest payments as requested will trigger a securitization audit, which could involve IRS investigation. 

This STOP ORDER and Opt-Out Authorization is effective immediately and will remain in effect indefinitely. 

I expect a written confirmation of your compliance with this request within required response time by law from the date of this notice. If I do not receive a satisfactory response, I will pursue all available legal remedies to protect my rights and ensure compliance with applicable laws.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened an account with Bank of American via the online application process on XXXX XXXX and also deposited {$25.00} to the said account. I received an email stating my application has been approved. I also enrolled for access into the online banking application. During the last week of XXXX I could not log in into my online banking application and it said my account doesn't exist. On XX/XX/XXXX I call the bank to check why I'm not able to access the account, only to understand that my account has been closed. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I receive a letter from the bank that they have decided to close the account as they are unable to verify my identity and that I have been reported to XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX and will have trouble to open an account for the next 5 years. 

I call the bank on XX/XX/XXXX to understand more. I was told that being a new customer the bank does not take any additional steps to verify consumers and merely closed the account and reports to XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX 

This is a serious flaw in the Bank of America online application process that approves applications without proper customer identification or background check. The verification, as I understand from my experience, is done days after the account opening. 

The deficiency in application is not communicated to the customer nor are they given a chance to respond or remedy the deficiency identified. The account is merely closed and the customer is logged out of the application, unaware of why he or she is logged out. Consumer complaint narrative: YOUR COMPLAINT This letter serves as my formal demand under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) for a complete validation of the debts you claim I owe, associated with the accounts listed above. Despite my prior requests, you have failed to provide sufficient evidence that these debts are mine, which violates my rights as a consumer. Furthermore, I have attached : A new police report confirming fraudulent activity. Updated documentation disputing these debts. This Cease and Desist letter. Violations and Legal Obligations Your failure to respond adequately to my validation requests and your ambiguous statements constitute violations of the following : FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692e : Prohibits false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Requires debt collectors to verify disputed information with the creditor and ensure accuracy. Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Guidance on Debt Collection Practices : Warns against vague or misleading communication, which can constitute an unfair or deceptive act or practice ( UDAP ). You are also violating my rights under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Unfair Trade Practices and Consumer Protection Law ) by failing to provide transparency and accountability in your collection practices. Legal Remedies Available Failure to comply with these laws exposes you to civil liability, including actual damages, statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, and coverage of attorney fees under the FDCPA and FCRA. Cease and Desist Demand Effective immediately, I demand that you : Cease all communication with me regarding these accounts, except to provide the debt validation as required under federal law. Provide a comprehensive validation of the debts, including : A signed agreement or contract proving my responsibility for the alleged debts. Full account histories showing how the amounts were calculated. Evidence that your agency has legal authority to collect these debts. Inform the creditors ( XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX ) that these accounts are in dispute. Next Steps If I do not receive a satisfactory resolution within 30 days, I will have no choice but to file complaints with : The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) My states Attorney Generals Office the gialed to respond to me so I am filling the complaint

Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted Barclay yesterday in regards to the previous complaint. I let them know that I saw the response in regards to the letter on XX/XX/XXXX, and that the response was incorrect. Barclays fraud department, supervisor team, customer service team, and finance team, are all aware that there have been clerical errors in regards to them, charging the credits that were due back to me, and that in regards to conversations stating that they had completed everything in XX/XX/XXXX was incorrect. I was working with XXXX, and he had provided additional statements because there were 4 different cards circulating at the same time, and two of them we were not even aware existed. He also stated that the credits that were due to me in XXXX appeared to be a clerical error where they had charged us instead of credited us. I was on the phone with Barclay for over XXXX XXXX hours yesterday trying to get the fraud department and the supervisors to address the situation in regards to the fact that not only are we owed credit that was not done by the fraud department, but they had also taken money out of our bank account as a payment, instead of crediting the money back to our account. I explained to the manager last night that the fraud department had been so rude to me in my recorded conversation with them that the customer service rep that forwarded me to her, cried on the phone at the way that I had been treated by that department. Sadly, the supervisor was just as rude and ended up hanging up on me in regards to the fact that not only did they still owe me credits for the fraud that they had approved entirely by the details that we supplied to them as they stated in the enclosed letter that they sent to you, but they had not issued those credits and they had not refunded the money that they accidentally withdrew from our checking account instead of giving us a refund. I can only state that I assume the supervisor hung up on me because no one attempted to call me back and no one was available when I tried to call back. When I called back today in regards to speaking with someone or trying to get a phone number for their executive offices my call was disconnected again. This company owes me over {$50000.00}. Due to clerical errors and credits they havent issued. As supplied by them in my formal complaint they indeed agreed that everything was awarded in our favor. I appreciate you supplying me a copy of that letter because we never received it in the mail and no one stated that that had been done. That being said, the only issue that needs to be rectified at this point are the additional credits that need to be handled due to the clerical errors in their financial department. This company also closed my card after almost a decade of being a loyal customer that was never late on a single payment. I need any assistance whatsoever to get these funds returned to us. We did receive our current statement in the mail today, but it states that we owe them XXXX dollars instead of the fact that they owe us almost {$50000.00}. I dont know what to do at this point, and I need any phone numbers and any organization numbers and any information that I can get to get this escalated to someone within this company thats actually going to care. I was actually told by the fraud department that I needed to mail my statements into their company so they can review them. How can a company not have their own documentation again? The customer service team was extremely polite, and was hit with the same brick wall when she tried to speak to a supervisor in the fraud department. She gave me a different number to call because fraud was refusing to take my phone call. I dont understand how these things can be overlooked and then closed after they claim that everything has been awarded in my favor. I am not disagreeing that they dont owe me a bunch of money. They are just not returning it to me, and then they are refusing to talk to me in regards to the money that they owe me. I dont know. I understand how we can be victimized by financial exploitation and fraud, and then be victimized by the companies that are supposed to be protecting us in the process I dont understand how the companies can then commit financial exploitation themselves by refusing to return your money or refusing to discuss the facts needed for your refund. I have contacted so many departments, looking for someone to assist us, that I dont know who else to call. The customer service representative that I spoke to last night made extensive notes on my account in regards to the money that is owed to me and the fraud department and the supervisor refuse to read a single one, and then I called back to the customer service department to see if their departments were able to see those and they stated that yes they were clearly noted. Every single XXXX was noted that that company owes us. At this point I dont even care if somebody could give me the phone number to the local news station where theyre located at. Maybe if I get a news crew in there and I can make this public and let people know whats going on and let people know that you can be a victim of fraud and that a credit card company can steal your money on top of it too and just close your complaint by stating that they let me know that I won every XXXX back that I requested. So if you know what state they actually live in or city they actually live in. I will call the new station. I will fly there and I will go live if thats what its gon na take. I just need someone to help me and I am desperate. Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: Im formally filing a complaint against Citi Bank Credit Card because I believe that they have mishandled my dispute. On XX/XX/year>, I booked a car rental through XXXX  website for {$110.00} from XX/XX/year> to XX/XX/year> in XXXX, XXXX while travelling there. I went to pick up the car on XX/XX/year> at XXXX airports parking lot from XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, a company called XXXX. Upon arrival at the parking lot where the car was, I met a man from XXXX. He told me that he would need my credit card for security deposit. I gave him my XXXX credit card which was the card I used to book the rental on XXXX  website. He said my card was declined but I knew my card wasnt declined because I didnt get notification from XXXX. He then told me that he will wave the security deposit if I paid a fee of {$100.00}. I politely declined his offer and told him that wasnt part of the deal. He also wouldnt accept my XXXX XXXX or my XXXX XXXX  credit cards. He only accepted the Citi bank credit card. He charged my Citi bank credit card a security deposit of {$1500.00}. He told me that when I bring the car back, he would refund my security deposit I brought the car back on XX/XX/year> at XXXX. The same man and a woman were there at the parking lot. After briefly inspecting the car, the woman said that there was a new a damage to the car. I asked her to show me the damage because I couldnt see any damage. She then pointed to a small scratch less than 3 inches on the bottom side of the front bumper. This was very tiny, you have to know exactly where to look for it in order to see it. I told her that this damage wasnt a new damage. Luckily I took a video of the whole car before I checked out the car. I asked the woman to refund the security deposit. She said that ok give me your card. I gave her my card but instead of refunding the security deposit ( {$1500.00} ), she made a new charge on the card in the amount of {$1400.00}. She blatantly lied to me and told me that she was refunding my security deposit but instead made unauthorised charge. When I asked her why she made a charge that I didnt agree to it, she told me that I should make insurance claim. I never agreed to their damage claim. I had a proof that the damage was pre-existing. I immediately went to the police station to report the illegal unauthorised charge. I also immediately called Citi bank customer service and reported the unauthorised charge. They told me that they will open a fraud investigation. I also made claim to the insurance. The insurance asked me to send them the inspection video. The insurance then told me that they would not cover it as this was a pre-existing. Citi bank closed the fraud investigation after a week in favorite of the merchant. I called them and they told me that I gave the merchant my card and I received a service from the merchant. I told them that I didnt not authorise the charge and I paid for the rental car through XXXX website with my XXXX  credit card. I explained to them that the damage theyre claiming was pre-existing and that I had a video to proof it. They then told that they will open a dispute investigation. They closed the dispute on XX/XX/XXXX on favorite of the merchant. They sent me a letter detailing the dispute with the merchants response. After reading it, I was shocked. The merchant didnt prove that I authorised the charge. They just lied and said I accepted responsibility for the damage and gave them my card willingly. They have also contradicted on their response and added my hard written statement which states they are claiming a damage that Im not aware of. I called Citi bank dispute department and told them that they lied on their response letter. I told them that I didnt authorise the charge and that I never accepted their claim of the damage. Citi bank then told me that they will continue the dispute and sent me documents to sign in order to continue the dispute. I signed the document and faxed to them. Meanwhile Citi bank reversed the credit and billed me for this charge although the dispute was still open and not resolved. I called them again and told them that they billed me a charge in which the dispute still ongoing. The lady I spoke with told me that she would send a note to the person who was handling my dispute. But credit was never issued and Citi bank continued to bill me on the disputed charge while it was still unsolved. They mishandled this dispute very bad and I believe they breached their contract by billing me while the dispute was still under investigation. They sent me a letter on XX/XX/XXXX which was dated on XX/XX/XXXX informing me that they closed the dispute, once again in favour of the merchant. This was extremely frustrating. I was very disappointed and lost confidence on Citi bank. I felt like they already decided they were going to rule in favour of the merchant even before the investigation was complete. This impacted me greatly in my mental and physical health. I lost a lot of sleep over this and experienced a lot of stress to the point that I could rest at night. It was very sad because I knew 100 % that these people were scamming me yet I felt helpless because my credit card company failed to properly investigate. I have the evidence that debunks their claim of the damage. This crucial evidence was not even mentioned on the dispute result letter. Even now through the Citi app the dispute is still showing as no resolved although the bill is past due. The due date was XX/XX/year> but it reads 5 days past due as of XX/XX/year>.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting a formal complaint regarding XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( doing business as FortiFI ) for engaging in unfair business practices, neglecting consumer protection obligations, and allowing price gouging in connection with my PACE loan for home improvements. FortiFI provided {$77000.00} in financing to XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, without adequate assessment or safeguards. This failure to ensure fair practices led to excessive pricing and predatory tactics used by XXXX XXXX, which FortiFI permitted to participate in the PACE program. 
XXXX XXXX applied high-pressure tactics to secure my agreement to the loan from FortiFI, claiming it was necessary for home improvements. FortiFI not only released funds to XXXX without verifying the validity of the assessment but also failed to monitor the transaction to prevent price gouging. Recently, FortiFI issued XXXX checks to me to address overcharges on the assessment, yet this action does not rectify the inflated initial loan amount or mitigate the substantial financial burden I have borne since XXXX, as I have paid taxes and interest on this loan for over five years.

Despite my repeated complaints and the existence of numerous allegations against XXXX, FortiFI has not canceled my loan. On XX/XX/XXXX, the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation ( DFPI ) issued a Desist and Refrain Order against XXXX XXXX due to fraudulent activity. Yet, FortiFI has avoided responsibility for failing to properly vet or oversee XXXX practices. In my DFPI complaint dated XX/XX/XXXX, FortiFI acknowledged that XXXX XXXX held a current and active CSLB license. However, despite this, FortiFI allowed XXXX to receive loan funds without officially enrolling them in the PACE program, placing me and others at risk of financial harm. 
Given these factors, I believe FortiFI has failed in its consumer protection obligations and violated my rights as a borrower under several laws, including : California Business and Professions Code 17200 ( Unfair Competition Law - UCL ) Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act ( Dodd-Frank Act ) I request that the CFPB investigate FortiFIs business practices, particularly their lack of oversight and approval of unjustified charges. I am also requesting that FortiFI cancel my loan entirely to address the financial harm caused by their facilitation of this inflated and predatory transaction. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a late notice for my mortgage in XX/XX/year> which I always pay in full every month. When I called on XX/XX/year>, to look into what was going on, it turned out the problem originated from my new insurance policy. I had re-done my XXXX insurance policy in the spring or summer of 2024 to account for a new roof I had installed. Shellpoint still had XXXX insurance policies on the books in my account even though the old one was marked expired according to the rep. I was being charged for both policies for the escrow account. The one that ends with XXXX should have been removed. The rep said it could take 30-45 days to re-run the escrow. In the meantime, I should pay my overdue mortgage amount. I told her I couldnt because I didnt have thousands of dollars lying around. 
I asked to speak to a supervisor, who told me his name is XXXX XXXX. He said he would have an expedited run on the escrow, and it would take a week. In the meantime, he recommended that I pay my XXXX mortgage early to prevent getting more threatening letters and calls. He opened up case number XXXX for the matter. He said he also opened up case number XXXX to make sure my credit score wouldnt be affected. 
I called back on XX/XX/year>, more than a week later. It seemed that nothing had been done on my account. I spent a long time on hold with someone in the insurance department who said after a long while that she got the extra insurance removed from my account. They transferred me back to customer service who assured me I have no late charges on my account, but Im not sure its true. I see on my last statement that I have Total Fees and Charges for {$44.00} and Overdue Payment for {$510.00}. 
The rep also said it would take a couple of weeks to re-run the escrow. It should have been done already per the expedited status I was promised on the XX/XX/XXXX call. I asked to speak to a supervisor again, but I was put on hold for a long time. I had been more than an hour on this call, and I had to hang up and do other things. 
Im writing this complaint to make sure : * The escrow and billing accurately reflect what I owe * That no charges or fees stemming from the companys mistakes are charged to my account * That my credit score is not affected by the companys mistakes. 

I acted responsibly by paying my mortgage on time, early paying to cover for their mistake, and spending lots of time on hold and navigating their phone trees. I would like a letter of apology, also.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
