Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Card opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative:
We've owned our timeshare for a year now, and over this period, its become clear to us that we were emotionally manipulated into acquiring it. XXXX clearly told the representative that while we might consider it in the future, our financial situation at the time made this an impractical decision. Despite us repeatedly stating we couldnt afford it, the representativesparticularly XXXX persistently urged with comments like, Dont you want to do this for your wife? This pressure was inappropriate, given our financial constraints and other urgent responsibilities. The encounter with XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and a financial team member with a XXXX  accent left us feeling cornered and emotionally pressured. The initial approach at the shopping center, where they shared a personal story of tragedy, was laden with emotional manipulation. Looking back, we regret not walking away after the presentation, but their friendliness made it hard to say no. 

We were also coerced into signing up for a credit card as part of this process, adding further financial strain. The timeshare was originally pitched as a flexible plan where we could use our points at hotels worldwide, making spontaneous trips easier. We were promised an additional XXXX points on top of our initial XXXX, totaling XXXX for our first annual points, with the bonus supposedly valid until the end of our second year. These points were essential for us since we planned to use them for a long-delayed honeymoon. However, during a follow-up call with Wyndham, we learned that these extra points had already expired. Despite owning the timeshare for a year, we haven't had a chance to use it. This is due to our limited paid vacation timeonly one week per year, including sick daysmaking it difficult to use the points as intended, which XXXX tried explaining to the representative. 

This timeshare purchase has been a huge mistake, resulting in specific hardships and sacrifices. The decision has negatively impacted our credit scores and diverted funds we had allocated for other essential parts of our lives. We didnt realize that acquiring the timeshare would equate to taking on the burden of a new mortgage, a fact that came to light only when our mortgage team contacted XXXX after our home purchase in XX/XX/XXXX. Further financial strain arose when we needed car financing following XXXX accident in XX/XX/XXXX. The lack of transparency about the credit card, which was signed up through a third party without our knowledge, raises serious concerns about how our personal information was handled. The combined financial strain, unfulfilled promises, and inability to use the timeshare make this investment feel entirely unworthy. 

Our understanding of the timeshare 's functionality grew more confusing when we tried to use our points at a Wyndham hotel. Contrary to what we were led to believe, we could only use reward points earned from other stays, not the points we purchased. Learning about the narrow ten-day window for cancellation was yet another unexpected surprise. This timeshare has not only failed to meet our expectations but has also severely impacted our quality of life. The financial stress and burden it created have prevented us from fully settling into our home. The lack of enjoyment and fulfillment from this investment only reinforces our desire to terminate the agreement. 

Considering all these factors, we feel the only reasonable path forward is to seek the cancellation of our timeshare. We would greatly appreciate any guidance on the steps needed to relieve us of this financial and emotional burden. The misinformation around the points system and the premature expiration of bonus points have been especially frustrating, and our inability to use the timeshare for intended purposes like our honeymoon has been a significant letdown. Weve also discovered that the promised flexibility of using points wherever affiliated with the company was not as simple as suggested in the sales pitch. The credit score impact and the hidden third-party credit card add to our concerns regarding the timeshares ethical practices, and we believe these issues warrant serious examination.

In light of these additional points, we hope our situation is given a thorough review and that we receive a fair and timely resolution, one that acknowledges the emotional and financial distress this timeshare has caused.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Please refer to the details in Closed Compliant XXXX. The company has NOT resolved the complaint. 

I received a response from Citibank dated XX/XX/year>. The response did NOT resolve the complaint. The company 's response continued to confirm that they failed to apply the extra payments to the highest interest rate balance ( Balance Transfer Offer XXXX ) as required by their policies and regulations. The company 's response states that interest rates listed on the prior statement are applicable rates to determine which balance portion has the highest rate. The company states a good " rule '' is to wait until the statement has cycled to make extra payments. Their " rule '' is clearly only beneficial to Citibank for charging higher rates of interest.This " rule '' also appears to conflict with their policies and federal regulations. 

To be clear, the company 's response contradicts the actual interest charges made to the account. If the company 's response were accurate, the rate on Balance Transfer Offer XXXX would not have been 26+ % as of XX/XX/year>, because it was 0 % on the prior statement. The company would also not have charged interest of {$99.00} ; Interest they now offer to refund as a " courtesy ''. The company appears to be using their " prior statement rule '' for extra payments as it benefits them because they are definitely not using the " prior statement rule '' for charging interest to the consumer. Based on this " rule '', the consumer can not pay off a higher interest rate balance until the next statement, ensuring Citi is able to charge interest to the consumer during that time period.

1. The cardmember agreement does not specify the method the company will use to apply payments ( based on prior statement rate or the rate on actual date of payment ).

2. The customer service representative assured me on XX/XX/year> that the extra payment would be applied to Balance Transfer Offer XXXX ( the highest interest rate balance ) and that my previous extra payment had also been applied to that higher rate balance.

3. Federal regulations require extra payments be applied to the highest interest rate balance first.

4. Company correspondence continues to confirm that the company 's records clearly reflected the higher interest rate on Balance Transfer Offer XXXX on XX/XX/year>, the date of the extra payment, ( because they started charging interest on XX/XX/year> ). Their records indicated the Balance Transfer Offer was the highest interest rate balance and they clearly failed to apply the payments properly.

The fraudulent creation and use of these accounts also constitute a fraudulent conveyance, as they were created to defraud creditors and other parties. This is a violation of state laws governing fraudulent transfers. 
Unconstitutional Taking and Involuntary Servitude The unauthorized use of my personal information to create and access these accounts has resulted in the unconstitutional taking of my private property without just compensation. This violates the XXXX XXXX to the United States XXXX. Additionally, the forced labor and financial burdens imposed on me as a result of these fraudulent accounts constitute involuntary servitude, a violation of the XXXX XXXX to the United States XXXX. 
XXXX of XXXX and XXXX of Rights The actions of your organization and its agents have been carried out under the XXXX of law, which is the appearance or use of lawful power to mask an illegal act. By using government authority to access and control my financial information without my consent, your organization has deprived me of my inalienable rights, in violation of XXXX XXXX. XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer, I have opted out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have provided to MilitaryStar written, unwritten, verbal, and nonverbal per 15 U.S. Code 6802. This opt out is effective immediately and indefinitely. Per 16 CFR 313.7 ( e ) & ( f ), You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. The term You includes each financial institution over which the Commission has rulemaking authority pursuant to section 504 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( C ) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6804 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( C ) ). 

MilitaryStar is reporting an account to XXXX XXXX and XXXX as a Charge-Off account which is considered a Certificate of Indebtedness, which means that it is income and must be removed. Per IRS Publication 4681 Cat. No. XXXX, Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return unless one of the exceptions or exclusions described later applies. This publication also states that upon the disposition of the property securing a nonrecourse debt, the amount realized includes the entire unpaid amount of the debt, not just the FMV of the property.

MilitaryStar has also been reporting my transaction history with XXXX XXXX and XXXX, which are Third Party/Non-Affiliates. According to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Privacy Policy Revised ( date ), they dont share information about your transactions and experiences to their affiliates nor do they share them with non-affiliates. I have attached proof that they have in fact shared information about my transactions and experiences to XXXX XXXX and XXXX, which is illegal and a violation the Privacy Act of 1974. 

Per 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. The Congress makes the following findings : ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. ( XXXX ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers. ( XXXX ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers. ( XXXX ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. 

Per 15 USC 1681 section 604 any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

MilitaryStar representatives may try to argue that these statues and codes do not apply to them, but 16 CFR 433.2 is on every installment agreement since the XXXX day of XX/XX/XXXX. The installment agreement also has TILA and the finance charge on it as well, so these statues and codes do in fact apply to them. They have infringed upon my right to privacy causing me to experience significant pain, suffering, and humiliation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I called to change the address on my Visa credit card that I have through US Bank, which is my hometown/family bank. 

While on the phone, I was told that I was eligible for an upgrade because I have a good history with the bank and paying off my credit card. 

The term upgrade was used throughout the conversation. Because of this I didnt understand that I was opening up a new and different credit card, I thought that my existing line of credit was being altered and improved. 

Im confident that I consented to the hard credit check, but it wasnt clear to me why that was necessary for an upgrade but I foolishly let the bank XXXX assure me that this was normal and necessary for the upgrade. 

When I received an email about my new credit card, I realized that I wasnt receiving an upgrade at all, I was just sold a new, separate credit card. 

It was a very embarrassing situation. Im planning on switching banks eventually, but its a bit of a hassle to transfer all of my deposit accounts and find a new financial institution.

Payment Status is inconsistent, showing Collection/Chargeoff in one place and Collection in another.

Clarifying this would help with consistency.

3. Consumer Statement and Comments : The consumer statement, I HAVE NO KNOWLEDGE OF THIS ACCOUNT, conflicts with the comment Account information disputed by consumer, meets FCRA requirements. It might benefit from clarity on whether the dispute was resolved or remains open.

4. Credit Limit and Past Due : Credit Limit and Past Due are blank or set as -, which might be incomplete. Typically, past due amounts or balances are specified, especially for derogatory accounts.

5. Two-Year Payment History : The payment history doesnt indicate any specific delinquency markers ( e.g., CO for charge-off ) that should match the derogatory status. Including more detail would give a clearer picture of missed payments or other issues.

6. Inconsistent Account Information Across Bureaus : The account type and account status may vary between bureaus, which can lead to confusion and inaccuracies in reporting.

7. Legal References ( FCRA 15USC 1681| ( 5 ) ( A ) ) : Its unclear why this legal reference is included without context. It may indicate a consumer dispute or a compliance check, but further clarification would help.

To improve accuracy, these areas could benefit from review and standardization.

Based on the information provided, here are potential Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) violations, as well as incomplete and inaccurate data points : Potential FCRA Violations 1. Inconsistent Reporting Dates Across Bureaus : The Date Opened differs across bureaus, listed as XXXXXX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) and XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ). The FCRA requires accurate and consistent reporting of account information, so this discrepancy could violate FCRA accuracy requirements. 
XXXX. Inconsistent Last Reported and Date Last Active : The Last Reported date is listed as XX/XX/XXXX in some parts and XX/XX/XXXX elsewhere. The FCRA requires that the information reported to credit bureaus is updated accurately and uniformly across agencies.

3. Missing Monthly Payment Information : The Monthly Payment field is blank, which may violate FCRA completeness requirements if this information is relevant to the account status.

4. Consumer Statement vs. Comments : The consumers statement, I HAVE NO KNOWLEDGE OF THIS ACCOUNT, conflicts with the comment Account information disputed by consumer, meets FCRA requirements. If the dispute is unresolved or inaccurately represented as resolved, this could violate FCRAs requirement for the accurate reflection of disputed information.

Incomplete or Inaccurate Data Points 1. Blank Credit Limit and Past Due Fields : Both the Credit Limit and Past Due fields are blank, which may be incomplete data if these fields are expected for a collection account. 
XXXX. Account Type Consistency : Although both XXXX and XXXX list the account type as Collection, XXXX type is unspecified here. Consistency across bureaus would improve clarity and accuracy in reporting. 
XXXX. Two-Year Payment History Missing Delinquency Markers : The two-year payment history shows no delinquency indicators ( such as CO for charge-off ) to match the derogatory status. Including specific delinquency markers for months in which payments were missed or the account was in collections would make the history more accurate. 
XXXX. Date of Last Payment Missing for XXXX : The Date of Last Payment field is empty or missing for XXXX, which could be important data for verifying the most recent payment history. 
Additional Observations Ambiguous Status with Collection/Chargeoff Designation : The accounts status is listed as Collection/Chargeoff and Derogatory, but the exact nature of this designation could be clarified. Clear differentiation between a collection and a charge- off status helps ensure accurate reporting. 
Addressing these inaccuracies and inconsistencies would enhance the reports clarity, accuracy, and compliance with the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
formally complain about the unauthorized accounts that appear on my credit report, which were initiated without my explicit consent. Despite my multiple attempts to resolve this matter over the past four months, starting in XXXX, I have yet to receive a response or resolution from your company. This inaction is a violation of my rights under both federal and state law. Legal Basis for the Complaint : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Under Pennsylvanias Unfair Trade Practices and Consumer Protection Law, any contract or financial agreement must be supported by clear evidence of debt and a copy of the contract. The accounts and inquiries listed on my credit report do not meet these requirements, as no proof of debt or contract has been provided. Federal Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : According to the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate or unauthorized information on my credit report. I have done so, and no documentation supporting the legitimacy of these accounts and inquiries has been provided within the required time frame. Failure to provide such documentation within seven days from the submission of my dispute necessitates the immediate blocking and removal of these items from my credit report. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : TILA mandates transparency in all credit-related transactions. The lack of response and failure to provide requested information on these unauthorized accounts and inquiries breaches this requirement. Police Report : As required by the aforementioned regulations, I have attached a copy of the police report I filed to substantiate the fraudulent nature of these accounts and inquiries. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding a charged-off account that continues to be reported on my credit report, despite qualifying as income under IRS guidelines . The reporting of this account without the issuance of a 1099-C form is both misleading and a violation of my rights under federal law.

Background The account in question was charged off by the creditor, which legally classifies the balance as canceled debt and, therefore, taxable income under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P. According to this provision, creditors are required to issue a 1099-C form for canceled debts exceeding {$600.00}, allowing the debtor to report it as income to the IRS. However, I have not received a 1099-C for this account, yet the creditor continues to report the balance to the credit reporting agencies as an active charge-off.

Legal Basis for Complaint Violation of IRC 6050P- The Internal Revenue Code mandates that creditors report canceled debts exceeding {$600.00} to the IRS and provide debtor with a 1099-C form. The failure to issue this form not only prevents me from properly reporting my taxable income but also raises concerns about the creditor 's adherence to federal law.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Creditors and furnishers are obligated to report accurate information to credit reporting agencies. Reporting a charged-off account as delinquent without issuing the legally required 1099-C creates an inconsistency between the IRS classification and the creditor 's reporting practices, constituting inaccurate reporting under the FCRA.

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) 1036 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) : It is considered an unfair, deceptive, or abusive act or practice ( UDAAP ) to report a charged-off account as collectible or delinquent the creditor 's reporting practices, constituting inaccurate reporting under the FCRA.
Company public response: Company disputes the facts presented in the complaint

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Discharged Debt : A discharged debt typically means that the debtor is no longer legally obligated to pay it. In bankruptcy, the discharge is granted by the bankruptcy court under 11 U.S.C. 727 ( in XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy ) or other relevant provisions. If the debt is discharged in bankruptcy, creditors, including third-party debt collectors, can not continue collection efforts unless the discharge order is violated.

3. Proof of Debt and the Wet Signature : A wet signature refers to a traditional signature on a paper document, often used in contracts. In the case of debt collection, it is not always required to prove ownership of a debt, especially if the debt has been sold. However, the third-party debt collector must provide sufficient evidence that they have standing to collect the debt, which may include proving the assignment of the debt from the original creditor.

Under FDCPA, if a debt collector is attempting to collect on a debt, they must be able to validate the debt if disputed by the consumer ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). This can include showing documentation, though it may not require a wet signature on a contract. However, if no agreement or assignment exists ( i.e., the third party can not prove they legally own the debt ), they may not have standing to collect.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq.

Bankruptcy Code : 11 U.S.C. 524 ( Discharge injunction ) and 11 U.S.C. 727 ( Discharge in XXXX  XXXX ). 
State laws may also provide additional protections, such as requiring more specific documentation or disclosures when debts are sold or transferred.

In summary, if the debt has been discharged through bankruptcy, a third-party collector can not pursue the debt, regardless of whether they have a wet signature or other documentation. If the debt has not been discharged but the collector can not prove ownership or provide appropriate documentation, they may not have the right to collect. Consumers should be vigilant in requesting validation and seeking legal counsel if they believe their rights are being violated.

I XXXX XXXX have been a victim of LJ Ross trying to extort money out of me through illegal debt collection practices for a debt that I don't even owe. Additionally, I would like the cfpb to have a record on file prior to me filing a suit aganist them if they don't comply with this cease & desist. 

Demand to Cease and Desist Collection Activities Prior to Validation of Purported Debt This constitutes legal notice under federal law that regulates the activities of collection agencies and their representatives. 
You are hereby notified, under provisions of Public Law 95-109, Section 805-C, THE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT to hereby CEASE AND DESIST in any and all attempts to collect the above debt.

Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 15 U.S.C.A 1601.1692 et al. this constitutes timely written notice that, I decline to pay the attached erroneous purported debt which is unsigned and unattested, and which I discharge and cancel in its entirety, without dishonor, on the grounds of false representation and fraud. No judgment has been entered on this matter.

15 U.S.C. 1692 ( e ) states that a " false, deceptive, and misleading representation, in connection with the collection of any debt, '' includes the false representation of the character or legal status of any debt. I have incurred no liability for this debt.

Said Notice contains, false, deceptive and misleading representations, and allegations intended to pervert the truth for the purpose of inducing me, in reliance upon such, to part with property belonging to me and to surrender certain substantive legal and constitutional rights. To act upon this Notice would divest me of my property and my prerogative rights, resulting in a legal injury to me.

Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( 4 ), Validation of Debts, if you have evidence to validate your claim that the attached presentment does not constitute fraudulent misrepresentation and that I owe this alleged disputed debt, this is a demand that, within 30 days, you provide such validation and supporting evidence to substantiate your claim. 
Until the requirements of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act have been met and your claim is validated, you have no jurisdiction to continue any collection activities against me in this matter. This is constructive notice that, absent the validation of your claim within 30 days, you must cease and desist any and all collection activity and are prohibited from contacting me, through the mail, by telephone, in person, at my home, or at my work. Your failure to do so will result in charges being filed against you with the State and Federal regulatory agencies empowered with enforcement. You are further prohibited from contacting, my employer, my bank ( s ), or any other third party. Each and every attempted contact, in violation of this Act, will constitute harassment and defamation of character, will subject your agency and/or board, and any and all agents in his/her/their individual capacities, to a liability for such damages and a further liability for legal fees to be paid to any counsel which I may retain. Further, absent such validation of your claim, you are prohibited from filing any notice of lien and/or levy and are also barred from any further legal action and from reporting any derogatory credit information to any Credit Reporting Agency , regarding this disputed purported debt.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
As I have no account with you, nor am I your customer, nor have I entered in a contract with you, I request the following information to which I am entitled under Title 15 USC 1692 et. seq., the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : LJ Ross Associates Please provide proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature.

Please evidence your authorization under 15 USC 1692 ( e ) and 15 USC 1692 ( f ) in this alleged matter.

What is your authorization of law for your collection of information?

What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt?

Please evidence your authorization to do business in my state.

Please show proof to establish balances, payments, interest rate disclosures, etc. as alleged in your demand letter.

Pursuant to 15 USC 1692g, you have 30 days from receipt of this notice to respond. Your failure to respond, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner, will work as a waiver to any and all claims in this matter, and will entitle me to presume that you sent your letter in error, and that the matter is permanently closed. 
This notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. In addition, this Notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. Moreover, this is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. I look forward to your prompt reply. I am insistent that you also send a copy of this dispute to the original creditor, so that they do not report this on my Credit Report. I further insist that if you have reported me to a Credit Reporting Company, you tell them that I am disputing this debt. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Furthermore, as you can see from the information above, your agency is not reporting accurate information. According to [ 15 USC 1681e ] ( b ), Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates.

You are in violation of the FCRA, [ 15 USC 1681b ] ( a ) ( 2 ) : ( a ) In general. Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I offer my testimony herein that I have not authorized or given anyone access to my private and confidential records and certainly not the information you're reporting.

My rights were violated, especially my right to privacy, according to [ 15 USC 1681 ] ( a ) ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumers right to privacy.

I, therefore, request that you immediately delete the items specified above from my consumer file with your agency. Failure to do so will require that I take appropriate legal action.

All these violations are a direct violation of 15 USC 1681. No consent is identity theft, and these violations are Aggravated Identity theft, according to [ 18 USC 1028A ] ( a ) ( 1 ). You have knowingly transferred, possessed, and used, without lawful authority, a means of identification of me, which is a felony punishable up to 2 years of imprisonment, in addition to civil liability.

For damages, I am invoking my rights as a consumer pursuant to 15 USC 1681 ( n ) civil liability, and I demand compensation for every violation listed below ; 1 2 3 4 5 6 Permissible purpose {$1000.00} Defamation of character {$1000.00} Damaged reputation {$1000.00} Damaged credit worthiness {$1000.00} Damaged mode of living {$1000.00} Infringed on right to privacy {$1000.00} Cease the reporting of this erroneous and deceptive information on my consumer report. Delete the specified accounts from my consumer report and all your systems.

Consumer complaint narrative: This has been going on for over eight months I have requested help and have been on the phone since XX/XX/XXXX, at least 2 to 3 hours a day. They will transfer me six times and then hang up on me. They have these tactics that have become totally predictable. Finally I was able to reach some corporate office who said they would have my issue resolved by XX/XX/XXXX that came again with the phone calls every single day multiple times being told I was on hold in the wrong department transferred never getting anywhere eventually told there is no department for this escalated complaint just request for me to be called which I did 14 times before I was called back once it's resolved and it's nowhere near the complaint that I filed. I know this was done intentionally because I read the complaint over the phone which was two sentences when I close my account the teller agreed if my wife and I make XXXX XXXX XXXX dollars a month these bills should be paid without problem, so at that time the teller put in a request for my account to be reviewed the next day closed account which I had frozen had {$1200.00} in it that I've been trying to get the rest of my account reviewed. It is never sent on a statement that I've had fees and suddenly have printed off my statement and sent it to me and it says I had {$2800.00} bounced check and late fees. This is only because the mortgage and HELOC department would put my payment in and then would pull my back out I have had automatic payment and platinum checking account for U.S. Bank for 24 years. I have not missed one payment in my mortgage and I have not missed one HELOC payment. In less than 30 days, they had already contacted the credit bureau and my wife and I who had credit of XXXX and above are now at XXXX so when I was leaving the bank, I couldn't go get another mortgage if I wanted to because the rates would be so bad. I have since gotten a letter saying that that was done correctly, but they are no longer reporting to the credit bureau which to me, seems incredibly backwards that now it can be two months late and not reported, but it can be reported before they even try contacting me and before my statement even comes out. They were making financial decisions on my behalf. My wife got paid that Monday if they had just left the payment in I would've rather paid the fee which there has never been platinum before but now suddenly I'm being hit with all these fees. I waited till the next day after a night of not sleeping. The next day, I called the branch where I made the deposit. The representative basically told me you have to go back to customer service. I asked if they could just count the deposits made in the atm. XXXX XXXX, I was laid off last XXXX and Ive been going to school and trying to find a job, but I do get funds from my dad. Thats where the funds came from. I also received a XXXX day notice from my landlord. I called the XXXX office line and gentleman was nice enough to provide me with the XXXX complaint line. I emailed them immediately. I received a call XXXX days later telling me that they would immediately look into my account. I called the branch and was connected with a account XXXX and she said that they hadnt received a notification that the atm had malfunctioned. This is XXXX days later. She called me back that evening to let me know the atm had malfunctioned. I received a letter XXXX weeks later that my credit card had been cancelled after I checked my online account information notified me that the account had been closed due to returned charges. I had notified them that I was making g a deposit and that I had lost my job but would make the deposit for my checking account. Keep in mind, I had never been late on my payments. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally express my concerns regarding my recent experiences with my checking and savings accounts at Citibank, specifically related to the handling of a third-party check deposit and subsequent access to my funds. 

I opened both accounts not long ago, accompanied by my wife, and made an initial deposit. During this process, I inquired about Citibank 's policy on third-party checks and was assured by a banker that such checks are accepted. As part of my responsibilities, I manage financial matters for my father-in-law, who is a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX. ). This arrangement necessitates regular deposits of his monthly checks into my account to cover his medical expenses, including medications and necessary equipment. 

Typically, I wait the standard clearance period of three to five business days for deposits. After confirming that a recent deposit had cleared, I proceeded to a nearby gas station, where I used my ATM debit card without issue. I called and listened to my available balance on my account which amounted close to {$10000.00} However, upon visiting the bank to transfer {$4000.00} to my savings account and withdraw {$2000.00} for my father-in-law 's needs, I encountered unexpected difficulties. After hearing my request of how much money i needed the teller gave me scowl type of look ; i felt she was judging me, made a phone call, and subsequently, another bank representative arrived, resulting in the blocking of my funds and my debit card. I was informed that I needed to provide further verification. 

This incident caused significant distress, as it prevented me from accessing necessary funds for my father-in-law 's medications. I am perplexed as to why my account was restricted following a normal transaction at the gas station. The only explanation I can discern is the potential perception stemming from my XXXX identity as a XXXX man withdrawing funds from my account. 

Having reviewed Citibanks policies, I understand that third-party checks are accepted, and I find the restrictions placed on my account both unwarranted and discriminatory. The bank informed me that they would issue a check for the remaining balance of {$9800.00} once the account was closed, a process which, I was told, could take 30 to 90 days. Meanwhile, my father-in-law has been left without the funds necessary to meet his medical needs. This extended delay, combined with the restricted access to our funds, has left us unable to address his essential expenses. I have not yet taken out any loans, hoping for an expedient resolution. 

As the delay continued, I grew increasingly concerned and placed a call to the branch where I opened the account. I inquired about the status of my remaining funds and the promised check from the fraud department. According to the sales representative, the computer system indicated that the check for {$9800.00} was scheduled to be sent on XX/XX/year>, to the last address on public file. But i had received a closeout letter saying my account was closed but he says theres an account balance of XXXX something dollars in it. How and why is it not being sent to me in a form of a check. its been over three months. However, I have not yet received this check, nor any further communication regarding the matter. 


Following this experience, I have decided to close my accounts with Citibank. I was disappointed to discover that my account was closed without the return of my funds or any further communication regarding this matter. 

I would appreciate your prompt attention to this issue and would like to request the immediate release of my remaining balance, as well as any additional clarification regarding the handling of my account. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, Subject : Formal Complaint, Opt-Out of Inaccurate Reporting, and Demand for Immediate Updates I am writing to file a formal complaint against the Credit Reporting Agencies ( CRAs ) regarding the inaccurate reporting of my credit information. As a federally protected consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I am exercising my rights concerning the privacy of my personal information and the accuracy of my credit report.

The FCRA mandates that CRAs must follow reasonable procedures to protect the confidentiality of credit information and promote accuracy, fairness, and the privacy of personal information. Notably, 15 U.S.C. 1681a states that it is illegal to report transaction history on a credit report, as the Act excludes reports that contain information solely about transactions or experiences between the consumer and the reporting entity. 
Given the inaccuracies in my credit report, I am opting out of any and all authorization for the reporting or sharing of any information related to the accounts inaccurately reported. This includes any written, unwritten, verbal, or nonverbal authorization I may have provided, in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 6802 and 16 CFR Part 313, which govern the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information. 
Due to the violations of my rights under the FCRA and the impact on my creditworthiness, I am demanding immediate updates to my credit report to correct these inaccuracies. I expect these updates to be made as soon as possible, in compliance with the FCRAs accuracy standards. Should these updates not be made, I will be seeking compensation for the violation of my rights as outlined under 15 U.S.C. 6801-6805, 16 CFR Part 313, and 15 U.S.C. 1692k. I am prepared to pursue legal remedies should my demands not be met.

To resolve this matter, I require the following : Immediate correction of the inaccurately reported account ( s ) on my credit report to comply with the FCRAs standards.

Compensation for the violation of my rights under the FCRA and related statutes due to the mishandling of my personal information.

Resolution Sought : I respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in the following : 1. Investigate this unauthorized hard inquiry made by Citibank N.AXXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 
2. Require Citibank N.A./THD to remove this inquiry from my credit report immediately. 
3. Ensure Citibank N.A./THD complies with federal laws and provides written confirmation of the removal and corrective actions taken.

Citibank N.A./THDs actions are in direct violation of my rights under the FCRA, and despite my attempts to address this issue directly, no resolution has been provided. 

I trust the CFPB will investigate thoroughly and take the necessary steps to protect my rights as a consumer. Thank you for your attention to this serious matter.

The question is simple and remains : Why does Barclays pay a merchant one amount and charge its client a higher amount? Please explain. 

Barclays claims to have resolved the claim in my favor, because it did the following without my authorization : As per the merchant, Barclays contacted the merchant, reversed or cancelled its original XX/XX/XXXX payment to the merchant in the amount of {$13000.00}, and then paid the merchant {$13000.00}. Meanwhile, I had paid Barclays {$13000.00}, as Barclays acknowledges in its XX/XX/XXXX letter. The credit Barclays claims to have provided basically allows for the charge on my account to be {$13000.00} ( what I paid ) instead of Barclays original charge on the account of {$13000.00}. However, since Barclays received {$13000.00} from me and subsequently reversed and paid the merchant about {$13000.00}, Barclays continues to overcharge me. It then suggests that I bring up the matter with the merchant, attempting to distance itself from the dispute. Yet, the unanswered question persists : Why does Barclays pay a merchant one amount and charge its client a higher amount?

Despite Barclays comments regarding foreign exchange, Barclays is still overcharging me {$280.00} and subsequently the merchant is now contacting me and demanding payment of such difference. I reiterate, Barclays is still overcharging me in the amount of {$280.00}, and NO, the dispute was not resolved in my favor. As also explained in my previous complaint, the merchant happens to be my health insurance provider. Thus, Barclays has put my health insurance coverage at risk. 

Since I have never been fortunate enough to contact XXXX XXXX nor any of her/his Barclays colleagues via the direct line nor receive return calls within the 48 hours stated on the Barclays recording , I am forced to file this CFPB complaint in further attempt to resolve the matter. 

If customer service is very important to Barclays, as it states in one of its letter, and if it honestly regret [ s ] the hardship it is imposing upon me, as it also expresses in one of its letter, then Barclays will have the respect to fully and honestly answer the questions posed above and return to me the amount of the overcharge. 


Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Email 2 Right after submitting the transfer request I requested to cancel it, because on the international transfer confirmation email the recipient bank was stated as Wells Fargo instead of XXXX. The foreign bank tells me the transfer is sent and can not be canceled. 

After this, I learned that given the size of XXXX, they do not process the transfer themselves but use Wells Fargo instead. Which explains the confusion when I was inputting the XXXX code. 

Email 3 On XX/XX/year> I requested an update to my foreign bank on the transfer because they money was not yet in my XXXX account. Foreign bank representative asked another representative to assist me with my request. 

Email 4 On XX/XX/year>, I requested another update to my foreign bank and was told that the foreign bank was going to open a case to investigate.

My foreign bank told me this case was closed.

Even though I inputted my XXXX account number and my name in the international transfer order, the money reached someone in Wells Fargo. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against La Curacao for their failure to respond to my dispute letter dated XX/XX/year>, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). In this letter, I specifically requested that La Curacao investigate disputed items on my credit report, provide a full audit trail, and remove any unverifiable or inaccurate information as required by law. 

Under the FCRA, particularly 15 U.S.C. Section 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), credit furnishers like La Curacao are required to investigate a dispute and report back to the consumer within 30 days. As of today, I have received no response from La Curacao, nor have they taken action to investigate, provide the requested audit trail, or update my credit report to reflect accurate information. 

Relevant FCRA Violations 1. Failure to Investigate : Under Section 1681s-2 ( b ), La Curacao , as a furnisher of information, is required to conduct an investigation into any disputed information once they receive notice from the consumer. This includes verifying the accuracy of the information or deleting any information that can not be substantiated. La Curacaos failure to investigate or respond to my dispute directly violates this FCRA requirement. 
2. Failure to Report Investigation Results : According to 15 U.S.C. Section 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ), a credit furnisher must provide the consumer with the results of the reinvestigation within the specified timeframe. La Curacaos lack of response constitutes non-compliance with this requirement. 
3. Lack of an Audit Trail : In my dispute, I requested an audit trail and supporting documentation used to verify the disputed items. Under FCRA requirements, furnishers are obligated to provide any documentation that substantiates the accuracy of the information in question. By failing to do so, La Curacao has prevented me from verifying the accuracy of the information they reported.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

HAVE ASKED SUNRISE CREDIT TO SHOW PROOF OF THE PURCHASE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THEM AND THE ORIGNAL CREDITOR THEY SENT STATEMENT TRANSACTIONS WHICH IS NOT A PURCHASE AGREEMENT ALSO ITS REPORTING AS A CHARGE OFF PER THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE A CHARGE OFF IS CONSIDERED INCOME AND INCOME CAN NOT BE REPORTED AND A CONSUMER REPORT IF IT IS A CHARGE OFF WHY HAVE I NOT received A 1099C cancellation OF DEBT LAST THING THE DATES OPEN ARE ALL different which is inaccurate information being reported I am writing to formally dispute the charge-off account reported by [ Creditor 's Name ] under my name, account number [ Account Number ]. This correspondence serves as a notice of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

I would like to bring to your attention that, under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), consumers have the right to dispute any information in their credit report that they believe is inaccurate or incomplete. I believe that the charge-off designation on my account is misleading and improperly represented for the following reasons : 1. IRS Conclusions on Charge-Offs : The Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) has concluded that a charge-off can be considered income to a debtor under certain circumstances. However, this should be reported accurately through a Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) if applicable. To date, I have not received a 1099-C concerning this debt, which calls into question the legitimacy of the charge-off being reported. As such, it should not be treated as a completed transaction as it lacks adequate documentation. 

2. Reporting of Late Payments : The Fair Credit Reporting Act requires that all information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and reflect the true payment history. If [ Creditor 's Name ] has reported late payments leading up to the charge-off, I demand verification of these claims. If accurate payment history exists, it should not have been misrepresented as an accumulation of late payments leading to a charge-off. 

3. FDCPA Compliance : Furthermore, I would like to assert my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ). If [ Creditor 's Name ] or any collection agency that reports on this account has failed to provide adequate validation of the debt when requested, this can be deemed a violation of my rights under the FDCPA as well. 

Given these points, I request a detailed investigation into this matter. I ask that you provide documentation of the charge-off, proof that a 1099-C has been issued to the IRS, and verification of any late payments or outstanding balances. If you can not provide such documentation, I request that you immediately correct the reporting of this account with the credit bureaus.

Per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), your failure to provide accurate and complete disclosure of all necessary information prior to furnishing details to consumer reporting agencies further substantiates the illegal practices you are engaged in.

P.s. My NEXT letter will be a notification of my LOITS! So that you do not need for a legal dictionary, a LOITS notice is a Letter Of Intent To Suit! You BEST be PROVEN COMPLIANT to ALL requirements and standards of FCRA COMPLIANCE and also of the implemented XXXX enacted CDIA implemented Metro 2 Compliance mandates as well. I will demand verification that each employee at your firm which MIGHT have seen or conducted any business on the file you allege mine has been properly trained by a certified and qualified instructor of the Metro 2 data field formatted reporting standards. I am NOT shy in detailing my DOUBTS you can withstand the requisites to survive a court hearing versus me as I leverage your DEFICIENCIES for a slew of victories being awarded a minimum of {$1000.00} PER VIOLATION PER TIME, and there certainly appears to be a bucket full. So, lets do this! Anything OTHER than your letter describing to me that you have already begun or completed the annulment of these unproven claims versus me and have eradicated ENTIRELY any and all aspects of records of what you allege being mine ( yeah! ) will IMMEDIATE compel me to assume your hostile to my demands of proper reporting and I will assume that your ignorance of appropriate and adequate duties are willful and intentionally injurious. Being such, civil suits are obvious however criminal charges are not out the question, particularly if your chicanery-led subterfuge brings forth or allows.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you in a state where you do not live or did not sign for the debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, regarding their alleged unfair and unlawful collection practices, as well as potential violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. This complaint specifically addresses XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  ( the collector ) attempts to collect on a debt purportedly owed to Citibank N.A., and Citibanks alleged issuance of a 1099-C form to the IRS without notifying me. 

1. Failure to Provide 1099-C Notification : Citibank N.A . appears to have filed a 1099-C form with the IRS in relation to this debt. Under IRS rules, creditors who issue a 1099-C form must provide the debtor with a copy. However, I never received such notice, leaving me unaware of any potential cancellation of debt income reported to the IRS. This oversight may affect the legal status of the alleged debt and my credit report, which under the FCRA must accurately reflect all pertinent information related to a debt. 
2. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXs  actions may be in violation of the FCRA, specifically : Inaccurate Reporting of Debt : The FCRA mandates that credit information must be accurate and complete ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Due to Citibanks apparent filing of a 1099-C, XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX may be reporting a debt that has been discharged or forgiven, leading to a potentially inaccurate credit report entry. 
Failure to Provide Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I am entitled to a validation of the debt. However, despite my request, XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX has failed to provide me with a debt validation letter, creating further uncertainty about the legitimacy of this debt. 
3. Improper Venue and Lack of Jurisdiction to Sue in New York : XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX has filed a lawsuit against me in the state of New York, despite the fact that I am a resident of Ohio. This filing is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692i, which requires debt collectors to bring legal action either in the district where the consumer resides or where the contract was signed. Since I do not reside in New York and did not sign the contract in New York, this lawsuit constitutes an improper venue and is thus unlawful. 
4. Lack of Authorization to Collect in New York : XXXX XXXX XXXX , XXXX has yet to provide evidence of their authorization to collect this debt in New York, where they have initiated litigation. Under the FDCPA, debt collectors are required to prove their authority to collect, especially when jurisdiction is in question. I request that they produce documentation establishing their right to pursue this debt collection in New York, in compliance with applicable state laws.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Syncb/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dear SynchronyXXXX XXXX  XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of the charge-off account associated with XXXX on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information ), I am entitled to request and receive complete and accurate documentation to verify the accuracy and legality of this accounts reporting. Additionally, under Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act ( Md. Code Ann., Com. Law 14-201 ) law, I am requesting proper validation of this debt. I would like to highlight several cases that affirm my right to dispute this information and request accurate reporting. In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ), the court emphasized the duty of credit reporting agencies and furnishers to ensure the accuracy of the information reported on consumers ' credit reports. Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) reinforces the requirement that furnishers conduct proper investigations into disputes and verify the accuracy of their reporting. 

To properly validate this account, I am requesting the following : 1. Authenticated Double-Entry Accounting Records I am requesting full double-entry accounting records for the account mentioned. This should include a detailed breakdown that shows how all transactions were debited and credited, ensuring compliance with standard accounting principles. Please note that I do not wish to receive a simple list of charges or statements. I expect authenticated evidence of the debt. The court ruling in XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) held that mere conclusory statements from debt XXXX or creditors do not satisfy the validation requirement. Only authenticated and verified documentation proving the validity of the debt is acceptable. 

2. Authenticated Evidence Based on Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act ( Md. Code Ann., Com. Law 14-201 ) Law. In addition to the accounting records, I require authenticated evidence, in compliance with Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act ( Md. Code Ann., Com. Law 14-201 ) law, that you have the legal right to report and collect this debt. This includes original signed contracts or agreements that show my obligation to pay the debt and your legal right to enforce collection and report it to credit bureaus. Without this evidence, the continued reporting of this debt may constitute a violation of both federal and state consumer protection laws. In XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court held that creditors must produce original signed documentation to prove the validity of a debt. Failing to provide this evidence may result in a violation of both state and federal consumer protection laws. 

3. 1099-C Form If this debt has been forgiven, canceled, or settled for less than the full balance, I am requesting a copy of the 1099-C form filed with the IRS, which is required if the amount of canceled debt exceeds {$600.00}. If you have not provided this documentation, the debt may be considered discharged, and it should no longer be reported as owed on my credit report. The IRS has clearly outlined the requirements for filing a 1099-C form under 26 U.S.C. 6050P, which applies when a debt of {$600.00} or more is discharged or forgiven. If you have failed to file this form, the continued reporting of this debt may be fraudulent. In the absence of the requested documentation and verifiable evidence, I request that you immediately delete this account from my credit report in compliance with the FCRA and Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act ( Md. Code Ann., Com. Law 14-201 ) law. Failure to do so will result in further action, including filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), pursuing legal remedies to enforce my rights, and submitting a Suspicious Activity Report ( SAR ) to the IRS for suspicion of fraud. The SAR ( FinCEN Form 111 ) will be filed if you continue reporting inaccurate and unverified information without providing the required documentation. Please respond within 30 days of receipt of this letter. I look forward to receiving the required documentation or confirmation that the account has been deleted.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Threatened to contact someone or share information improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of 2024, I received a letter of Intent to Initiate Administrative Wage Garnishments Proceedings from Pioneer Credit Recovery. I responded to the letter by checking the box that stated that I was ineligible for wage garnishments because I was involuntarily laid off from my previous employer, and I was currently unemployed. I submitted a letter from my previous employer, and a hand-written letter from me stating that I was currently unemployed. I started a new job the last week of XX/XX/year> after submitting my response to pioneer. I received an identical letter of intent to initiate garnishments again in XXXX of 2024. I did not reply to this one since I had already replied to the one back in XXXX. In XXXX of 2024, my new employer received a wage garnishment order. He showed it to me. It was made to look like a court ordered garnishment, but did not look real. It did not have a judge 's signature nor an official seal. He asked me about it, and I told him that I had responded to the letter of intent back in XXXX. He has not been garnishing my wages. Back in XXXX of 2024 he tells me that Pioneer has been harassing him every single month via phone calls and letters demanding payments. Since, then I've been seeking legal advice on how to proceed forward. After several weeks, I finally received advice and I contacted Pioneer on XXXX XXXX, 2024. When I spoke to the initial receptionist, and I explained the problem, she told me that they did receive the letter from my previous employer, but that they did not received my response to the letter of intent. All the correspondence ( letters from me, previous employer and response to letter of intent ) were mailed in the same company provided envelope. She then transferred my call to the wage garnishment division where I spoke to another lady. I again explained my situation to her stating that I had responded to letter of intent back in XXXX of 2024. She claimed that Pioneer never sent me a letter of intent in XXXX of 2024. She claimed that the first letter they sent me was in XXXX of 2024, and that they had no correspondence from me. She offered to resend me the XXXX letter of intent again so that I can resubmit my response to which I agreed. I asked her to stop contacting my employer in the mean time and she said that she couldn't. She said the process was automated and that my employer was not complying with an official order.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Subject : Request for Reinvestigation and Removal of Charge-Off Account # XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the accuracy of a charge-off listed on my credit report under the account # XXXX XXXX. I have received a 1099-C form for this account, indicating that the debt was canceled. According to the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ) 6050P, a 1099-C form is issued when a creditor cancels a debt of {$600.00} or more. This means the debt has been legally forgiven and should no longer be reported as a charge-off. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ), I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe is inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. As the debt has been canceled and a 1099-C form has been issued, the reporting of this charge-off is both inaccurate and misleading. I request that you conduct a reinvestigation of this matter under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and remove the charge-off from my credit report. If the information can not be verified, it must be deleted from my credit file according to FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). Please provide me with written confirmation that this item has been corrected and removed. If you are unable to verify the accuracy of this information, it must be deleted from my credit report as required by law. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

After a week I was notified that they are not able to XXXX XXXX by and need to charge me {$750.00}. Which I, hesitated to say yes, but due to the process and credit check fee etc, I said yes.

I asked why this was not communicated to me and I was told I only have two option to approve or reject it. I rejected it and requested the {$750.00} appraisal that I paid as I feel like they did not do their due diligence in checking eligibility and now I further accrued more debt, not to mention because of the hard credit check my score went down and I'm getting phone calls every 5 minutes from all over the world. 
The issue was XXXX holding a lien on my mortgage and for them to approved my loan they need to clear that lien first. If they would have been honest and told me this from the beginning, I could have avoided all of these.

The contract that was sent to me had different numbers and I asked why that is and was told that they can edit it on their end but need my signature before they can proceed. Very sketchy process but I trusted them and now paying for it.

XXXX had stated that Barclays would contact the credit rating companies to correct the report. 
This case resulted in my excellent credit rating downgrade due to negative hit from past due bill since the credit card company did not suspend the charge while investigation was ongoing. Because I have received no info other than my case was concluded and written off by XXXX, I am concluding that my case was never investigated before being sent to collection. Because if it was investigated they would find that the charges were not made by me. Id like to note that my research shows that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX and ordered them to pay {$24.00} million dollars for violations of the law in collecting on unsubstantiated debt. I am appalled that there was no follow up or investigation done.

I am filing a complaint regarding an unauthorized collection entry placed on my credit report by Procollect ( Adress- XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Texas XXXX Phone- XXXX XXXX XXXX ) The agency first contacted me by phone call regarding this debt on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, before ever contacting me, they reported the debt to the credit bureaus, which is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). These acts mandate that consumers have adequate notice and the opportunity to verify or dispute a debt before it appears on their credit report. 

Furthermore, I have proof that this debt was paid in full on XX/XX/XXXX. Despite this, Procollect inaccurately reported it, causing an immediate and severe impact on my credit score. This has led to significant distress and unfairly harmed my financial standing.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with rewards from credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Executive Summary : Citibank closed my credit card account without my knowledge and with no reason, resulting in forfeiture of {$1100.00} cash value worth of rewards points that I had built up over a period more than 10 years. I believe that this is a UDAAP violation, with unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices. The subject credit card has an expiration date of XX/XX/XXXX, I never missed a payment, and I have excellent credit, with credit scores consistently over XXXX. Therefore, there was no legitimate reason to close the account. I tried to reason with the Citibank Customer Service Representatives ( CSR ) and Supervisors for several hours on the phone for a reasonable resolution but to no avail. I believe that this is a common tactic of corporate stonewalling by deterring the consumer to come to a resolution due to many layers of deterrence. This situation is basically a large corporation ( Citibank ) stealing from the consumer ( me, and potentially others with the same situation ). In summary, closing my account and forfeiting my points is effectively theft by Citibank. 


Potential UDAAP violations : While this issue does not pertain to the collection of a consumer debt, the following describes how this situation meets all three of the Applicable Standards for UDAAPs. 

XXXX. Unfair Acts or Practices The Dodd-Frank Act prohibits conduct that constitutes an unfair act or practice. An act or practice is unfair when : ( XXXX ) It causes or is likely to cause substantial injury to consumers ; ( XXXX ) The injury is not reasonably avoidable by consumers ; and ( XXXX ) The injury is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or to competition. 

The injury is monetary, in the amount of {$1100.00}. I couldnt avoid the injury, as they closed my account and took my points/cash value. 

XXXX. Deceptive Acts or Practices The Dodd-Frank Act also prohibits conduct that constitutes a deceptive act or practice. An act or practice is deceptive when : ( XXXX ) The act or practice misleads or is likely to mislead the consumer ; ( XXXX ) The consumers interpretation is reasonable under the circumstances; and ( XXXX ) The misleading act or practice is material. 

The deceptive act or practice is the stealing ( forfeiture ) of my points for no reason, when I had an open credit card with no delinquencies and good credit. 


XXXX. Abusive Acts or Practices The Dodd-Frank Act also prohibits conduct that constitutes an abusive act or practice. An act or practice is abusive when it : ( XXXX ) Materially interferes with the ability of a consumer to understand a term or condition of a consumer financial product or service; or ( XXXX ) Takes unreasonable advantage of ( A ) a consumers lack of understanding of the material risks, costs, or conditions of the product or service; ( B ) a consumers inability to protect his or her interests in selecting or using a consumer financial product or service; or ( C ) a consumers reasonable reliance on a covered person to act in his or her interests. 

The abusive act or practice is theft of my points that have a cash value of {$1100.00}. 

Additional Details : Prior to filing this complaint, I tried very hard to come to what I thought was a very reasonable resolution to the issue. I simply wanted Citibank to either reinstate my credit card with my points or issue me the cash value of those points at {$1100.00}. As previously stated, I accumulated the points over a period more than 10 years. In XX/XX/XXXX, I called a Citibank CSR and inquired about my points. During that conversation, the CSR informed me that the points never expire. In addition, I was never informed that my account would be closing. In XX/XX/XXXX, I tried to access my account to use some of my points, however, I could not access my points. I then spent over 4 hours talking to several Citibank CSRs and Supervisors over 3 days, from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. The last person I spoke to was Senior Account Supervisor with Citi Cards in Arizona, with the name of XXXX. In summary, all the CSRs and Supervisors told me that the account had been closed, the points had been forfeited, and there was nothing that they could do. I repeatedly tried to escalate to higher supervisors, but at some point, they refused to escalate it anymore. Here is where I refer to the strategy of corporate stonewalling the strategy of making consumers feel they have no options because the supervisors just basically disregard their reasonable requests. In addition, I strongly believe that this is corporate theft, as CitiBank had no legitimate reason to close my credit card that had an expiration date of XX/XX/XXXX. Again, I have strong credit and never had any delinquencies. 

I bring this to the attention of the CFPB not only to recoup the {$1100.00} that I am entitled to, but to highlight this very unfair practice that could be impacting other consumers. These unfair practices should result in civil money penalties and restitution. 

I am only seeking from Citibank a fair resolution to this issue, which would be one of two options : XXXX ) Reopen the credit card, with my point reestablished, or XXXX ) Issue me a check for the cash value of my points, which is {$1100.00}. 

Details of the subject credit card : Citi Rewards Credit Card XXXX # XXXX Valid Thru date : XX/XX/XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Roundpoint Mortgage Servicing LL XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX Loan Number : XXXX : Escrow Disbursement Dispute Good afternoon, My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, owner of property address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Florida XXXX. I currently hold a mortgage loan with RoundPoint Mortgage Serving LLC. 

Statement : On XX/XX/XXXX a letter was drafted and mailed to me by RoundPoint stating my home require flood insurance due to a flood map revision " REMAPPING '' issued by the Federal Emergency Management Agency ( FEMA ). The letter stated " If proper evidence of acceptable flood insurance is not received within 45 days of the date of this notice, we will purchase coverage at your expense effective XX/XX/XXXX. '' Upon receiving the notice I contacted my insurance agent, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and we secured flood insurance for my home. The policy was submitted to RoundPoint ( see attached and paid by RoundPoint using my RoundPoint escrow account. ) The effective date of the policy is XX/XX/XXXX, which is within the 45 days of the notice. 

On XX/XX/XXXX a letter was drafted and mailed to me by RoundPoint stating " we have not received the insurance information we previously requested for the property location shown above. At your expense, we have purchased the flood insurance described below to protect our interest in the property, as required by the Flood Disaster protection Act of 1973, as amended, ( FDPA ). '' ( attached ) XX/XX/XXXX, I received the letter dated XX/XX/XXXX which stated flood insurance was purchased on my behalf for the period of XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$210.00}. This is clearly an error on RoundPoints behalf as I had already secured flood insurance and it was paid by RoundPoint. I called my insurance agency who called RoundPoint and was told it was an error and it will be corrected in 15 days. I also called on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke with XXXX and voiced my dispute as well. I was told that RoundPoint will followup and address the matter. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, today I received the below email stating an escrow disbursement was made from my escrow account in the amount of {$210.00}. ( attached ) On XX/XX/XXXX, I called roundpoint and advised them about the situation above and expressed I am disputing this matter. I spoke with XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I was told to send an email with my dispute. On XX/XX/XXXX, I prepared my dispute and emailed roundpoint. Roundpoint replied acknowledging receipt of my dispute. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my insurance agency, XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX called and spoke with your customer service for 52 minutes. XXXX called XXXX. XXXX requested this matter be escalated and resolved. XXXX advised she was unable to resolve this matter and has exhausted all resources on her end. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed roundpoint and notified them I will be filing a complaint. 

I did not give Roundpoint permission to obtain flood insurance on my behalf. I complied with the notice to obtain flood insurance within 45 days as stated. I did not give roundpoint permission to use my escrow funds to purchase this insurance. 

Roundpoint has been engaged in unfair and abusive practices against me. I respectfully request this matter be investigated and that roundpoint replace the escrow funds they took without my permission ( {$210.00} ) It is not unreasonable for me to believe this has happened to other customers and I beg your agency to look into this matter further. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : REQUEST LETTER TO REMOVE INACCURATE INFORMATION To Whom It May Concern, Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. After, a careful review of my report I noticed my report had errors and also suspected fraud. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to:1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of XXXX ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means XXXX make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) ; XXXX ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq.

Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report.

For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my consumer report. See. Exhibit A.

In completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items I am disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary. I know that your company will need some sort of verification to prove my identity. 
I have attached my SSN, utility bill, and drivers licesense Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX EXHIBIT A I hereby dispute these derogatory accounts and request the following items be thoroughly investigated and deleted from my consumer report, please see below : Name of Account, Name of Source, Type of Item Account Number or Identifier Creditor Name, Debt Collector Name, or Dispute Matter Account #, Reference #, etc...

The account was in collections before I paid the card off and citi chose to end their relationship with me which I am completely in agreement with. I considered this matter resolved since the full balance owed was paid. I found out by having my credit report pulled that there was back dated interest in the amount of {$42.00} due which I was happy to pay. Citi did not inform me of the interest due instead they charged me several months of late fees and interest on the late fees. When I called to resolve this matter and inform them of their error I was informed that they would not be waiving the late fees because I had already had fee waivers. I explained to them that this was not me asking them to waive a fee but me informing them that they have a process error. There is no communication that comes from them once the account is removed off online banking and that I was not informed of the interest owed but im happy to pay it minus the late charges.
