Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> a loan modification with Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing was applied to my account. I made my expected payment of {$1200.00} on XX/XX/year>. Today, XX/XX/year>, I tried to make my payment for XXXX and see that I'm expected to pay {$2700.00} due to my escrow payment now being {$1900.00}. This is a sharp increase from my expected escrow payment of {$490.00}. I called and spoke to a representative who told me this is due to them doing an escrow analysis in XXXX, the same month they were working on my modification. When I brought this to her attention she says that it's an automatic analysis and my modification wasn't taken into account. She then told me they received a huge payment for my escrow, this is because a modification settles your escrow deficit and puts it into a new principal balance. This isn't even the information she knew to tell me but what I know from dealing with the modification myself. She then tells me they sent a check for {$2200.00} saying I had a surplus in my account. However, they're still expecting me to pay {$2700.00} for both XXXX and XXXX each due to an incorrect escrow analysis. When I brought this to her attention she says the extra amount is to bring me out of a deficit. How do I have a deficit when you're sending me a check for a surplus? Overall, my escrow account should be regular. It shouldn't be a surplus or a deficit. Because of them mistakenly sending this check, my escrow account now has a deficit. Please see the attached photo to see how this mistake has messed up my account. Since my loan was transferred to them in XXXX, there have been ongoing issues. From lack of communication leading to me having prolonged missing payments and ruining my credit to applying the master condo insurance to my account instead of my private home insurance. This has been nothing short of a headache and I have had to constantly reach out to XXXX XXXX to deal with them. I am under the impression that they are either trying to force people to foreclose or are extremely incompetent. Either way, I need my account fixed asap.

I am still unable to access my account, I was told this would be escalated and " not to worry ''. I am trying to make a payment but I am unable to even access my account nor see any activity on this account. Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I was trying to hook up my new XXXX printer and was unsuccessful. I scanned a QR code provided by XXXX and called a number for XXXX Support. A man by the name of XXXX XXXX came on and took control of my laptop, showing me I had viruses. They charged me {$190.00} to clean up the viruses and told me I needed to their software to protect my laptop, other devices and their software would stop all viruses at the point of entry at the modem. I felt pressured to make this purchase but made a lifetime purchase. They temporarily got my printer working but it never stayed working. About a month later they called me and said I needed to upgrade my purchase because my modem was getting hacked by foreigners. They wanted over {$3000.00} more, when the original purchase was supposed to cover the modem. This is when I knew they were scamming me. Their company name is XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX is the only address I can find when searching for this company. 

I reported this to my credit card company, Elan Financial Services through XXXX Bank. Initially they reimbursed the charge of {$1200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. After their investigation, they reversed that reimbursement saying that I willingly put in my credit card number for the purchase and received the services represented by the transaction. This is not true. I did not receive the services XXXX told me I had purchased. There would not have been a need to purchase further protection, if they had in fact provided the services they promised. 

I have twice requested the investigation information from Elan Financial Services that was used in their investigation and both times they said they would send it. I still have not received the information.

This time, I contacted service provider, and it was discovered that there was indeed fraudulent charges being made, and stated they would stop it. Why was card company, after reaching a dispute resolution in my favor, still charging my card? My thinking it was easier to just resolve dispute, as opposed to actually researching and finding guilty party. Meanwhile I keep getting recurring charges that I keep disputing. I did inform agent that I would cancel card if it happened one more time. I am curious to see what will happen in XXXX. This is after service company stated they will stop charges, as seen as a fraud purchase. This company is the streaming company XXXX. I do not have any contracts through XXXX. They can verify this. But CitiBank keeps reposting my account after cancelling account and settling dispute in my favor. Please advise. Thank you.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: US Bank offers an incentive for opening a new checking account and it is dependent on the total direct deposited amount within 90 days. US Bank denied my first direct deposit and my company issued me a physical check. When I took the check to the local branch I was told they would need to look into it but they did not explain why they wouldn't accept my first paycheck through direct deposit. They did follow up with me to suggest alternatives like trying to calculate my future deposits to see if I qualify but no effort was made to address the initial denial. I asked to speak to a manager and was told the manager was on vacation for another week. I then called the XXXX customer service number and again it was not explained why US bank denied my first direct deposit. The called was disrupted after I asked the question about explaining why the denial even happened. There is something fraudulent occurring if a bank offers incentives for the amount of direct deposits and then denies the customer from making a direct deposit. Below is my email communication with the branch official XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year>, XXXX Hello XXXX, You inquired about your first deposit that will be deposited into your checking account if the deposit could be coded as direct deposit even though the deposit will be in check form. Unfortunately, this deposit will be in the manner of a check deposit and not direct deposit from your employer. Which is a stipulation to have direct deposit into the checking account to earn the potential bonus. What I was going to suggest is that we look at the first direct deposit amount total and add those from that time frame of the first 90 days to determine your earning potential. If there is anything else that you would like me to address, please let me know. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX I still don't know why my initial direct deposit was " denied ''. Can you please have a manager call me at XXXX so we can solve this issue? If the bank offers incentives and then finds ways to limit their exposure to incentives they are liable for then that is fraudulent. I'd like to know specifically why my check was not direct deposited when no other bank has had issue before. I would to deposit my paycheck and correct it to be a direct deposit since this is no fault of mine and since US Bank is creating this conundrum. XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I can request that the branch manager contact you when she returns from her vacation on Tuesday the XXXX. And I will ask that she call you when she returns to the office. Let me know if there is anything else you would like me to address. XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Indicated you were committing crime by not paying debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

6. Chain of Custody 7. Assignment of Contract Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
I have not received a validation response to my request for verification on the debt. You have not sent me designation or proof of ownership of the debt or identification of the original creditor and subsequent assignees of the debt. As you know under 15 USC 1692g ( a ) the CFPB recently increased the requirements of a debt collectors validation response to the following : Name and mailing information of the debt collector ; and Name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; and Account number ( if any ) associated with the debt ; and An itemization of the current amount of the debt that reflects interest, fees, payments, and credits since a particular date that you may be able to recognize or verify with records ; and, the current amount of the debt as of when the validation notice is provided. 
None of the above were provided to me. 
PURSUANT TO THE FDCPA, I WOULD LIKE THE FOLLOWING PROVIDED : 1. THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF THE ORIGINAL AND CURRENT CREDITOR 2. VERIFICATION OF THE DEBT AMOUNT THAT YOU ARE SEEKING TO COLLECT 3. ASSIGNMENT FROM THE ORIGINAL CREDITOR WITH MY NAME AND ORIGINAL ACCOUNT NUMBER ON THE ORIGINAL DEBT 4. ALL INFORMATION ON THE SECURITIZATION OF THE DEBT AND PROOF THE DEBT WAS ASSIGNED BACK TO UNDER FEDERAL LAW : Pursuant to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX & XXXX, XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> ), and 15 USC 1692g ( b ), you are required to cease and desist from collecting upon the debt ( including contacting a debtors credit ) until you properly validate and verify the debt amount. 
Please do not look at my credit or report anything to my credit reports as I dispute I owe this debt to you and that dispute should be stated on my credit report. Do not contact my credit report.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint provided an opportunity to answer consumer's questions

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX XXXX Kikoff, Inc. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX : XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Formal Dispute Response to CFPB Complaint To Whom It May Concern, Regarding my CFPB complaint about late payment notations on my credit report. After reviewing your response, I have identified several issues and potential violations of consumer protection laws. I would like to formally dispute the inaccuracies in your reporting and raise concerns regarding your handling of this matter.

Issues with Kikoffs Response 1. Inadequate Proof of Late Payments ( FCRA Violation ) o Your response includes a summary document of dates and amounts but fails to provide verifiable proof of the alleged late payments. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), creditors must ensure that all information they report to credit bureaus is accurate and verifiable. A simple document outlining dates and amounts is insufficient evidence without accompanying transactional records or logs that clearly establish my payment history. 
2. Failure to Notify Adequately o You mention that notifications were sent to " all customers regarding account status, '' but no evidence has been provided to show that I was specifically and adequately notified about my payment status or potential late remarks prior to their being reported. Lack of sufficient and timely notification may violate fair practice standards and could demonstrate negligence in maintaining open communication with consumers.

3. Misrepresentation of Consumer Rights o Your statement that Kikoff " can not remove genuine late or missed payments '' misrepresents consumer rights under the FCRA. If late payments are reported inaccurately or without sufficient evidence, they must be removed regardless of whether Kikoff believes them to be " genuine. '' This misrepresentation undermines my ability to exercise my rights to dispute errors.

4. Failure to Conduct a Thorough Investigation ( FCRA Requirement ) o The FCRA requires data furnishers to perform a reasonable investigation when a dispute is received, especially one filed through the CFPB. Your response does not indicate that a detailed review of the alleged late payments was conducted. Simply reiterating that the payments were " outside the grace period '' without concrete proof of my payment activity does not meet the standard for a proper investigation.

5. Unclear Terms and Conditions Enforcement o You reference the terms and conditions accepted on XX/XX/year>, but fail to provide specific clauses that justify the reporting of late payments or the process for notifying consumers. Transparency in these agreements is essential to ensure compliance with applicable laws. 
6. Account Closure and Reporting Practices o While you mention that my account is currently closed, you do not clarify whether the closure process was conducted in compliance with regulatory standards or how this impacts the accuracy of your reporting. Reporting closed accounts with disputed late payments may further harm consumers if done inaccurately or without proper justification.

Relevant Case Studies To support my concerns, I reference the following legal precedents that demonstrate the importance of compliance with consumer protection laws : 1. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : This case established that creditors must provide complete and accurate documentation when reporting to credit bureaus. Failure to do so undermines the consumer 's rights and violates federal law. 
Request for Action To resolve this matter, I request that Kikoff : 1. Provide complete and verifiable evidence of the alleged late payments, including transactional records, timestamped payment logs, and proof of notifications sent to me regarding account status and payment issues.

2. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed late payments as required under the FCRA and provide a detailed explanation of your findings.

3. Remove any inaccurate or unverifiable late payment notations from my credit report.

4. Clarify the terms and conditions referenced in your response and how they justify your reporting practices in this case.

5. Provide documentation regarding the closure of my account, including details of any adverse action taken and notifications provided to me.

Potential Consumer Protection Violations If these issues are not addressed promptly and appropriately, I reserve the right to escalate this matter further. I am prepared to take this dispute to arbitration, which will significantly increase costs for your company. Arbitration costs, including fees for arbitrators and legal representation, could outweigh the resources required to resolve this dispute amicably. I may also file additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and consider legal remedies to enforce my rights under the FCRA and other applicable laws.

Response Deadline Please respond to this letter with all requested documentation and evidence within 30 days of receipt. Failure to comply may result in further action to protect my rights and resolve this matter.

Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your prompt and satisfactory response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you in a state where you do not live or did not sign for the debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am filing a formal complaint against Rubin & Rothman , LLC, regarding their alleged unfair and unlawful collection practices, as well as potential violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. This complaint specifically addresses Rubin & Rothman, LLCs ( the collector ) attempts to collect on a debt purportedly owed to XXXX XXXX, and XXXX alleged issuance of a 1099-C form to the IRS without notifying me. 

1. Failure to Provide 1099-C Notification : XXXX XXXX . appears to have filed a 1099-C form with the IRS in relation to this debt. Under IRS rules, creditors who issue a 1099-C form must provide the debtor with a copy. However, I never received such notice, leaving me unaware of any potential cancellation of debt income reported to the IRS. This oversight may affect the legal status of the alleged debt and my credit report, which under the FCRA must accurately reflect all pertinent information related to a debt. 
2. Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Rubin & Rothman, LLCs actions may be in violation of the FCRA, specifically : Inaccurate Reporting of Debt : The FCRA mandates that credit information must be accurate and complete ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Due to XXXX apparent filing of a 1099-C, Rubin & Rothman , LLC may be reporting a debt that has been discharged or forgiven, leading to a potentially inaccurate credit report entry. 
Failure to Provide Debt Validation : Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I am entitled to a validation of the debt. However, despite my request, Rubin & Rothman , LLC has failed to provide me with a debt validation letter, creating further uncertainty about the legitimacy of this debt. 
3. Improper Venue and Lack of Jurisdiction to Sue in New York : Rubin & Rothman , LLC has filed a lawsuit against me in the state of New York, despite the fact that I am a resident of Ohio. This filing is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692i, which requires debt collectors to bring legal action either in the district where the consumer resides or where the contract was signed. Since I do not reside in New York and did not sign the contract in New York, this lawsuit constitutes an improper venue and is thus unlawful. 
4. Lack of Authorization to Collect in New York : Rubin & Rothman , LLC has yet to provide evidence of their authorization to collect this debt in New York, where they have initiated litigation. Under the FDCPA, debt collectors are required to prove their authority to collect, especially when jurisdiction is in question. I request that they produce documentation establishing their right to pursue this debt collection in New York, in compliance with applicable state laws.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I Am demanding that these accounts be removed immediately upon reading this complaint. I have also attached my identity theft report as well. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act has violated my rights. 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions. I have no knowledge of these companies and they shouldnt be reporting as I never gave permission for the reporting per Section 1681a -I sent correspondence to the Credit Bureaus regarding this. I was never notified in writing per 15 U.S.C 1692ag prior to accounts being on my credit report, within 5 days. Moreover, these accounts violate debt collections, and abusive and unfair practices per section 1692f ( 1 ) adding additional amounts. 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. ) Privacy Act considerations. A delinquent debt may not be reported under this section unless a notice issued pursuant to the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. 552a ( e ) ( 4 ), authorizes the disclosure of information about the debtor to a credit bureau. The Privacy Act of 1974 is a federal law that governs our collection and use of records we maintain on you in a system of records. A system of records is any grouping of information about an individual under the control of a Federal agency from which information is retrievable by personal identifiers, such as name, social security number, or other identifying number or symbol. Under the Privacy Act, Federal agencies may not disclose information without consent unless certain exceptions apply to the disclosure. The Privacy Act provides protections to individuals in three primary ways. It provides individuals with : the right to request their records, subject to Privacy Act exemptions ; the right to request a change to their records that are not accurate, relevant, timely or complete ; and the right to be protected against unwarranted invasion of their privacy resulting from the collection, maintenance, use, and disclosure of their personal information. ( b ) CONDITIONS OF DISCLOSURE.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communica- tion to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record 15 U.S . Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, I was in XXXX with my wife and we took a cab, about a XXXX XXXX trip. The cab driver asked me for a card, said " no cash '', and then tried to run my credit card but said it " did not go through '' - he then accepted cash. 

Later, when we returned home, we checked our credit card statement and had a charge for almost {$900.00} from a vendor we did not recognize. We determined based on our review it has to have been the cab company. 

Citi explained that because I did not have " proof '' of the transaction, a credit card slip, they could not help me. I explained that there would not be a credit card slip because the cab driver said the charge did not go through, but then later charged me almost {$900.00}. 

I did not authorize the transaction on my statement for {$890.00}. I do not have a sales slip, because I paid cash, but the cab driver scanned my card and told me that it didnt go through suggesting he did not have an internet connection, or that it was malfunctioning. 

I did not authorize any transaction from XXXX * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I am not able to contact this vendor. I can not contact the vendor as Citi has suggested I have no information on this vendor. If you XXXX XXXX * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX you do not get any results. This was a cab driver in downtown XXXX, XXXX, and I have no reason to document the cab # and no realistic way to contact this vendor. Presumably Citi bank would have some information on this vendor since it works with them on payment processing. This is why I can not speak with the vendor to resolve the issue. 

I attempted to resolve this by filling out the dispute paperwork and spending 2 hours on the phone with Citi. Ultimately, they said they could resolve this by awarding me a {$240.00} credit. I reluctantly said " fine '' but want to file my complaint anyway. This policy is ridiculous, implies that I am lying to them, and offers cardholders no support. Citi should put the burden on the VENDOR to prove I signed something which the vendor can not do.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint for Removal of Inaccurate Account Information and Compensation Request Re : Unauthorized Data Reporting and Violation of Consumer Rights under the FCRA Dear To whom it may concern I am writing to formally dispute and demand the immediate removal of inaccurate information from my credit report in accordance with my rights as a federally protected consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Additionally, I am officially opting out of any and all authorizations I may have previously grantedwhether written, unwritten, verbal, or non-verbalregarding the reporting of information that does not comply with federal law. 
Legal Basis for Removal Pursuant to 16 CFR Part 313 ( Privacy of Consumer Financial Information ) and 16 CFR Part 433 ( Preservation of Consumers ' Claims and Defenses ), I am asserting the following : 16 CFR Part 313 mandates the protection of consumer financial information and restricts the unauthorized sharing of personal data.

16 CFR Part 433 ensures that consumers ' claims and defenses are preserved, prohibiting the inclusion of unfair or deceptive acts or practices by data furnishers in credit reporting. Specifically, 16 CFR 433.2 ( a ) requires any holder of a consumer credit contract to be subject to all claims and defenses the debtor could assert against the original seller.

Unauthorized Reporting of Charge-Off Accounts Under FCRA regulations, a charge-off should not appear on my credit report as it represents a certificate of indebtedness or an accounting adjustment, which in legal terms can be categorized as income and therefore should not be reported to credit bureaus. The report of this charge-off represents an inaccurate portrayal of my financial standing and an unauthorized disclosure of my private information. 
Request for Deletion and Compensation I hereby demand the following : Immediate Deletion of any charge-offs or similarly misclassified accounts that violate 16 CFR Parts 313 and 433, FCRA, and the Truth in Lending Act.

Compensation for the violation of my rights as a consumer due to the unauthorized reporting of inaccurate information. The impact of this erroneous reporting has affected my creditworthiness and caused me undue stress and inconvenience.

Confirmation in writing that all inaccurate and unauthorized information has been removed from my credit file and details regarding the compensation process. 
Notice of Preservation of Consumer Claims and Defenses As per 16 CFR 433.2, please note the following provision applies : NOTICEANY HOLDER OF THIS CONSUMER CREDIT CONTRACT IS SUBJECT TO ALL CLAIMS AND DEFENSES WHICH THE DEBTOR COULD ASSERT AGAINST THE SELLER OF GOODS OR SERVICES OBTAINED PURSUANT HERETO OR WITH THE PROCEEDS HEREOF. RECOVERY HEREUNDER BY THE DEBTOR SHALL NOT EXCEED AMOUNTS PAID BY THE DEBTOR HEREUNDER. 
Failure to respond to this request may lead to further action to enforce my rights as a consumer, including but not limited to legal avenues.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I expect confirmation of these changes and a response regarding compensation within XXXX  days, as per the FCRA 's required response timeline. 

Company name : XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Amsher Collections reported a collections account of {$2200.00} from XXXX XXXX XXXX to all three credit bureaus. This information is incorrect, and despite disputing it multiple times, it remains on my credit report. 

In XXXX, when the collections account was first reported, I called to request a debt validation letter and to dispute this erroneous information. However, a debt validation letter was not sent. In XXXX, I received a letter from Amsher Collections instructing me to call before XX/XX/XXXX if the account was not mine or if there was incorrect information being reported. I called on XX/XX/XXXX, disputed the account, and requested a debt validation letter, which should have been provided within thirty days of the debt being reported. 

I want to clarify a few points : 1. I paid the entire amount to XXXX when I closed my account in XXXX. 
2. I never owed {$2200.00} at the time of closure ; the remaining balance was paid in full to XXXX XXXX XXXX, and they unlocked my IMEI number to be able to move carrier. If the account had not been paid fully they would not have unlocked my IMEI number 3. On XX/XX/XXXX, Amsher Collections acknowledged inconsistencies during our conversation and stated that they would dispute the account, yet it has not been removed. 

When I saw an updated report on XX/XX/XXXX, I called Amsher again. This time, a representative informed me that they were no longer handling the account and instructed me to contact a law firm. However, the credit bureaus still reported Amsher as the collections agency for the debt. 

Here are the major issues I am facing : - The debt amount is incorrect ; I paid off the entire balance before closing my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
- The debt continues to be reported as a collections account on all three of my credit bureau reports. 
- I called Amsher four times to dispute the debt and request a debt validation letter, but neither has been provided. 
- On XX/XX/XXXX, an Amsher representative acknowledged inconsistencies with the account and assured me it would be removed. 
- On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Amsher again and was told that they no longer handle the account and that a law firm is now responsible for it. This was surprising because no one had informed me of this during my previous calls, and no debt validation letter had been provided to confirm that the amount and debt were mine. 
- When I called the law firm using the number given by the agent, it turned out to be a non-working number.

In XX/XX/year>, one of our locations experienced an internet outage for several days, which affected our ability to process card payments through our POS systems. I OPENED AND PAID FOR A ONE-TIME PREPAID ACCOUNT FOR A XXXX XXXX XXXX. This allowed us to resume accepting card payments after the outage. I believe this charge of {$220.00} is related to the prepaid account I opened in XXXX. I have documentation showing payment to XXXX on that day for {$370.00}. Greater than the amount XXXX claims I own. 
I am planning to apply for a mortgage within the next two years, and I am concerned that the collection on my record may affect my eligibility. It is imperative that I obtain the mortgage as I have a land contract for the house, I currently live in. Failure to secure the mortgage within the specified time frame may result in legal action against me for the full amount of the house and potentially me and my family losing our home. 
I believe this issue does not accurately reflect my creditworthiness or my commitment to fulfilling my financial obligations. I believe I am not liable for the debt claimed by XXXX, as it was a one-time prepaid account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a long-time US Bank customer . Over the summer, my debit card was compromised, and US Bank issued a replacement card, which I activated in XXXX XXXX. Since then, I have been unable to add this card to XXXX XXXX through any available channels. After a month of back-and-forth with the Fraud Department and Customer Service , no one could explain the issue. On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a case with US Bank to investigate what I initially thought was a glitch. The response I received informed me of a 90-day wait policy on new debit card holders, despite having received new debit cards in the past without this restriction. 

Seeking clarity, I escalated my case through multiple channels, including the local branch manager and customer support, but have received no response or further clarification. I have been dealing with this issue for over two months now and it still has not been resolved. I feel they are stringing me along until that 90 day wait is over. The last email communication on this case was back on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  advising my concern would be escalated to a manager. I have received zero response since then, leading me to feel as though I am being ghosted. This lack of transparency and communication has left me with unresolved security concerns about my account. US Bank claims this limitation is working as designed, but no one at the bankwhether customer service, the fraud department, my local branch, managers, or online publication resourcesseems to be aware of this policy. 

I also reached out to the XXXX community, other US Bank customers confirmed they had no issues adding new debit cards to XXXX XXXX  on new or old accounts, which makes me question why I am being singled out when Im simply trying to protect my account with an additional layer of security. This policy not only limits my options but feels counterproductive to the very goal of security US Bank promotes. With no further responses from the escalation team or my branch manager, I am left with no other option than to escalate through this channel for assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have tried several times to register the card on the website without luck and because of limited time just gave up. I but tried again on XX/XX/year> at about XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, via the website XXXX, and it told me to contact the number on the back of the card, XXXX. It is a prepaid visa for {$100.00} with a picture of a gold bow on it that I received as a gift that has never been used. 

I got through to an XXXX and provided the XXXX digit number and CVV number and the XXXX XXXX numbers of the barcode. I was told that I needed to go back to the website to register the card because it was not registered. I said that is why I was calling, because I had tried to register it on the website and had not been able to. We attempted the process again, with no luck. So the XXXX said I needed to call back, select the number XXXX when prompted and I would be able to register the card using the phone. I told the agent that when you call the number you are not prompted with options, you just input the XXXX digit card number and are connected directly to a XXXX, with no options to select from a menu. She just kept repeating the instructions, cutting me off each time I tried to explain that it would not work and to get clarification. It was going nowhere, so I said I would call back. 

I called back, and as I had experienced previously, it did not let me select from a menu and I was not able to select " XXXX '' to register the card. I was prompted to enter the XXXX digit card number and I was connected to a XXXX, who was the same as the previous one I had spoken to. We went through the same process, but this time, she said that the card no longer had any funds left on it, as opposed to it having never been registered. I said I had not used it. She repeated herself. I asked her if she could tell me what the transactions were that had been made on the card and she said she could, but then she said that it was not that there were transactions on the card, it was that the card was never loaded. So I asked if she could provided something in writing showing that the card was never loaded and she said she was not able to provide anything. I asked if there was a supervisor or someone else who had the capability to provide something in writing showing that the card had never been loaded. She said there was no one. And I said that they should be able to provide something, because if she could determine that from what ever she was looking at, they should be able to provide a copy of that to me and that the person who bought the card would be out {$100.00}. and would not be able to get their money back without any documentation that the card was never loaded. She then said that I needed to provide them the documentation from the person who purchased the card. During this time, the XXXX kept interrupting me and not letting me finish, but just kept repeating the same thing over and over saying it was never loaded. I was saying that I heard her, but that I would like something in writing because first she said it was not registered, then she said it had been spent, and now she said it had been loaded. I have no reason to believe that the person who gifted me this would not have loaded it. I asked how to submit something in writing and she said there was a way on the website but when I asked for a reference number for the call she said there was not XXXX and when I asked for a CSR # for her, she said there was not XXXX. I was going to submit something to the address on their website, but I did a quick check online and saw that there were a lot of posts about them being a scam and lots of issues with the cards.

Company: Eastern Account Systems of Connecticut, Inc.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Overcharged for something you did purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is a continuation of a closed investigation previously filed with the CFPB - XXXX XXXX. In that complaint I stated that I was scammed by an online lawyer service on a site named XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I tried to get legal advice for a concern I had, for a {$5.00} fee I was told it would be, for a XXXX week trial period. The answer was bogus, unhelpful, and I complained to a representative on their site both over the phone and in writing the very same day. I was offered the opportunity to have my question addressed to another online attorney, which I declined and I immediately declined the remainder of the week long trial. I was charged {$69.00}, for a full month membership, which I did not know anything about. Despite several resolution attempts on my part with them, they refused. I contacted the credit card company, Macy 's Amex, and, to this day, they have not offered a resolution, despite several hours of attempts on the phone, in online chats and requests for them to put something in writing about the {$69.00} charge I was disputing. 

Moving forward, this is still the case. As a matter of fact, I feel my rights have been violated. To my surprise, this year a number of charges totaling close to {$200.00} were made to my Amex card. When I go online, all I see are my Macy 's charges, not the ones made outside of this. Somehow, one day I managed to get access to this, surprised to find out that someone else was using my card on a fairly regular basis this year to pay off things that appear to be video games related. The woman I spoke to was very helpful and stayed on the phone with me for nearly 2 hours, going back as far as XX/XX/XXXX to see how long these charges were going on for, helping me get back over {$180.00} for 5 individual ongoing XXXX XXXX charges. She addressed the unresolved {$69.00} fraud dispute that was listed as such, for a year and a half. She attempted to put this complaint through again, since it was still left open. I attempted a total of 3 times again this year to get a response, only to be told that it appears this dispute is still " pending ''. 

Since then, a new card was issued to me and I was instructed to keep making payments to the account ending in XXXX. I told them that I would pay for everything, barring the {$69.00} in question, and I was told that I couldn't do that, that Macy 's require ongoing payments, and even if I pay it all off, I would still be reimbursed the disputed charge. The account for XXXX has officially been paid off. Now i have a new account ending in XXXX. It does not appear to tie into the previous account, because I have had nothing but issues since receiving the new card. I had to call to activate the card because online this card was saying that it was invalid and that I had to call in to activate it. Macy 's Star Rewards and coupons that I had on my Macy 's wallet on the account XXXX did not transfer over to the XXXX account without my calling a representative. I signed up for payment due notifications, which I no longer was receiving with the new card and I am incurring late fees of {$29.00} regularly, with no warning. I have a history of either paying off my balance in full, or making larger payments than the amount due amounts, so I was shocked to find that Macy 's has frozen my card because I was late making a {$29.00} payment that was due last week for a balance due of about {$250.00}. In the past, over the years, I would either have gotten a call or, at the very least, a mailing, letting me know a payment was due. This is no longer the case. And if I hadn't been attempting to make a {$40.00} online purchase, I would not have known that my account was frozen and I was told to call in. It was then that I was told by a representative, at XXXXXXXX XXXX this morning on XX/XX/XXXX, that my account will remain frozen until I make a payment. 

Presently, as of XX/XX/XXXX, I still do not have access to view my XXXX statement to see what charges, outside of Macy 's online purchases, have been made. The woman would not provide me with information on anything else and reluctantly let me know that at least one late fee was applied to my account. She said if I made a payment now, she would see if she could " grant '' me a " courtesy removal '' of " one '' {$29.00} late fee. She could not answer why I am no longer getting payment due notification alerts, that I signed up for several times. 

I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX that informed me the investigation on my Macy 's American Express card was completed and that the disputed charge was removed. Of course, because I am unable to access my account in full online, I can not see if the resolved dispute charge was the {$69.00} because the letter omits that information. 

I need assistance in getting this {$69.00} disputed charge resolved. I want to report my card being frozen for a missed payment. I want to report that I am not getting payment reminder alerts that I have signed up for online and that I am repeatedly being charged {$29.00} late fees that I have been unknowingly paying. I want an investigation done on the credit card policy that Macy 's has that I am required to make monthly payments on my account- even for the disputed charge amounts. Since trying to resolve this dispute from XX/XX/XXXX with Macy 's Amex, I've done everything the way CFPB advised. I've called to speak with supervisors, put my complaint in writing, followed up repeatedly, and continued paying balances in full without resolution. I do not know what to do next. Please advise.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

On XX/XX/year> I wrote to Barclays Bank Delaware via USPS Certified Mail, " requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( section XXXX ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( section XXXX ). XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX regulations require all debt collectors to send specific written documentation validating the debt. Under section 2-190 of the Rules of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  , validation requires all of the following : Proof of my agreement to pay the original creditor ; A copy of the final account statement issued by the original creditor ; A breakdown of the total amount due, showing principal, interest, and other charges ; and For all other charges, the date of and basis for each charge. '' Barclays Bank Delaware received my letter and signed for it at XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/year>XXXX  ( see USPS Tracking printout attached ) and 30 days later, I received no reply. 

On XX/XX/year>XXXX  I wrote to Barclays Bank Delaware for the 2nd time via USPS Certified Mail, informing them of their failure to place a notice of dispute on my account within 30 days as required by federal law, citing the FCRA and FDCPA laws and even enclosing a printout of623 - 15 U.S.C 1681s-2 clearly defining a data furnishers duty to provide notice of dispute within 30 days. 

I received a reply from Barclays Bank Delaware on or around XX/XX/year>, stating that this " account was ... sold to XXXX  ... as such... are reporting this account as " charged-off sold '' ... please contact XXXX  '', totally ignoring their violation of Federal law which compels them as a data furnisher to add a notice of dispute within the timeframe required by law. This appears to be gross negligence and disregard for the law and for affected consumers like myself nationwide. If they are unwilling to cooperate, hopefully the CFPB and US Attorney General can induce a correction of their behavior.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Id like to file a complaint against Barclays ( GAP ) Mastercard for looking out for their companys best interest instead of myself ( the consumer ). 


I ordered seven clothing items from Old Navy on XX/XX/XXXX ( order # XXXX ) for a total of {$110.00}. My order was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX with five out of the seven items missing. My package was taped shut like it had been tampered with and someone haphazardlywrapped the package in shipping tape. There was also an internal XXXX  XXXX ( shipping ) HUB sticker inside my resealed package showing someone had been in my package between the ( GAP ) warehouse and myself. 
After speaking with customer service reps on XX/XX/XXXX and having my missing items claim denied, a GAP representative told me my only course of action was to dispute the charge with my credit card company but otherwise the case is closed and I'm out {$76.00}. They had no interest in the pictures I took of my package. A customer service rep alluded to me that since I have a GAP card, and GAP will do the 'internal " investigation with my disputed charge, I don't stand a chance at a refund. This is a conflict of interest. I filed with the BBB and the case was eventually closed without a resolution. I insisted this was a shipping issue, not a credit issue. 
It was reiterated to me continuously from customer service reps from GAP that they can not and will not offer a refund ; I can only dispute the charge. 

Enter Barclays : - I talked with GAP Barclays credit card customer service on XX/XX/XXXX to initially dispute the charge @ XXXX. I talked to XXXX to review the missing items. 
- I returned a missed call & message on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX and spoke to both XXXX & XXXX to again review the missing items. 
- I returned a missed call & message on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX and spoke to XXXX. XXXX alerted me I would receive a credit for my missing order in the amount of {$59.00}. I told her that was not the full amount and she insisted it was only a partial refund but I would receive the entire {$76.00} back. 
- I missed a call on XX/XX/XXXX but no message or number was left. 

Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter in the mail from Barclays GAP Mastercard stating my case has been closed and was decided against me in part because of no communication on my part. This is untrue. I have phone logs of myself calling and talking to their representatives. They also notified me they would be taking back the {$59.00} they credited me on XX/XX/XXXX. 
The proof Old Navy/GAP provided were tiny screenshot printouts of my account charges, a fragmented sentence stating based on weight all items were included, and a tracking number showing the package was delivered. They absolutely closed the claim without sufficient evidence since my claim was for missing items. 
- I spoke to XXXX from Barclays today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) who confirmed the case was closed and I can only mail or fax a letter to ask for my case to reopened. I have XXXX interest in continuing the charade that this will be taken care of appropriately. 

It certainly questions the relationship between Barclays GAP ( store ) credit card and a GAP owned company. Especially after the customer service rep mentioned/threatened this would happen. How exactly did they find in their own favor with scant evidence? I was not and am not protected in any of these situations. GAP knew by pushing me to dispute the charge, there was no way they would be found at fault when theyre investigating themselves. They unilaterally decided my case wasnt valid without any recourse. 

Its an extreme conflict of interest when they decided themselves that they didnt do anything wrong.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Collection agency name : Address : Account number : Your NAME : Your address : Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

They had multiple repair attempts by themselves and sent the car to a mechanic on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. All of their repair attempts have been on unsuccessful. Ive requested the invoices for the work they said they did while the car was at the mechanic and both the mechanic and the dealership has been given my husband and I the runarounds. Mechanic claims he does not have a copy the dealer has it, the dealer said they gave it to us, by the last thing we were told was the guy who had it was on vacation. 

On the day of purchase my husband and I originally came in for a different car, which was a gray XXXX XXXX. They convinced us to get the XXXX XXXX when they learned that my husband drives manual, and lied about the durability of the car. After settling on a price and everyone agreeing with the numbers with my husband and father present, they let my husband leave with the car before any papers were signed. Since my husband had to leave for work he couldnt stay and I dont drive manual, so if he couldnt take it, wed have to come back another day. After my husband left the XXXX introduced me to the lady in their XXXX department, when I got in her office, it was just us XXXX, she offered me XXXX loan option, XXXX with the numbers that my husband and I already agreed on, and the second option was with an extended warranty for approximately {$4000.00} added. I told her no because Ive had extended warranties on previous purchases and they always expired when I needed it, I was perfectly fine with the XXXX month warranty they told my husband and I was included with our purchase. Unhappy with my decision, the finance lady left the room in frustration and went to get the XXXX to try to convince me, I called my husband and he agreed we didnt need to get additional warranty, so I said no, the XXXX then took back the XXXX months warranty that he initially told my husband and I was included, and suggested I needed the extended warranty that came with the second loan option. When the XXXX people that were already in the room could not convince me, the owner of the dealership came in and printed out papers showing me peoples experience on the cost of auto repair, he even offered to pay me back the money for the warranty if I didnt use it, I still refused. When the XXXX of them saw that I only wanted to loan agreement with the numbers my husband and I already agreed on, they told that I wasnt an option anymore, they said I had to sign the second loan option as my husband already left with the car, and that would be considered theft. After purchasing the car XXXX days later the check-engine light went on, we told them and immediately they started suggesting I pay for it with my extended warranty, and it because clear to me why I was pressured to get it. The owner later said that told me that XXXX are well known to breakdown and thats why he made me get the warranty, which is a lie. 

Lastly, the finance lady had me sign the papers, then informed me that she included reported and additional income of XXXX a month on my loan application, income I did not report because its nonexistent. Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint 1 : MERS Inactivity and Demand for Validation Complaint Overview This complaint addresses M & T Bank 's inactive status in the Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems ( MERS ) despite collecting payments for over XXXX years. This inactivity raises significant concerns regarding M & T Bank 's legal standing and authority to collect payments, and it follows issues outlined in prior demand letters dated XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Details of Complaint XXXX. Lack of Standing and XXXX XXXX M & T Bank 's inactive status in MERS violates transparency requirements under federal statutes, including TILA ( Truth in Lending Act ), RESPA ( Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ), FDCPA ( Federal Debt Collection Practices Act ), and FCRA ( Federal Credit Reporting Act ). This lack of transparency clouds the title and deprives me of my right to know the legal holder of the mortgage and promissory note. 
2. Request for MERS Milestone Report I am requesting a full MERS Milestone ( MAL ) report under the Qualified Written Request ( QWR ) provision, detailing all transfers of the mortgage and promissory note to validate M & T Bank 's authority as the servicer and establish its legal standing.

3. Ongoing Financial Burden The financial impact of these actions is substantial, with payments expected to continue through XXXX. Payments to an unverified servicer have caused financial hardship and distress, affecting trust resources and stability. Due to M & T Bank 's inactivity in MERS and lack of required settlement disclosure, I have incurred financial losses, including increased payments and higher interest rates. 
4. Emotional Distress Calculation To quantify emotional distress, I assign a daily rate of {$100.00}, beginning from the onset of hardship on XX/XX/XXXX, amounting to approximately XXXX days to date : Calculation : {$100.00} ( daily rate ) x XXXX ( days ) = {$100000.00}. 
This reflects the emotional and ongoing distress directly resulting from M & T Bank 's actions and inactions. 
5. Unjust Enrichment and Bad Faith Since the closing date of XX/XX/XXXX, I have tendered payments in good faith, expecting proper handling and documentation. M & T Banks failure to provide essential documentation jeopardizes my financial standing and suggests unjust enrichment and potential bad faith. The ongoing collection without validated legal standing benefits M & T Bank unjustly at my expense. 

Resolution Requested I request immediate restitution based on the following monthly calculation of {$940.00}, totaling approximately {$45000.00} over XXXX years : XXXX Total : {$11000.00} XXXX Total : {$11000.00} XXXX Total : {$11000.00} XXXX Total : {$11000.00} Additionally, I request XXXX XXXX M & T Bank 's standing through a MERS Milestone report, relief from future obligations under this loan due to violations and lack of transparency, and emotional distress compensation totaling approximately {$100000.00}. 



Complaint XXXX : Settlement Disclosure Provided After Closing Complaint Overview This complaint concerns M & T Banks failure to provide a required settlement disclosure until after closing, in violation of my rights under TILA, RESPA, and FDCPA. Despite this documents omission by the original lender XXXX M & T Bank, as the current servicer, is responsible for providing it under the Qualified Written Request ( QWR ) provision. I am formally requesting complete copies of all closing documents related to my propertys mortgage on XX/XX/XXXX, as required. 
Details of Complaint XXXX. Violation of XXXX XXXX M & T Banks failure to provide a timely settlement disclosure impacts my right to understand loan terms, informed consent, and protection from unauthorized collection practices. As the mortgage servicer, M & T Bank must ensure I receive the necessary settlement closing document under my QWR. 
XXXX. Financial and Emotional Damages The absence of this disclosure has caused substantial financial losses, credit denials, increased loan and insurance rates, and compounded financial obligations. Additionally, these actions have led to significant emotional distress, affecting trust resources, peace of mind, and well-being as I navigate these unresolved issues. 
XXXX. Unjust XXXX and XXXX XXXX M & T Banks failure to provide required disclosures and continued collection of payments since closing suggests bad faith and unjust enrichment. Despite acting in good faith by making payments, M & T Banks failure to disclose has benefited them at my expense. 
Resolution Requested I request immediate compensation of approximately {$25000.00}, calculated as follows : Emotional Distress Compensation : An estimated {$10000.00} for prolonged distress due to credit denials, financial strain, and collection activities resulting from M & T Banks failure to provide proper documentation. 
Financial Losses : Approximately {$8000.00} due to increased interest rates on credit and higher insurance premiums stemming from credit damage due to inaccurate reporting. 
Additionally, I request a setoff to balance the ledger due to overpayments under incorrect servicing terms and M & T Bank 's failure to validate debt ownership, including : Setoff Amount : The setoff amount includes approximately {$110000.00}, reflecting the initial mortgage balance from XX/XX/XXXX, and {$25000.00} for a partial claim mortgage established on XX/XX/XXXX, which lacks my authorization. This total setoff reflects unauthorized debt obligations and unvalidated collection practices. 


Final Statement for Both Complaints As Trustee of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I have consistently made payments and issued formal demand letters on XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. While these issues remain unresolved, this complaint seeks immediate restitution, compensation, and exoneration of this loan due to cumulative statutory violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In a recent investigation into banking policies, I discovered that, according to the deposit agreements of major financial institutions such as XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, an account may be closed if it remains inactive or maintains a XXXX balance. Even when an account has a balance, minimal engagement in activitiessuch as online transfers or depositsover an extended period may lead the bank to classify the account as dormant, resulting in its closure. 

I am currently experiencing a similar issue with my BMO savings account, which is set to be closed due to my inadvertent maintenance of a XXXX balance for over 30 days. I have contacted both customer service and the nearest branch in an attempt to prevent this action ; however, I was informed that there are no measures that can be undertaken to stop the closure. This assertion is perplexing, as I believe that most processes can be implemented or reversed. 

Additionally, it is noteworthy that the procedure for closing an account predominantly involves human intervention, suggesting that it may be possible to halt this process. I find it concerning that a financial institution, which has recently commenced operations in California and is rapidly expanding its customer base, is facing such challenges. My situation is not a result of negligence ; I attempted to transfer funds into the account only to discover that it had been removed from my online banking interface. Upon inquiring about this, I learned it is in the process of being closed, with no options for recourse. 

I respectfully urge that my account closure be reconsidered. It is of utmost importance to me that I do not incur additional negative marks on my XXXX or XXXX XXXX  records while seeking to establish a new account. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

I have no idea what the cycle is on these new accounts. ( e.g. the XXXX to the XXXX, XXXX to XXXX, other ). Further, it requires me to go into a branch, which is only open about the same time as I work, to pay the {$5.00} because I no longer have ATM access. As I am often spread thin on time between the job, XXXX family members for whom I am the sole caretaker and trying to maintain some kind of life, time gets away from me, I forget and then there's another {$5.00} deficit in that account. 

I didn't agree to this change. I wasn't notified of this change. I've received no statements for these accounts. I have no access to these accounts other than in a branch. 

I fully expect that the response to this complaint will be similar to the previous response - " Because we can '' - but felt it important to post here at CFPB in case others are researching issues with Wells Fargo.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Debt Validation Request Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1692g Re : Account Number XXXX Dear TrueAccord Corp, This letter serves as a formal request for validation of the above-referenced account, as permitted under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ). I respectfully request that you provide documentation to substantiate this debt and confirm the legal right to collect on it. Specifically, I request the following : Verification of Debt : Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I request a detailed account statement validating the nature of the alleged debt, including the original creditors name and any substantiating documents, statements, or other records that confirm the balance claimed. Please also provide the assignment contract between TrueAccord Corp and the original creditor that permits you to collect on this account. 

2. Proof of Reporting Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I request that you provide detailed evidence showing the accuracy of the information reported to the credit bureaus. I am also requesting that this account be removed from my credit report should your investigation find any discrepancies or a lack of substantial proof for this debt. Under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ), the credit reporting agency and information furnisher bear a responsibility for ensuring the accuracy of reported information. 

3. Responsibility of Furnishers of Information to Credit Reporting Agencies ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) : This code mandates that information furnishers report accurate information. In line with these obligations, I request an itemized and accurate history of the reported account, including all payment history, fees, interest, and additional charges applied. As established in XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  ), inaccuracies that are not promptly corrected by the furnisher may be grounds for removal. 

4. Prompt Correction and Blocking of Incorrect Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : If TrueAccord can not validate the legitimacy of this debt with concrete evidence, I respectfully request the prompt deletion of this collection account from my credit report as per 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, which calls for the blocking of disputed or erroneous information. 
To ensure thorough validation, please include copies of the following documents : The original agreement/contract that initiated this debt, bearing my signature, as well as proof of assignment to your agency. 
Any and all documentation related to this debt, as required under the FDCPA and FCRA to validate ownership and the accuracy of information shared with the credit bureaus. 

Failure to validate this debt according to the standards required under the FDCPA, FCRA, and applicable case law should result in the cessation of reporting on my credit file. Should you continue reporting unverifiable information, I will pursue further steps to enforce my rights under federal consumer protection laws. 

Thank you for your cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within the 30-day period mandated by law. Please send all correspondence to the address listed above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Less than three hours later, I realized I had fallen victim to an individual who posed as a USAA fraud agent, resulting in a loss of {$4000.00}.

For over eight years, USAA has been a trusted financial partner for me and my family, honoring my grandfathers XXXX  in XXXX. Due to this scam, my account is now overdrawn by nearly {$1500.00}, putting me in a precarious financial position as a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX living on student loans and facing imminent graduation and marriage ( XX/XX/year> ). BMO CASE : XXXX I am trying to appeal my incorrectly denied fraud case and I have been reaching out to XXXX XXXX for over a month with no response from the claims department. 

Please see below for a detailed account of everything that happened and will need to be thoroughly reviewed. I have been calling daily and still haven't heard back. 

On XXXX XXXX while leaving the XXXX XXXX my debit card was stolen out of my luggage by either the concierge at my hotel or XXXX. I was unaware that it was stolen as I was on a flight ( have proof of me being on a flight ) and could not have been making charges in a country I was no longer in. Upon landing, I received a fraud notification FROM BMO stating that XXXX charges were going to be processed ( others were denied for fraud automatically, have proof of this ) XXXX charge was for {$3000.00} and another for {$86.00} had been made to the same fraud name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( I have screenshots of the fraud changes email from BMO ). I promptly called BMO to turn my card off immediately and filed my fraud case once the XXXX fraud charges were posted to my account. When initially on the phone with the BMO agent I said I didn't know if my card was stolen or my account hacked again as I had just gotten off a plane and didn't have my luggage yet. When I got to my luggage and checked, the card was indeed stolen. 

It should also be noted, that the debit card HAD NEVER BEEN used before, these fraud charges were the first and only charges made on the card. Again, these were also initially correctly flagged as fraud by BMO. 

Once the charges were posted I immediately called and filed a fraud case. I did not hear back about my case so on XX/XX/year> I emailed XXXX XXXX to get an update after filing my case. While I did get an automatic response, I have yet to receive an email from an actual person with information about reopening my case. 

While checking my account, I noticed the fraud charge for {$86.00} had been refunded, but for some reason, the larger charge for {$3000.00} had been denied. This is incorrect, I can prove I was on a plane at this time and did not make either of these charges. To try and get help on XX/XX/year> Spoke with XXXX from the BMO resolution team- she never called me back to update me on my case after she said she was following up. 

On XX/XX/year> Follow-up email to Rege.processing to which I received no automatic response, nor a response from an actual person. 

As XXXX XXXX was not responding to my emails on XX/XX/year> I went into a physical branch ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX ) and spoke with the XXXX XXXX XXXX, He emailed Rege.processing on my behalf with all of my evidence to which he received no response and still hasn't to this day.

It should be noted, I had NEVER received the denial prior to this day XX/XX/year>. XXXX, the branch manager said he did communicate this to BMO for my case. 

After finding out on XX/XX/year> I made a new call to BMO and spoke with XXXX with the resolutions team to try and get help. She has emailed Rege.processing on my behalf and opened a new XXXXase Call Reference # XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year> I sent a new email to XXXX XXXX for a response and looking to reopen my fraud case once again. 

Again, the fraud charge for {$86.00} was returned as it was correctly identified as fraud. I am asking BMO to please return the {$3000.00} fraud charge that was made by the same merchant at the same date/time to my account immediately.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Fraud Incident and Inadequate Response from USAA Bank To whom it may concern, I am reaching out to formally address an urgent matter involving a case of bank fraud and inadequate response from my bank, USAA. I have been a victim of fraudulent activity and, despite multiple attempts to resolve the issue with USAA, they have failed to safeguard my account or recover my lost funds. This negligence has led to significant financial loss and distress. 

Incident Summary On XX/XX/year>, I received a call from an individual posing as a USAA representative. This impostor informed me that there were red flags on my account, and funds had attempted to be withdrawn. They instructed me to visit a nearby physical bank, as USAA lacks a physical branch, to withdraw and deposit my funds into a new secure account they would create. Importantly, at no point did I share my PIN, password, or other account details, as they already had access to my account information. 

Preventive Measures Taken After this suspicious interaction, I contacted USAA immediately on the following day to confirm the legitimacy of this call. USAA verified that this was indeed an impostor and assured me they would red-flag my account. They advised me to change my PIN, username, and password, and I did so multiple times. I also followed their directive to unlink and deactivate any devices, as well as XXXX XXXX connections, to further protect my account. 

USAAs AssurancXXXX and Failed Security Promises On XX/XX/XXXX, a suspicious pending transaction appeared in my account, which I promptly reported to USAAs fraud department. Despite being reassured that my account was flagged and the transaction would be blocked, I later discovered that my entire balance was transferred out. I contacted USAA immediately, and they promised to prevent the transaction from completing. However, despite these reassurances, my funds were ultimately withdrawn without intervention. 

USAAs Failure to Take Responsibility When I called again on XX/XX/XXXX, a USAA representative informed me that they might hold me responsible for the loss, despite my following all their security instructions and diligently reporting each suspicious activity. USAA had ample opportunity to protect my account and prevent this loss, yet they failed to take timely action. I feel doubly victimized : first by the fraudsters and then by USAAs failure to secure my funds. 

Conclusion This entire experience has been distressing and financially damaging. I am seeking the BBBs assistance to hold USAA accountable for their negligence and to ensure my lost funds are restored. USAAs lack of action and delayed responses have severely impacted my trust, and I believe they must take responsibility for their oversight. 

Thank you for your time and consideration of this matter. I appreciate any assistance you can provide in ensuring that USAA upholds its commitment to protect its customers. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MO XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Consumer Complaint XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MO XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Account Closure by US Bank and Lack of Access to Funds I am writing to file a formal complaint against US Bank ( Bank Branch : [ Not known ) due to the unexpected closure of my account, which resulted in my inability to access the funds in my account. Despite numerous attempts to contact the bank, I have not received a clear explanation for the account closure nor have I been provided access to my funds. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that my account ( Account Number : XXXX ) had been closed by US Bank without prior notice. I was not informed of the reason for the closure, nor did I receive any written notification from the bank. This has caused significant financial inconvenience, as I have been unable to access my remaining balance or transfer the funds to another account. 

As a consumer, I am entitled to protection under both Missouri law and federal regulations regarding the closure of my account and access to my funds. Specifically, I believe the following laws are relevant to my case : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Closure Laws Under Missouri Revised Statutes 362.410, a bank has the right to close an account, but must do so in accordance with the terms of the account agreement. Generally, a bank is required to provide reasonable notice of account closure, particularly if the closure results in the account holder being unable to access their funds. Failure to notify a customer, as is the case in this instance, may be in violation of this law.

2. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) and Regulation E The Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ), 15 U.S.C. 1693 et seq., and Regulation E, 12 C.F.R. Part 1005, govern electronic fund transfers, including withdrawals, deposits, and other transactions involving consumer accounts. Under these laws, a financial institution must provide clear information about the closure of an account, as well as ensure that the consumer has access to their remaining funds. If an account is closed and there are funds remaining, the bank is required to facilitate the withdrawal or transfer of those funds promptly.

3. The Right to Access Your Funds Under Missouri law, when a consumer 's account is closed, they are still entitled to access the funds in the account. If the bank closes an account without providing proper notice, it must ensure that the account holder is able to retrieve their funds. This is especially important if the closure was not initiated due to fraud or a legitimate breach of contract.

4. Consumer Protection Under the D
odd-Frank Act The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010 established the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to protect consumers from unfair or deceptive practices by financial institutions. The failure to notify a customer about the closure of an account and withholding access to their funds could be viewed as an unfair practice under this law, which is subject to investigation by the CFPB or relevant state authorities. 

Request for Immediate Action In light of the laws outlined above, I respectfully request that the Missouri Division of Finance investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that US Bank complies with state and federal regulations regarding account closure and access to funds. Specifically, I request the following : A thorough investigation into the circumstances surrounding the closure of my account by US Bank.

A detailed explanation from US Bank regarding why my account was closed without prior notice, in violation of the terms of the account agreement and applicable laws.

Immediate access to my remaining balance, either by check or through a transfer to another account that I designate.

Written confirmation from US Bank outlining the steps being taken to resolve this issue. 
If this matter is not resolved in a timely and satisfactory manner, I will consider pursuing additional recourse through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other legal channels. 

Please contact me at XXXX or [ your email address ] for further information or if you require any additional documentation. I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and to receiving a resolution as soon as possible. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
